loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a loan to purchase cows and goats for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cows and goats for her business.

loans.name: Biliane

texts.en:
Biliane is aged 34. She is married with three children. She will use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during rice production; they need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labour costs during rice production.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for supporting her while she was constructing her personal house.

Mejumaa operates a fish selling business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more stock of dry fish for her business.

Mejumaa looks forward to the financial support with gladness and a thankful heart.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry fish for her business.

loans.name: Claudia Ines

texts.es:
La cría de cerdos es una actividad muy popular en la región de Montería, y se ha convertido en una de las principales fuentes de ingresos de la región.
La señora Claudia es una de las tantas mujeres que con su trabajo en la porcicultura permite que esta actividad se mantenga vigente y brinde oportunidades de trabajo a más personas.
Aunque es un trabajo con mucha competencia ella ha tratado de sostenerlo a costa de todo.
Así las cosas, desea un préstamo para comprar un lote de cerdos de levante para aumentar su producción y mantenerse a flote en este mercado tan concurrido, dándose la oportunidad de formar un capital y una unidad de trabajo autosostenible en el tiempo.
Su mayor sueño es poder ofrecer empleo a varias personas de la región para que tengan la ilusión de salir adelante dignamente.
texts.en:
Raising pigs is a very popular activity in the Montería region, and has become one of the main sources of income for the region. Claudia is one of many women that with their work in this trade, allows them to actively sustain themselves and provide work opportunities to more people.
Although it is a job with a lot of competition, she has tried to hold her ground at all costs.
Therefore she would like a loan to buy a lot of pigs to grow her production and keep herself afloat in this very crowded market, giving her the opportunity to form capital and a self-sustaining unit of work over time.
Her great dream is to be able to offer employment to various people in the region so that they have the vision of getting ahead in life with dignity.

loans.use: to buy a lot of pigs to boost her business.

loans.name: Cecilia Guadalupe

texts.es: Cecilia de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, sus dos hijos y su esposo, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada por esa razón posee mucha clientela, por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Cecilia está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos como: granos básicos, aceite, golosinas, detergentes, refrescos, sopas, etc. y asi surtir mas su tienda y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 34, lives in a house she owns, together with her mother, two children and her husband. She runs a store at home, which is located in a busy area, so she has many customers. She also offers a wide variety of products and very good prices. With what she earns and with the help of her husband, she can cover the home expenses.

Cecilia is requesting a loan to buy more products such as grains, oil, candies, detergents, beverages and soups. With more products to offer, she will improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy grains, oil, candies, detergents, beverages, soups, etc.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 20 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She has one child. For the past 3 years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her small fish business, where she sells fresh fish. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh fish and cooking oil to sell, and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and take care of her family's basic needs. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a retail shop. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 16 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 6 months, Rebecca has been working hard to manage her food stall, where she sells fresh food and vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Rebecca has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more tomatoes, raw bananas, sweet potatoes and dry fish, and will help Rebecca to generate greater profits and improve on her family's standards of living. Rebecca hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a grocery business. 

Rebecca is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, raw bananas, sweet potatoes and dry fish.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: El señor Martin es de la ciudad de Potosí, tuvo una instrucción hasta el nivel primario la falta de recursos económicos de sus padres no le ayudaron a seguir superándose, desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar, pero como no encontraba trabajo en su pueblo tuvo que irse y buscar otras oportunidades para salir adelante, fue así que llego al trópico de Cochabamba, donde actualmente vive, empezó a trabajar de peón en las cosecha de arroz, plátano, piña y otros productos de la región, con su esfuerzo se compró su propio lote urbano en el cual tiene una casita muy pequeña, hoy en día es portero de una escuela ,está encargado del cuidado, limpieza y tiene una pequeña tienda de dulces y otros comestibles, de esta forma genera ingresos para mantener a su familia que son su concubina y dos hijos, su casa no cuenta con los servicio básicos es por eso que solicita un crédito para terminar la construcción de su vivienda y contar con todo lo necesario para brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Martin is from the city of Potosí. He only went to primary school. For lack of economic resources, his parents could not help him to continue his studies and since he was very small he has had to work. He did not find work in his neighborhood though, so he went to find other opportunities to get ahead. This is how he came to the tropical region of Cochabamba where he currently lives.

He started to work as a laborer for the harvest of rice, bananas, pineapples, and other products of this region. His efforts enabled him to buy his own plot in the town where he has his own very small house. Today,  he works as the janitor of a school. He is responsible for the care and cleaning and has a small shop with sweets and other snacks. By this he earns the money for his family: his common-law partner and two children.

At the moment, his house does not have the basic amenities. Therefore he is asking for a loan to be able to finish the construction of his house and to get everything he needs to offer his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to finish the construction of his house.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: La señora Flora es una persona humilde, responsable y trabajadora vive en la provincia de Quillacollo actualmente tiene una humilde casa que fue herencia de  sus padres, tiene 51 años de edad,  es separada legalmente ya que tuvo problemas con su anterior esposo, se dedica a la lechería desde hace más de treinta y un años y también a la agricultura donde siembra alfalfa para el consumo de su ganado bovino lechero, la señora es una persona respetada y ejemplar ya que está sacando adelante a sus dos hijos. Ahora necesita un crédito para la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado bovino lechero, con esto quiere acumular este insumo para la actividad de la lechería y así abastecerse para contar con el mismo cuando suba de precio en temporada de invierno, con ello no bajara sus ingresos y lograra mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Flor is a humble, responsible and hard-working person who lives in the province of Quillacollo. She has a humble house which she inherited from her parents. She is 51 years old. She is divorced because she had problems with her husband.

She has worked in milk production for more than 31 years and also in farming – her crop is alfalfa for the consumption of her dairy cattle. Flor is a respected and exemplary person because she gets her two children ahead.

She now needs a loan to buy fodder for her dairy cattle. She wants to store the fodder, which she needs for the milk production, and by this to have it on stock for use in the winter, when the prices are high. So she will have a higher profit and achieve a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder for her dairy cattle.

loans.name: Noline

texts.en:
Noline is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Noline has been working hard to manage her food stall, where she sells raw food. 

To help expand her business, Noline has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more raw foods to sell, and will help Noline to generate greater profits and take care of herself. Noline hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business by adding different items for sale since she inherited her stall from her mother. 

Noline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more raw foods to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a profitable place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as self-oriented. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in an area with potential. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough resources. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a viable place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells eggs, sugar, bread, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, sugar, flour and other items. Her business goal is to own a big supermarket within 5 years. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her business.

loans.use: buy more stock of bread, sugar, flour and other items.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Julián de 66  años de edad vive junto a su familia en casa propia, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz, maicillo y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, cuando su cosecha y esta lista la comercializa en los diferentes mercados, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; Julián  necesita invertir por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicida, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía, él tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Julian, 66, lives with his family in his own house.  He has been working in agriculture for several years and grows corn, sorghum and beans.  This has given him much experience and allowed him to obtain the best produce which he sells at different markets at harvest time.  He has many customers who like the quality of his products, the low prices and, above all else, the good service.

Julian needs a loan to buy seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, composts, weed-killer, etc. and to improve the land shown in the photograph.  He has good references from the people who know him.  He is very responsible and assures us that he will pay back the loan on time.  He also believes he can provide his household with economic security.

loans.use: To buy seeds, insecticide, fertilizers, composts, weed-killers, etc. and to improve his land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more jackets.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer es soltero y vive en Chincha en la casa de su hermana. 
Desde hace casi 1 año trabaja como Operario en un Fundo en la zona donde reside. Con el sueldo obtenido apoya a su hermana y otra parte ahorra porque quiere construir su casita más adelante.
Es una persona ejemplar, muy amable, luchadora y responsable, que busca salir adelante trabajando honradamente, para tener una mejor calidad de vida y un futuro mejor.
Wilmer está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que con el apoyo brindado él podrá empezar a construir su vivienda y des esta manera cumplirá su más grande sueño: “Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Wilmer is single and lives at his sister’s, in Chincha. He has been working for almost a year in a farm close to where he lives. With the money he earns he helps his sister and saves because he wants to build his own house in the future.

He is an exemplary person. He is kind, hardworking and responsible and tries to get ahead in an honest way in order to have better living conditions and a brighter future.

Wilmer appreciates the support that Kiva lenders have given him. He will be able to start building his house and make his biggest dream come true: to have his own house.

loans.use: to build his house.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 32-year-old married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of customers. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to excel within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Micro finance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Wilkista

texts.en:
Wilkista is a 27-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a retail business where she sells eggs. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a vibrant place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of eggs. Her business goal is to own a bakery within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Micro finance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of tea leaves.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a hardworking and enterprising woman who greatly thanks Kiva lenders for their financial support. Besides the charcoal-selling business, Beth operates a poultry-selling business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more poultry and chicken feed for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry and chicken feed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more shoes and sacks.

loans.name: Margoth Germania

texts.es: Germania es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 13 años de edad que asiste al colegio, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, Germania va a emprender este negocio con el crédito que le otorgue fodemi, comenta que es una vecina quien le enseño que la crianza de chanchos es una buena actividad, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para criarlos en las chancheras que les presta una amiga, Germania espera que le vaya muy bien en este negocio y que esto le permita pagar los gastos de arriendo de la casa, de alimentación y educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Germania is a single mother. She has a 13-year-old son who goes to school. She works in raising small animals. 

Germania wants to start this business with the loan she gets from Fodemi. She says that a neighbor taught her that raising pigs is a good activity. She wants to invest the loan in the purchase of pigs to raise them in the pigsties which a friend will provide her with.

Germany expects that her business will turn out well and that it will enable her to pay the expenses for her household – for food and the education of her son.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more auto parts for motorbikes and cars to expand her sales.

loans.name: Martha Janeth

texts.es: Martha se dedica 3 años a su negocio de tienda general, ella está divorciada de su esposo y tiene un hijo de 13 años que asiste al colegio, ella vive con su hijo en la casa de su madre a la que le paga arriendo para vivir y para tener su negocio, Martha, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para ofrecerlos en su tienda, lo que Martha aspira es mejorar su negocio, surtir más productos y seguir trabajando por su hijo.
texts.en:
Martha has had a general store for three years. She is divorced and has a thirteen-year-old son who goes to school. They live at her mother’s. She pays her some money in order to live and work there.

Martha will use the loan to buy products for her store. Her goal is to improve her business, offer a wider variety and continue to work for her son’s best.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cell phones and memory cards to stock her shop and sell.

loans.name: Vilma Epifania

texts.es: Vilma de 51 años de edad, vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, desde hace varios años que Vilma se dedica al oficio de corte y confección, tiempo en el cual ha ido adquiriendo mucha experiencia como también clientes fijos. Ella es una persona muy responsable, quien trabaja con mucho esmero por dar lo mejor de sí. Vilma solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL por medio del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de materia prima como: telas, botones, hilos, agujas, etc.  para poder atender mejor a sus clientes y no perder la oportunidad de obtener ganancias extras y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Vilma, 51, lives with her family in her own house.  For several years she has been working as a seamstress which has afforded her much experience and fixed customers.  She is a very responsible person who works hard to give the best of herself.  

Vilma is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to invest in her business, buying a larger quantity of raw materials such as fabrics, buttons, threads, needles, etc., so she can attend to her customers better and not miss out on the opportunity to earn extra profit and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, buttons, threads, needles, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Hermelinda Isabel

texts.es: Hermelinda tiene 42 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto  a su esposo y sus tres hijos. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace mucho tiempo. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Ella ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pila dado que no cuanta con un lugar adecuado para almacenar el agua. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena y ladrillo.
texts.en:
Hermelinda, 42, lives in her own house with her husband and their three children.  She makes and sells tortillas and has been in business for quite some time, earning a living this way to support the household.  

Hermelinda decided to request a loan through FUSAI to build a basin since she has nowhere to store water.  She will use the loan to buy cement, sand and bricks.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and bricks to build a basin.

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es: Rosa de 43 años de edad se dedica a la venta de comida, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por que vende los platos con comida a buen precio, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar.  Rosa está solicitando un crédito para poder mejorar su vivienda ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, por esa razón solicita dicho crédito para comprar los materiales necesarios como cemento, arena, ladrillos, hierro y pago de mano de obra y así poder construir lso cuartos que necesita para que ella y su familia puedan vivir cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
Rosa, 43, sells food from home where her business is set up.  She has many fixed customers because of her good prices and is able to earn enough from sales to cover household expenses.  She lives with her family in her own house.

Rosa is requesting a loan to renovate her house since she does not earn enough to cover the cost.  The loan she is requesting is to buy the materials necessary such as cement, sand, bricks and iron, and to hire workers to build enough rooms for the family to be comfortable.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, bricks, and iron, and to hire workers.

loans.name: Las Gardenias Group

texts.es: “LAS GARDENIAS” es un grupo conformada por mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras por mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Ernestina tiene 38 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos educando. Ella hace 05 años se dedica a la venta de desayuno y almuerzo en forma ambulatorio. Años atrás se dedicaba a prestar servicios de domestica. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de una cocina nueva. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Ernestina es la primero persona parada del lado derecho.
texts.en:
“LAS GARDENIAS” is a group made up of hard-working, enterprising women with the aim of improving their families' quality of life. Ernestina is 38 years old and has a partner and two children, who are in education. For five years, she has made a living selling breakfasts and lunches on a mobile basis. Years ago she made a living providing domestic services.

She will invest the loan in buying a new oven. The group is grateful to KIVA lenders for the loan given. Ernestina is the first person on the right standing up.

loans.use: to buy a new oven.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es: El señor Narciso, tiene 62 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos que dependen de sus ingresos, vive en Mizque porque sus hijos estudian en los colegios del municipio. Trabaja en la agricultura cultiva maní, papa y frejol para el sustento de su familia, cubre los gastos de alimentación, servicios, material de estudio entre otros. El señor es una persona trabajadora también se dedica a la construcción de viviendas como albañil dentro de su radio urbano. Su casa no cuenta con una buena infraestructura por ello actualmente solicita un crédito para la construcción y ampliación de su vivienda. De esta forma podrá proporcionarle a su familia mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Narcisco, 62, is married and has three dependent children.  He lives in Mizque because that is where his chidlren attend the municipal school.  He works in agriculture and grows peanuts, potatoes and beans to support his family, cover food costs, and pay for utilities and school materials.

He is a hard-working man who also works as a bricklayer in construction in the urban radius.  His house does not have a very good infrastructure so he is requesting a loan to expand and renovate the house.  That will enable him to give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: To expand and renovate his house.

loans.name: Merly María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santa Narcisa se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio San Agustín en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Merly, tiene 22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre, no tiene hijos. El marido es chofer de un tráiler. 
Doña Merly con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatillas por catálogos, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, lleva  más de 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo para el bien de su hogar y de sus hijos cuando lleguen.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa y zapatillas ya que tiene varios pedidos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 2 ciclos  y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños es tener bien arreglada su casa.
texts.en:
The Santa Narcisa Credit Group meets every 15 days in the neighbourhood of San Agustín in the city of Manta. This city is known for it's lovely beaches which are very popular throughout the year, and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions.

It is in this city that Señora Merly lives. She is 22 years old and in a common-law relationship with no children. Her husband makes a living driving a trailer. Doña Merly sells clothes and shoes from catalogues, with the goals of making some income of her own and being able to help her household to get ahead. She sells door-to-door and has been doing so for more than a year. This is how she makes a living to contribute to her household, and to her future children.

She will use this loan to buy clothes and shoes as she has various orders to fill. She has been in the credit group for two cycles and she likes it because the loans are very helpful. Her dream is to have a well-kept home.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken and chicken feet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, oil, coal, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more petroleum by container for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish and chicken.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is eighteen years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sodas, juice, drinking water and a fridge. This will help Aisha to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a retail shop. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more sodas, juice, drinking water and a fridge

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah is eighteen years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, she has been working hard to manage her tailoring business. 

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more material for making clothes for sale. It will help Faridah to generate greater profits and take care of her family's basic needs. Faridah hopes that in the future she will be able to build a residential house. 

Faridah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more material for making clothes for sale

loans.name: Bankito Progresista  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Bankito Progresita está formado por 7 socias y 1 socio quienes viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es muy visitada por la belleza de su centro colonial, esta bañada por 4 ríos, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, la gran variedad en su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propio y extraños. Las socias son personas con espíritu de lucha y trabajo ya que siempre están en la búsqueda de mejorar su estabilidad económica por el bien de sus familias.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Gladys, es una socia amable, gentil que forma parte del grupo de crédito Bankito Progresista, su grupo está conformado por amigas quienes se apoyan para cumplir sus metas, en cada reunión pueden platicar de varios temas de su interés.
La Señora Gladys tiene 28 años de edad, es una mujer soltera, no tiene hijos y vive en casa de sus padres la cual es propia.
Doña Gladys tiene un negocio propio el cual es la preparación y venta de salchipapas, actividad que la realiza de lunes a sábados desde hace un año. El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de víveres para la preparación de su comida rápida. Su sueño es  viajar al extranjero.
Las dos fotos pequeñas son de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The lending group “Bankito Progresista” consists of 7 female members and 1 male member, who live in the city of Cuenca. This city is often visited by tourists because of its beautiful center from the colonial era. Four rivers run through the city and the people keep up their culture and traditions, and the great variety of their cuisine which is pleasing to the palates of locals and foreigners. The members of the lending group are people with a spirit to fight and work and they are always striving to improve their economic stability to improve the lives of their families.

One of the members of this group is Gladys. Gladys is a kind and gentle member who is part of the lending group “Bankito Progresista”, a group which was formed by friends who help each other to achieve their goals. At each meeting they discuss various topics of interest.

Gladys is 28 years old, she is single, has no children and lives with her parents in their own house. Gladys work is the preparation and sale of salchipapa (a dish which consists of sliced fried sausages and fries) and she works from Monday through Saturday. She has worked in this business for a year. She will invest the money from the loan in the purchase of supplies for the preparation of her fast food. It is her dream to travel abroad.

The two small photos are of members who could not be present when the picture of the group was taken.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Gira Lenny

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santa Narcisa se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio San Agustín en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Gira, tiene 41 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 7 y 2 años, uno de ellos estudia en escuela. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Gira es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice para arreglar su taxi que está un poco deteriorado, el necesita comprar llantas nuevas y pagar el arreglo del taxi para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes ya que esta es la fuente de ingresos que él tiene para sacar adelante a su familia, el lleva más de 10 años realizando esta actividad con la cual el lleva el pan diario a su hogar.
Este crédito es para compra llantas y pagar el arreglo del taxi. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ella ayuda a su marido a salir adelante en su hogar. Sus sueños es comprar un taxi nuevo.
texts.en:
The Santa Narcisa  Credit Group meets every 15 days in the neighbourhood of San Agustín in Manta, a city known for its stunning beaches which are popular all year round, and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Señora Gira lives here. She is 41 years old, has a partner and two children, aged 7 and 2. One of them studies at school. Her partner is a taxi driver.

Gira is a very good partner who is requesting a loan so that her partner can use it to make repairs to his taxi, which is slightly damaged. He needs to buy new tyres and pay for repairs to the taxi to offer a better service to his customers, since this is his source of income he uses to support his family. He has been in this business for more than ten years, which puts bread on his family's table every day. 

The purpose of this loan is to buy tyres and pay for taxi repairs. Gira has been a member of the Credit Group since the beginning, and she likes it because this way, she is able to help her husband to succeed. Her dream is to buy a new taxi.

loans.use: to buy tyres and pay for repairs to the taxi.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that her industriousness has enabled her to greatly increase her income and help her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy more stock for her food stall and solar lamps to lighten her business at night. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her food stall and solar lamps to light her business at night.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cartons of fish.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda lives with her husband and son in San Isidro, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. The family is involved in a retail business. They started selling dried fish in a small store near their house. This business is the only source of income for this family, so it is very important to them. Rosalinda has now requested this loan to be able to purchase new stock of dried fish for selling to locals in her area. She hopes that someday their life will be stable financially.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en: Felipe is 54 years old. He is married and has three children. He will use a Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. In the future he wishes to acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Joweria

texts.en:
Joweria is nineteen years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, she has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Joweria has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sodas, juice, drinking water and a fridge. This will help Joweria to generate greater profits and take care of her family's basic needs. Joweria hopes that in the future she will be able to build a residential house. 

Joweria is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more sodas, juices, drinking water and a fridge

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 63 years of age, and presently residing in Gango, Ozamis City. She is married with 5 children of adult age. She has an existing business (a carenderia) in Barangay Gango. She has had this business for more than a decade. Aside from the salary of her husband, her carenderia also is a source of family income. Emma has requested a loan as additional capital to buy rice, meat, vegetables, spices, etc.  She hopes that she will be able to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is twenty years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past two years, Joan has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells raw food.

To help expand her business, Joan has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more raw foods for selling, and will help Joan to generate greater profits and take care of her family's basic needs. Joan hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a boutique.

Joan is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more raw foods to sell

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 36 years old and married with six children. With four children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Antonieta's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor involved in rebuilding her family home.

Antonieta is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 52 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Adelaida's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a PHP 6,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her family home. 

Adelaida is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Amie is 28 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are in school.

Amie and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013; but her business and family home was wiped out. She is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a new house for her family. 

Amie has been an NWTF borrower since 2013 and plans to recover through her general store business. With your help, she can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a 45-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Anecita's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regaining what she lost. She is taking out a PHP 9,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Anecita has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Bayarsaikhan, 36 years old, lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting goods between districts since 2012. His wife is unemployed, and stays at home looking after their children. Their eldest son goes to school, and others stay at home. 

He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam for a house renovation. 

After the renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: La Esperanza El Coco 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Menenciana lives in a rural village of Samana. She is one of the members from the group called La Esperanza el coco (the hope of coconut) 1, 2, 3 & 4.  She and her group of 20 members are taking loans for their businesses. This group is dedicated to many different businesses like selling clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and a little restaurant. Menenciana is selling clothes and cosmetics.

Menenciana is planning on investing her new loan in the purchase of cosmetics and clothing. This is her 12th loan with Esperanza Internacional, and she will increase her inventory. She will use her profits to continue investing in her business to improve sales, and to provide for her family's needs.

Menenciana's family is made up of her and her 5 dependents, including her children and other of her family members. She says that her most difficult challenge has been to have a successful and sustainable business that generates enough income to support her and her family.

loans.use: To buy clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
This is Randy, 59, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Solita, and they have children. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Randy oversees the operations of their Jeepney transportation business. They have one unit of Jeepney that carries up to 16 passengers to their destinations within the community. He earns from the boundary* (a daily quota) their driver remits everyday. Their regular passengers and customers are from the local community. He earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in boundary every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will be using the loan for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit.

Randy hopes to have more Jeepney units, and dreams of having a better living. He meets up with his co-fellowship** members to share stories of his life and business every week, and he also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

*In the boundary system, the driver pays the Jeepney owner a fixed amount (the “boundary”) for driving a passenger vehicle for 12 hours. It is as if the driver is renting the vehicle. What he earns from passenger fares above the “boundary,” minus what he paid for the gas and oil, is his take-home pay.

**All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their Jeepney unit.

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.en:
Brigitte is 45 years old; she is married with four children. 

She will use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.  She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. 

With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 49 years old and married with five children. 

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Belinda is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She has been an NWTF borrower since 2012, and plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Belinda can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan.

In future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: María Gilma

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santa Narcisa se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio San Agustín en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 60 años de edad, hace varios años su querido esposo falleció y quedo viuda, pero de esta relación tienen dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de  edad,  ella vive con una hija. 
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante,  ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa donde vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas, carnes, artículos de bazar y papelería, entre otras cosas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su negocio es su vida ya que además de ganarse la vida en el, allí se entretiene y se olvida de sus problemas, ya son más de 10 años que lleva con este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante sola.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por las ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su tienda.
texts.en:
The Santa Narcisa credit group meets every two weeks in the San Agustín neighborhood in the city of Manta. It is a city known for its beautiful beaches that are much visited all year round. It is also known for being a city with unmatched beauty and many tourist attractions. 

Here lives María. She is 60 years old. Several years ago, her beloved husband passed away and she became a widow. From that relationship she has two children who are now grown. A daughter lives with her. Maria is a woman who likes to work to get ahead. She has a grocery store in her house where she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, vegetables, legumes, fruit, meat, miscellaneous items, paper goods, and more.  
She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. and sometimes later. Her business is her life and she likes making her living there. It is entertaining and she forgets her troubles. She has had this business for more than 10 years now and it has allowed her to get ahead on her own. 

She is going to use this loan to buy rice, sugar, detergent, deli meats and other staple products. She has been in the credit group since the beginning and she likes it because of the help she gets with the loans. Her dream is to improve her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, deli meats, and other staple products.

loans.name: Mata De Palma En Desarrollo 1 Group

texts.en:
Valeria is the coordinator of "Mata de Palma en Desarrollo" group 1 (Palm tree in development). They are named this because this is the community where the group is located in Hato Mayor city, in the eastern part of the country. The group includes five micro-business people who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, food, etc.

Valeria is very excited to receive her 17th loan with Esperanza International, after having repaid her previous loans and taken steps to grow her business. She has had her business for about nine years. She started it when she took her first loan. Gisela plans to invest her new loan in her business. She sells new clothes and miscellaneous products. She will use her business profits to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes and miscellaneous products

loans.name: Grace Nora

texts.en:
Grace is a resident of Tondo Manila, Philippines. She is married to Ronel, and a mother of one child. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Grace operates a "Piso-Net" business. Piso Net is basically a merge of PC rental and Arcade rental services where customers can pay for the services by inserting coins to the machine. There is increased need for services like these, as customer demand increases. Her main patrons are students who require her services for school requirements. She also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes, like writing a resume and office documentation; as well as people who would just love to surf the net and any social networks. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 450 in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy an additional Piso Net unit for her business. 

She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Grace hopes that her family will always be happy and healthy, and desires to help other people to the best that she can. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy another set of Piso Net unit

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of candies and toy products to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of candies and toy products to expand her product inventory. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rochelle hopes to expand her business and have other sources of income. She dreams that her family is always in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities of candies and toy products to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and other expenses. She looks forward to this financial assistance with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Natividad dreams of a longer and happy life with her family, and hopes that her children will also become successful in their own businesses. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a tobacco retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock and vegetable vending businesses. Teresita is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy more tobacco to offer for resale.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more tobacco to offer for resale.

loans.name: Dorica

texts.en:
Dorica is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 51 years old and has three children who are in school.

Her house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fishing business and is committed to regain what she lost. She is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Dorica has been with NWTF since 2012 in her effort to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 54 years old, married, and has twelve children. Two of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Rebecca has been farming vegetables for 25 years.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 38 years old and married, with five children. With four children currently in school, Elena works very hard to provide for them.

Elena's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business, and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Elena has taken a PHP 9,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Elena is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 50 years old, and married with three children who are all in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 15 years, and sells a variety of items such as detergent, snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Nenita would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mildred Alexandra

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santa Narcisa se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio San Agustín en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Mildred, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 11, 9 y gemelos de 5   años de  edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y  los tres menores en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Mildred junto con su esposo se dedican a la compra y venta de productos agrícolas, ellos se trasladan a varios cantones de la provincia para comprar maíz, cacao, arroz, café y varios productos más, para luego entregar a instituciones del Estado o a empresas que exportan estos productos al extranjero, de esta forma ellos se ganan algo por ser intermediarios, ya son más de 12 años que su marido está en este negocio y con lo cual salen  adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar café, cacao, maíz y arroz. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ellos financian su negocio con los créditos. Sus sueños es tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The Santa Narcisa credit group meets every two weeks in the San Agustín neighborhood in the city of Manta. It is a city known for its beautiful beaches that are much visited all year round. It is also known for its unmatched beauty and it many tourist attractions. 

Here lives Mildred.  She is 34 years old, married and from thais relationship has four children, aged 11, 9,  5 year old twins. The oldest is in high school and the three youngest are in primary school. Her husband is a merchant. Mildred and her husband work buying and selling agricultural products. They go to different cantons in the province to buy corn, cacao, rice, coffee and various other products. Later they deliver them to state institutions or business that export these products abroad. They make some profit from being the intermediaries, and she and her husband have had this business for more than 12 years. With it, they get ahead. 

This loan is to buy coffee, cacao, corn and rice. She has been in the credit group since the beginning and she likes it because they finance her business with the loans. Her dream is to have a great locale.

loans.use: to buy coffee, cacao, corn and rice.

loans.name: Clotilde Oliva

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santa Narcisa se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio San Agustín en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Clotilde, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Clotilde es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y con esto ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar,  ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras, helados de una marca muy reconocida a nivel nacional, entre otras cosas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su marido le ayuda en las noches, pero es ella la que pasa casi todo el día allí y le gusta ya que además de ganarse la vida se entretiene y se entera de todo lo que pasa en su entorno, ya son más de 10 años que lleva con este negocio con el cual está muy contenta.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes y helados. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos surte mas su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su tienda.
texts.en:
The Santa Narcisa credit group meets every two weeks in the San Agustín neighborhood of the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are popular with visitors all year round and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

In this place lives Clotilde, 56 years old, who is married and from this relationship has three adult children who are independent. Her husband is a merchant. 

Clotilde is a woman who likes to work and also to help her husband with the household expenses. She has a general store in her home, and there she sells all sorts of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, legumes, vegetables, and a nationally known brand of ice cream, among other things. She works every day from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm and sometimes later. Her husband helps at night, but she is the one who spends almost the entire day there and she likes it because in addition to earning her living, she keeps herself entertained and learns about everything that goes on around her. She has worked in this business for over 10 years and she is very pleased with it.

She will use this credit to stock her store more, she will purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergent and ice cream. She has participated in the credit group since its beginning and she likes it because the loans give her business a boost. Her dream is to continue improving her store.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergent and ice cream.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to add more products to her grocery store, and she was also able to help send her children to school. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She continues to work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. 

The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gloria dreams that her business will last longer and hopes to have a better living. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 48 years old and has eight children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She has been an NWTF borrower since 2012 and plans to recover through her fishing business.

With your help, Carmen can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her general store business and been in NWTF since 2013. 

Sheis now requesting a PHP 4,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Emma will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Emma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel tiene 55 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán, departamento de Sololá, tiene dos hijos; el primero de 30 años de edad, trabaja en un tienda en la comunidad donde viven, el segundo tiene 22 años de edad trabaja en un taller de mecánica automotriz, obtiene sus ingresos por fletes, se dedica a acarrear gente de la comunidad donde vive hacia un municipio del departamento de Suchitepéquez, comenta Manuel que la gente les costaba salir de la comunidad ya casi nadie prestaba este servicio y por eso decidió atender a la gente con su pequeño camión, Manuel solicita un crédito por un monto de Q. 10,000.00 para el mantenimiento de su pequeño camión, el sueño de Manuel es comprar unos lotes de terrenos para sus hijos y tenga mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Manuel is 55 years old. He lives in the town of Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán, department of Sololá. He has two children. The oldest is 30 and works in a store in the community where they live. The youngest is 22 and works in an auto mechanic shop. He earns his income by transport. He picks up people in the community where he lives and takes them to a town of the department of Suchitepéquez. Manuel says that it was difficult for people to leave his community and almost nobody offered this service and that is why he decided to serve people with his truck. Manuel is asking for a loan in the amount of Q. 10,000.00 to do maintenance on his little truck. Manuel's dream is to buy some plots of land so his children can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to do truck maintenance.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El Sr. Jorge es de la ciudad de Encarnación, es soltero y tiene una hija, por quien está luchando para poder darle una vida digna, y sin privaciones.
Jorge es de profesión Abogado, que trabaja de manera independiente, tiene su propia oficina ya hace más de 6 años.  El pide este préstamo para poder construir para su casa, y comprar materiales de construcción, ya que quiere dar a su hija una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Jorge is from the city of Encarnación. He is single and has a daughter, and is working hard to be able to give her a decent life, without hardship. Jorge is a lawyer and works independently. He has had his own office for more than 6 months now.

He is asking for this loan so he can build his house and buy building materials, since he wants to give his daughter a decent home.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Virginia Patricia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santa Narcisa se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio San Agustín en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Virginia, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 8 y 6   años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Virginia es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta conseguir sus propios recursos por el bien familiar, ella vende ropa de todo tipo y productos de Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos ya que sus hijos están en la escuela, ella también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes si necesitan de algún producto, deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva 6 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual ayuda a su marido en los gastos de estudios de sus pequeños. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y ropa de todo tipo. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque  los créditos son rápidos y a bajo interés. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Santa Narcisa credit group meets every two weeks in the San Agustín neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are popular with visitors year round and for being a city of unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions.

In this place lives Virginia. She is 24 years old, married, and from this relationship has two children, ages 8 and 6, who are students. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Virgina is a very hard-working woman who likes to earn her own resources for the family good. She sells all sorts of clothing and Yanbal products (beauty products, scented cosmetics and women's accessories).  She works every day, mostly in the mornings since at that time it is easier to make her rounds since the children are in school. She also sells from her house where her customers come if they need certain products, she accepts credit and they pay every week. She has worked in this job for six years, with which she helps her husband with the little ones' school expenses.

She will use this loan to purchase perfumes, costume jewelry, creams, and all sorts of clothing. She has been involved in the credit group since the beginning and she likes it because the loans are fast and with low interest rates. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, and clothing.

loans.name: Denny Alfonso

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santa Narcisa se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio San Agustín en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive el señor Denny, tiene  48 años de edad, está separado y tiene dos hijos mayores e independientes.
Don Denny es un hombre muy trabajador que le gusta salir adelante a través del trabajo honrado, el se dedica al comercio de artículos de temporada ya esto se vende más rápido y aumenta sus ganancias, el vende ropa, zapatos, ropa interior, entre otros productos, su forma de venta es ambulante, el recorre la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos, trabaja todos los días y casi todo el día, esto lo realiza por más de 4 años con lo cual el sale adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas y camisetas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 3 años  y le gusta porque así el financia su  negocio. Sus sueños son tener un local.
texts.en:
The Santa Narcisa credit group meets every two weeks in the San Agustín neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches which are popular with visitors year round and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

In this place lives Denny. He is 48 years old, separated and has two adult children who are independent.

Denny is a hard-working man who likes to get ahead through honest work. He works selling seasonal things since they sell more quickly and increase his earnings. He sells clothing, shoes, and undergarments, among other products. He does this as a street vendor, going around the city offering his products. He works every day and almost the entire day. He has done this for over four years, and with this, gets ahead. 

He will use this loan to purchase pants, blouses, and shirts. He has been a part of the credit group for the past 3 years and he likes it because, through it, he finances his business. His dream is to have a shop.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses and shirts.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria  es divorciada y tiene 7 hijos Maria vive en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Maria es artesana y ayudante de chofer en movilidad y necesita un credito para cancelar una intervención quirúrgica de suma urgencia Maria es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Maria  is divorced and has 7 children. She lives in El Alto in a brick and cement house which she owns. Maria is an artisan and an assistant driver.

Maria needs a loan to pay for an operation that she urgently needs. She is the only source of income for her household, and that is why she needs your help.

loans.use: to pay for a very urgent operation.

loans.name: Ildaura Isabel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santa Narcisa se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio San Agustín en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Ildaura, tiene 59 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de  edad, tres de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.
Doña Ildaura es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma para ganar sus propios recursos y con estos ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a  preparar y vender deliciosos ceviches y encebollados de pescado y mixtos en su casa, los fines de semana realiza esta actividad y en ciertos días prepara almuerzos y bocaditos, lleva más de 10 años realizando esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo por el bien del hogar.
Este  crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The Santa Narcisa credit group meets every two weeks in the San Agustín neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches which are popular with visitors year round and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

In this place lives Ildaura. She is 59 years old, in a common-law marriage and from this relationship has four adult children. Three of them still live in her home. Her husband is a security guard. 

Ildaura is a woman who likes to be self-sufficient to earn her own resources and with them, help her husband with the household expenses. She works preparing and selling delicious ceviche and encebollados de pescado (a fish and onion dish) and mixed encebollados at home. She does this job on the weekends and certain days she prepares lunches and snacks. The has worked in this job for over 10 years, from which she earns her own income for the good of the household.

This loan is to purchase supplies to prepare food. She has been a part of the credit group since the beginning and she likes it because, with the loans, she gets ahead. Her dream is to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to prepare food.

loans.name: Mardoris Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santa Narcisa se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio San Agustín en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Elizabeth, tiene 38 años de edad, está separada y  de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 14, 7 y 2 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y escuela.
