Doña Elizabeth es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y  con el fruto de su trabajo sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella tiene a cargo el bar en una escuela de la localidad, allí ella prepara y vende deliciosos ceviches, encebollado, empanadas, bocaditos, jugos naturales entre otras cosas, cada día ella lleva algo diferente para ofrecer a los niños que asisten a este centro de estudios pero todos los alimentos de la forma más natural posible,  son dos años que lleva con este negocio con el cual está muy contenta ya que así se gana lo suyo por el bien de sus hijos.
Este  crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella sale adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Santa Narcisa credit group meets every two weeks in the San Agustín neighborhood of the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches which are popular with visitors all year round and for being a city of unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions.

In this place lives Elizabeth. She is 38 years old, separated, and from that relationship has three children, ages 14, 7 and 2; the two older ones are students in secondary school and primary school.

Elizabeth is a woman who likes to be self-sufficient and with the fruits of her labor, she gets ahead with her children. She is in charge of the snack bar at a local school. There, she prepares and sells delicious ceviche, encebollado, empanadas, snacks, and natural juices among other things. Every day, she brings something different to offer to the children who go to this school, but all the foods are of the most natural form possible. She has had this business for two years and is very pleased with it because she earns her own income for the good of her children.

This loan is to purchase supplies to prepare food.  She has had 4 loan cycles with the credit group and she likes it because, with the loans, she gets ahead. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to prepare food

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
Kuña Aty quiere decir, agrupación de mujeres, ellas se unieron y están en su primer ciclo, con mucho entusiasmo de trabajar y poder capacitarse, están haciendo también la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza y así luchan por ir creciendo.
Una de ellas es la señora  Teodora, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir que debe seguir trabajando por poder crecer.  Ella está recibiendo capacitación para poder emprender en la venta de cosméticos en su barrio para generar más ingresos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos variados para poder seguir emprender en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Kuña Aty means a group of women. This group has formed and is in its first loan cycle. They are very enthusiastic about working and training and are also doing the survey to eliminate poverty, to fight to get ahead.

One member is Teodora, who in her survey was at level one of poverty, which means that she must continue working so she can grow. She is receiving training to enable her to start a cosmetics sales business in her neighborhood to generate more income. She is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of a variety of cosmetics so she can start up her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
Mujeres valientes se llama este grupo que está en su Cuarto ciclo, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para salir adelante.
Una integrante es la Sra.  Limpia, se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, comenta que ya tiene una muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella sus prendas. Dice que el secreto para poder crecer en sus ventas es tener siempre una buena variedad de productos, y es por eso que pide este préstamo, ya que quiere poder comprar nuevas prendas, ya que se acerca el invierno y quiere tener una buena variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group, which is called Mujeres Valientes, is in its fourth loan cycle, where all the women commit to working together and helping each other in order to make progress. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, in which they are all making their best efforts to make progress.

Limpia is one of the members. She makes a living selling all types of clothing. She says she has a very good clientele who always buy their clothing from her. She says the secret to being able to grow sales is to always have a good range of products. This is why she is asking for this loan, as she wants to buy new clothing because the winter is coming and she wants to have a good range to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing to sell.

loans.name: Lina Del Jesús

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santa Narcisa se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio San Agustín en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Lina, tiene 42 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 18 y 14  años de  edad, la menor estudia de colegio. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Lina es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante con su trabajo, ella tiene una  tienda de víveres en su casa muy bien surtida, allí vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas, carnes, bebidas como aguas en bidón, cervezas, colas y jugos, entre otras cosas, allí trabaja todos los días, su esposo y sus hijos le ayudan cuando pueden, le gusta su negocio ya que además de ganarse algo está al tanto de las necesidades de sus hijos, lleva  3 años con su negocio y está muy contenta.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con la ayuda de los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su tienda.
texts.en:
The Santa Narcisa credit group meets every two weeks in the San Agustín neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches which are popular with visitors year round and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

In this place lives Lina. She is 42 years old, in a common-law marriage and from this relationship has two children, 18 and 14 years old. The younger one is a secondary school student. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Lina is a woman who likes to get ahead with her work. She has a well-stocked general store in her home. There, she sells all sorts of products such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, legumes, vegetables, fruits, meat, drinks such as large bottles of water, beer, soft drinks, and juice, among other things. She works there very day. Her husband and children help when they can. She likes her business because in addition to earning something, she is aware of all of her children's needs. She has worked in this business for three years, and is very pleased.

She will use this loan to stock her store more, she will purchase rice, sugar, and oil among other staples. She has been in the credit group for 3 years and likes it because with the help of the loans, she opened her business. Her dream is to continue improving her store.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and oil, among other staples.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Activas está en su ciclo número 14 del programa de comité de mujeres. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familias, que están luchando por poder salir adelante. Donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Inocencia, quien es una persona muy trabajadora y sacrificada.
Ella está saliendo adelante por medio de su trabajo en la costura, donde se ha hecho muy conocida por el buen trabajo que viene haciendo y con lo cual ayuda a su familia. Su sueño es poder seguir con su trabajo para ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, y demás productos para poder seguir trabajando. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Mujeres Activas is in its 14th loan cycle in the program of women's committees. They are women heads of household who are struggling to be able to get ahead. One of the members is Inocencia, who is a very hard-working and self-sacrificing person. 

She is getting ahead though her work in sewing, where she has made herself well-known for the good work that she does, and with which she helps her family. Her dream is to be able to continue with her work in order to help her family and give them everything she couldn't have.

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of fabric, thread, elastic, and other products to be able to continue working. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting in order to continue growing.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, elastic, and other products.

loans.name: Juntas Podemos Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Juntas Podemos, ya que todas saben que juntas podrán mejorar sus vidas. Ellas están en el 3er ciclo  del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, cada una haciendo una actividad productora.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Felicia, una persona trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de productos en general para el uso en el hogar, y el préstamo que pide lo quiere usar en la compra de productos varios para la venta, como jabones, edulcorantes, café, leche y demás, para ofrecer a su clientela. Su marido también trabaja, se dedica a la albañilería por lo tanto también la ayuda. Según su primera encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza dándole a su familia todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
The group is called Juntas Podemos (Together We Can) because they all know that together they can improve their lives. They are in their third cycle of the Women Entrepreneurs Committee program, each one is doing a productive job.

One of them is Felicia, a hard-working person who works selling general products for the home, and the loan that she asks for, she wants to use to purchase various products to sell, such as soaps, sweeteners, coffee, milk, and other products, to offer to her customers. Her husband also works, in construction, so he also helps. According to her first poverty elimination questionnaire, she is improving her poverty situation, giving her family everything it needs.

loans.use: to purchase soaps, sweeteners, coffee, milk and other supplies.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo es una persona muy trabajadora que a través de su despensa bien surtida esta trabajando para poder tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia, esta luchando cada día mas por ir creciendo. Comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior pudo comprar insumos para vender en su despensa, que le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo que le permitirá seguir abasteciendo su negocio con carne, bebidas. lácteos, y demás insumos. agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que eta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Gerardo is a very hard-working person who, through his well-stocked store, is working to be able to have the means to be able to help his family.  He is fighting more every day to continue growing. He states that with the previous loan, he could purchase supplies to sell in his store, and it helped him a lot.

Today he asks for a new loan, that will permit him to continue stocking his business with meat, drinks, dairy products, and other supplies. He is thankful for this new opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo Divino Niño Jesús está en el  ciclo número 16° del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se pusieron como meta crecer y salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde gracias al esfuerzo de todas están mejorando su línea de pobreza.
Ramona integra este grupo, ella trabaja en la venta de frutas y verduras variadas, que siempre vende en su puesto ambulante. Comenta que al principio le costó un poco empezar, pero se fue abriendo camino y ya tiene muy buena clientela. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras y frutas frescas para poder seguir con su venta como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Divino Niño Jesús group is in its 16th loan cycle with the women's committee program, where they all work and set a goal to grow and get ahead. They are using the poverty elimination tool, where, thanks to all of their efforts, they are improving their poverty line.

Ramona is a member of this group. She works selling various fruits and vegetables, that she always sells in her street vendor location. She states that at first it was difficult to start, but she continued making her way and now has many good customers. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is getting to be able to continue growing.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase fresh vegetables and fruits to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase fresh vegetables and fruit for sale.

loans.name: Sergio Eloy

texts.es: El señor Sergio es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres, su actividad es la venta de productos varios en una  tienda de barrio, cuenta con esta actividad hace mas de dos años la misma se encuentra cerca de su domicilio. Actualmente solicita un credito para comprar productos  para su tienda, ya que quiere abastecerla para ofrecer mayor variedad y tambien requiere algunos de consumo masivo de mas inversion. El empezo con la actividad, con muy pocos productos y con el paso del tiempo fue incrementando su capital mas adelante tiene planeado ampliar su almacen para abstecer a todas  las zonas colindantes ya que es un mercado en crecimiento. Con relacion a la competencia, tiene la ventaja de que sus precios son  accesibles a sus clientes y los vecinos de la zona.
texts.en:
Sergio is single and has no children. He lives in his parents' house. He has a business selling various products in a local shop. He has been doing this for more than two years and the shop is near to his home.

Currently he is asking for a loan to buy products for his shop, as he wants to stock the shop to offer a wider variety and also needs to spend more on everyday staples. He started the business with very few products and over time has gradually increased his stock. 

In the future he plans to expand his store to supply all of the neighbouring areas, since the market is growing. As regards the competition, his advantage is that his prices are affordable for his customers and the locals.

loans.use: to buy products for his shop.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita previously accessed a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Amelita hopes to have an expansion for her business and dreams of a longer and happier life with her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: El señor Adrián vive en la provincia de Tiraque su actividad principal es la agricultura, se dedica a esta actividad hace 14 años. El cliente cuenta con cinco dependientes económicos que son sus hijos, los cuales están estudiando. En su trabajo para la preparación del terreno utiliza tractor agrícola y para la siembra y cosecha utiliza jornaleros de lugar, el cliente cuenta con casa propia pero es rustica con pocos muebles y enseres. Ya que no tiene muchos recursos solicita un crédito para capital de operaciones para la compra de abono orgánico, semilla de papa y haba de esa manera podrá aumentar sus ingresos y de igual forma podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Adrián lives in the province of Tiraque. His main work is in agriculture and he has been doing this for 14 years. He has five financial dependents who are his children, and they are all studying. 

In his work he uses an agricultural tractor to prepare the land and for planting and harvesting he uses local day labourers. He has his own house but it is basic, with little furniture and few belongings. 

Since he does not have a lot of resources he is asking for a loan to use as working capital to buy organic manure, seed potatoes and broad bean seeds. By doing this he will be able to increase his income and also improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy organic manure, seed potatoes and broad bean seeds.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosana previously accessed a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to buy propeller materials and other products needed in propeller making. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 23,000 PHP loan for her to buy propeller materials and other products needed in propeller making. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosana hopes to have her own shop so she no longer has to rent. She dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for propeller materials and other products needed in propeller making.

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
Rica is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more ingredients for her food stall. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting in everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She also has a variety store for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy raw ingredients such as sugar, bananas, and other products needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rica dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her life and business and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15-30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients such as sugar, bananas, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
This is Juvy. She previously accessed a 23,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to buy ready-to-wear products and merchandise for her clothing business. Juvy also manages a computer shop and a street food business and offers manicure/pedicure services. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy raw products and ingredients needed in her street food business, like siomai. She will also utilize the loan to buy parts and to cover the maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Juvy hopes that she and her family will always be in good health and dreams that someday, she will become a boss of her own company. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Christina works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Christina is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 35 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Her house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost.  She is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Guadalupe has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. Guadalupe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family. 

With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home.

loans.use: purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 48 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Evelyn's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost. Evelyn is taking out a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Evelyn has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Evelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house after Super Typhoon Haiyan.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 41 years old and married with six children. With three children currently in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Evelyn has restarted her food vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Evelyn has taken a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Evelyn is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in the future, would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her family home after Super Typhoon Haiyan.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mary Joy works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a grocery store.  Mary Joy is borrowing 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell.

Mary Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her general store business.  She has been in NWTF since 2013 and is now requesting a PHP 6,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family. In the future, Flora would like to save enough money to expand her business.

With your help, Flora will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 7,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family. Imelda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

With your help, Imelda will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Blanca Maria

texts.es: Blanca se dedica 24 años a su salón de belleza,  ella vive con su esposo,  sus 2 hijos y sus 2 entenados (hijos de su esposo con otra señora)  de los cuales tres  están en el colegio y una en la universidad, Blanca dice que ella les cuida y les quiere a los 4 jóvenes  por igual,  Blanca comenta que es un buen negocio y que le gustaría ampliarlo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de belleza y su aspiración es poner una pequeña bootique ya que sus clientes salen bien arregladas de su sala de belleza y le dicen que con qué tipo de ropa les combina y Blanca les va a ofrecer ropa.
texts.en:
Blanca has worked in her beauty salon for 24 years. She lives with her husband, her two children, and her two step-children. Three of the children attend school, and the other is at university. Blanca says that she cares for and loves them all equally.

She notes that her business is a good one and she would like to expand it. The loan money will be used to buy beauty products, and her big plan for the future is to open a small clothing boutique so that her clients can leave her salon smartly dressed. They will tell her what type of clothing to buy and Blanca will provide it.

loans.use: buy beauty products

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
Jennelyn works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan. She has restarted her fishing business.

Jennelyn requested a housing loan from NWTF for 9,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family. In the future, Jennelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for labor

loans.name: Hector Bayardo

texts.es: Hector vive con su esposa y tiene 3 hijos de 12, 14 y 17 años de edad que se encuentran estudiando, el se dedica al comercio de papas, dice que compra su mercadería en los alrededores donde cosechan este producto y luego vende en la feria de las ciudades, Hector con el dinero del crédito va a  comprar mercadería en papas, y  su aspiración es seguir adelante en este negocio trabajar duro para que sus hijos tengan un buen futuro terminando sus estudios
texts.en:
Hector lives with his wife and has three children aged 12, 14 and 17. He makes a living selling potatoes and says he buys his stock in the surrounding area where they harvest the potatoes and them sells them at markets in the cities.

Hector will use the money from the loan to buy a stock of potatoes. He hopes to make progress in this difficult business so that his children can have a good future by finishing their education.

loans.use: to buy quintals of potatoes.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 27 years old and lives in Bay-Bay, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is a married woman with one child. 

Aida is a farmer; she owns a rice field. Aida obtained a loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase fertilizer for her rice field. Aida hopes to purchase another parcel of land to till.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Juan Derian

texts.es:
Juan es un joven emprendedor, soltero y vive en el Distrito de Cañete junto su familia.
Desde hace 1 año trabaja en una fábrica de queso, desempeñando su labor con mucha responsabilidad. El dinero ganado lo está ahorrando porque empezará a estudiar una carrera profesional.
Es un joven tenaz con muchas ganas de salir adelante y apoyar a su familia.
Juan está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que con el apoyo brindado el podrá comprar una laptop  para poder realizar sus trabajos de la Universidad, y así con el empeño con el que siga sus estudios más adelante podrá cumplir su gran sueño: “Ser un excelente profesional”.
texts.en:
Juan is a young entrepreneur. He is single and lives in Cañete District with his family. For the last year he has worked in a cheese factory, a job he fulfills with much responsibility. He is saving the money he earns so that he can take some professional courses. He is a determined young man with a great desire to get ahead and support his family.

Juan is grateful to Kiva donors as it is with their help that he will be able to buy a laptop to use at university. He is determined to work hard at his studies so that he can achieve his dream of getting a good professional job.

loans.use: buy a laptop to use at university

loans.name: Renato

texts.es:
Renato es soltero y vive en el Distrito de Nazca junto a su familia.
Él trabaja en un predio agrícola desde hace 6 años, sembrando principalmente el cultivo de papa de variedad canchan y su producto final es vendido en el mercado a un precio competitivo.
También, desde hace 4 años trabaja en un supermercado de la zona y con los ingresos obtenidos apoya en los gastos familiares.
Este hombre trabajador busca dar un mejor nivel de vida a su familia y que ellos tengan mayor comodidad en su hogar.
Renato está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que con el apoyo brindado el comprará insumos como plaguicidas, también cubrirá los costos de riego, mantenimiento, cosecha y todo lo que el cultivo pueda conllevar; des esta manera más adelante podrá cumplir su gran sueño: “Comprar vehículos para poder alquilarlos”.
texts.en:
Renato is single and lives in the Nazca district with his family. For 6 years he has worked on agricultural land, mainly growing potatoes of the Canchan variety. His produce is sold in the market at a competitive price. He has also worked in a local supermarket for 4 years and with the income he makes he helps with the family's expenses. 

This hard-working man is looking to give his family a better standard of living and make their home more comfortable. Renato is grateful to the Kiva lenders since through the support he has been given he will be able to buy supplies such as pesticides. He will also be ale to cover the costs of irrigation, maintenance, harvesting and everything else that the crop entails. In this way he hopes that in the future he will be able to fulfil his dream of buying vehicles to rent them out.

loans.use: to buy supplies for maintaining his fields and keeping them healthy.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 52 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Ma. Elena has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Elena requested a 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Ma. Elena has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Ma. Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 30 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Janeth works very hard to provide for them.

Janeth's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Janeth has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Janeth has taken a 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Janeth is committed to rebuild her devastated life and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her family home after Super Typhoon Haiyan

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 46 years old and married with eight children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Mercy has a fishing business in the Philippines. Mercy requested a 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Mercy has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Mercy would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is married and has five children. She works hard to support her family. She sellings oysters in the Philippines and earns additional income from a beach resort.  

Lucia requested a her third loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more stocks of oysters to sell to customers. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of oysters to sell

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Muchos artículos vende Noemi en su negocio: dulces, postres, calzado, ropa y mercancía en general, pues ella aprovecha muy bien las necesidades de su clientela para ofrecerle lo que ellos requieran y ganar un poco más. Su negocio inició desde hace 20 años, cuando decidida a obtener nuevas fuentes de ingresos, para apoyar los gastos de su hogar, decidió emprenderlo, aprovechando el conocimiento que su amiga le trasladó para iniciarlo y los ahorros con que contaba para ese propósito. Hoy sus ventas las realiza a crédito de 8 de la mañana a 8 de la noche y sus principales clientes están en el segmento del mercado de la comunidad donde habita. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará blusas, calzados y jeans entre otros artículos. Con ello sus ingresos aumentarán al tener mas inventarios que impulsarán sus ventas.
texts.en:
Noemi sells many things in her business: candy, deserts, shoes, clothing and general merchandise.  She knows the needs of her customers and offers them what they want and in that way earns a little more.  She started her business 20 years ago.  

When she decided to get new sources of income to help pay the household bills, she decided to 
undertake it drawing on the knowledge a girlfriend had given her to start and the savings she had available for that purpose.


Today her sales are made on credit from 8 in the morning to 8 at night and her principle customers are in the part of the community market where she lives.  This is her first application for a Kiva Loan  through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which she will buy blouses, shoes, jeans, and other articles.  With it her income will grow and she'll obtain more inventory which will boost sales.

loans.use: buy blouses, shoes, jeans and other articles

loans.name: José Renato

texts.es:
José tiene 62 años de edad, es agricultor, estudió hasta noveno grado, está acompañado por segunda vez el cual tiene un hijo de este hogar, su hijo estudia  segundo grado, su compañera de vida es comerciante.

José tiene muchos años de trabajar en la agricultura, se esforzó mucho por aprender, ya que no pudo sacar un grado académico mas alto, su compañera de vida trabaja con el comercio y ella es quien le apoya mucho con los gastos que van surgiendo en el hogar.

Con el préstamo pretende terminar una siembra de maíz que tiene pequeña y le hace falta comprar algunos insumos agrícolas tales como:  sacos de abono, veneno para la plaga, entre otros.

El sueño de José es ayudar a su hijo económica y moralmente para que se prepare con una carrera universitaria y tenga mayores oportunidades de trabajo, así mismo obtener buenos resultados en la cosecha para cancelar a tiempo su crédito y tener las puertas abiertas para otros nuevos.
texts.en:
José is 62 years old and is a farmer. He studied as far as ninth grade. He has a partner for the second time and has a son from this relationship, who is studying in second grade. His life partner has a business. José has worked in agriculture for many years and worked hard to learn, as he was not able to study for a higher academic level. His partner is in business and she helps him a lot with any costs which arise in the household.

With the loan he intends to finish planting corn, which he has a little of, and he needs to buy some agricultural supplies such as bags of manure, pesticide and other items.

José's dream is to help his son financially and morally so that he is educated with a university degree and has better work opportunities. He also hopes to get good results during the harvest to pay off his loan on time and keep the doors open for further loans.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of manure, pesticide and other items.

loans.name: Arlon Gabriel

texts.es:
Desde que era un niño el cuido de los animales y del medio ambiente era el principal interés para Arlon, razón por la que decidió estudiar Ingeniería en veterinaria, profesión que desarrolla con mucha pasión. El tiene 25 años, está soltero y hace dos años estableció una veterinaria, su madre ha sido su mano derecha. Aparte de atender animales con problemas de salud, vende peceras y está dedicándose a la crianza de peces exóticos, actividad que quiere desarrollar con éxito y dar a conocer en diferentes ciudades.
Él solicita el crédito para la compra del alimento de los peces, asimismo las medicinas de los animales, productos que tiene un precio elevado. Por lo tanto, Arlon deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, puesto que tendrá la oportunidad de brindar un mejor servicio y de esta manera obtener más clientela y mejores ingresos. Una de sus metas es  mejorar el estado de salud de las personas a través del nado como medio de relajación, quiere cumplir todas sus metas, lograr ser un ente de cambio y un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Since he was a boy, the care of animals and the environment has been Arlon's primary interest. For this reason, he decided to study veterinary medicine, a profession which he carries on with great passion. He is 25 years old, single, and two years ago, he established a veterinary practice. His mother has been his right hand. Apart from taking care of animals with health problems, he sells fish and is focusing on raising exotic fish, an activity that he wants to carry out with success and to be known in different cities.

He asks for this loan in order to purchase fish food, and also animal medicines, products which have a high price. Therefore, Arlon puts his confidence in the loan, since he will have the opportunity to offer better service, and in this way be able to have more customers and better income. One of his goals is to improve people's health through swimming as a means of relaxation. He wants to accomplish all of his goals, to be a change agent and a great professional.

loans.use: to purchase fish food, and also medicine for the animals.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario es viuda y tiene tres hijos Ella vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Rosario se dedica a la elaboración de diversas masitas y pasteles Rosario necesita credito para comprar insumos (harina, azúcar, mantequilla, manteca) para su negocio de masitas Rosario es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Rosario is a widow, and she has three children. She lives in La Paz, in a house made of brick and cement that she owns. 

Rosario makes a variety of baked goods and cakes; and she needs a loan in order to purchase supplies for her bakery business, such as flour, sugar, butter, and lard. Rosario is her household’s sole source of income, and this is why she needs your help.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her bakery business, such as flour, sugar, butter, and lard.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha es casada tiene 4 hijos y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento  Martha tiene una tienda de abarrotes y quiere un credito para incrementar su mercaderia como arroz, azucar, conservas y otros Martha es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Martha is married and has 4 children. She lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house. Martha has a grocery store and wants a loan to increase the merchandise, such as rice, sugar, canned goods and others. Martha is the only source of income for her home and for that she needs its help.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise such as rice, sugar, canned food, and others.

loans.name: Marco

texts.es: Marco es soltero y no tiene hijos Marco vive con sus padres en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento Marco sigue dedicandose a la carpinteria y necesita un credito para compra de madera para fabricar muebles Marco es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Marco is single and doesn't have children. Marco lives with his parents in La Paz in a brick and cement house. Marco continues working in carpentry and needs a loan to purchase wood to make furniture. Marco is the only source of income for his household and, for that reason, he needs its help.

loans.use: to purchase wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es: Clotilde vive en concubinato, ella tiene un hijo Ella vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un anticrético Clotilde se esta ganando la vida como ayudante de carpintería y necesita un prestamo para comprar madera para revender o transformar en muebles Clotilde es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Clotilde lives with her common-law husband and has one son. She lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house that she leases. Clotilde makes her living as an assistant carpenter. She needs a loan to buy wood to resell of to transform it into furniture. Clotilde is the only source of revenue for her home so she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy wood to resell or to make into furniture.

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
José de 22 años de edad, es agricultor, estudió hasta 7º grado debido al bajo nivel económico que tuvo desde pequeño, vive con su madre. Ella es madre soltera y fue por esa razón que se le dificultó mandarlo a la escuela, también José vive con dos hermanos, él es mayor de todos y es por eso que apoya a su familia para llevar el pan de cada dia  y para que tengan lo necesario para vivir.

José se dedica a la agricultura desde que dejó de estudiar, se vió obligado y con la necesidad de hacerlo para apoyar a su familia con los gastos del hogar, son muy unidos, apoya mucho a sus hermanos con los gastos para el estudio y que tengan las oportunidades de trabajo que él no puede optar, se sacrifica muchísimo ya que se levanta desde muy temprano para salir al campo a trabajar arduamente hasta horas muy tarde que regresa a su casa.

El préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de insumos agrícolas tales como 6 sacos de sulfato, 2 de formula, herbicidas para la plaga, y para cancelar el alquiler del terreno donde sembrara 22 hectareas de maíz.

El sueño de José es obtener buenos resultados con la cosecha para cancelar el crédito a la fecha correspondiente, ayudar a su madre para que tenga una vida digna y ayudar a sus hermanos para que sigan estudiando para que sean profesionales y tengan mayores oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
José, 22 years old, is a farmer. He studied up to the 7th grade due to the low economic level that he had since he was small. He lives with his mother. She is a single mother, and it was for that reason that it was difficult for her to send him to the school. José also lives with two siblings. He is the oldest and, for this, he supports his family to bring the daily bread and so they have what is necessary to live.

José has worked in agriculture since he left school, he was obligated and it was necessary to do so to support his family with the household expenses.  They are very close, he supports his siblings a lot with the student expenses and so that they have work opportunities that he couldn't choose. He is extremely self-sacrificing since he gets up very early in the morning to work in the field and works arduously until very late when he returns to his house.

He will use the loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as 6 bags of sulfate, 2 of formula, herbicides for the infestation, and to pay off the rent for the land where he will plant 22 hectares of corn. 

José's dream is to have results from the harvest to pay off the loan on the due date, to help his mother so that she has a decent life, and to help his siblings so they continue studying to become professionals and have better job opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase 6 bags of sulfate, 2 of formula, herbicides for the infestation, and to pay off the rent for the land where he will plant 22 hectares of corn.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah always enjoyed photography, but it wasn’t until friends started to asking her to shoot their weddings that she decided to turn her hobby into a gift. 

“I love being behind the camera and capturing memories for my clients. Since I was little, my passion for art has always played a major role in my life,” explains Sarah.

Sarah has big dreams for her photography business. She would eventually like to hire an editor and another photographer. Her vision for the future involves motivating and inspiring women all around the world to chase their dreams. Her business has found much success through running promotions via Amazon/Living Social. However, in order to take her business to the next level, she needs to purchase a lighting system and an additional lens to be able to shoot on location weddings. This loan will allow her to purchase the equipment she needs to expand her business. 

Help this inspiring entrepreneur chase her dream so she can help others chase theirs!

loans.use: To purchase lighting equipment and a new lens.

loans.name: José Vladimir

texts.es:
José de 30 años de edad , es agricultor, estudio hasta séptimo grado,  debido a los bajos recursos económicos que vivía junto a sus padres, está acompañado y tiene un hijo de tres años de edad, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

José se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 17 años aproximadamente, trabajo que le enseño su padre después que dejó su estudio, a él se le hace difícil conseguir otro trabajo debido al nivel académico que tiene y es por eso que la agricultura es su fuente de ingreso.

Utilizará el préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas tales como: 4 sacos de sulfato, un saco de formula, herbicidas para la plaga, una bolsa de semilla, para la preparación de la tierra, entre otros.

El sueño de José para el futuro es obtener buenos resultados en su cosecha, para tener ganancias y poder cancelar el crédito, así mismo ayudarle a su hijo en el estudio para que sea un profesional y tenga mayores oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
José, 30 years old, is a farmer. He studied up to seventh grade, due to the low economic resources that he lived in with his parents. He is partnered and has a 3-year-old son. His partner takes care of the household chores.  

José has worked in agriculture for approximately 17 years, a job that his father taught him after he left school. It is difficult for him to get another job due to the level of schooling that he has, and for this reason, farming is his source of income. 

He will use the loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as 4 bags of sulfate, one bag of formula, herbicides for the infestation, a bag of seeds, to prepare the land, among others. 

José's dream for the future is to be able to get good results from the harvest, to have profits and to be able to pay off the loan, and also to help his son with his studies so he will be a professional and have better work opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase 4 bags of sulfate, a bag of formula, herbicides for the infestation, a bag of seeds, for the preparation of the land, among others.

loans.name: José Ándres

texts.es:
José esta casado, es un hombre responsable y trabajador, es padre de doce hijos, se dedica a la agricultura desde muy pequeño, cultiva maiz, frijoles y maicillo y su esposa se dedica a los queaceres del hogar.

José en los meses de inviernos se dedica a reservar la tierra reailizando el proceso de preparacion empezando por cortar las hierbas malas hasta que el campo quede libre de malezas, luego hace las siembras y para eso utiliza los herbicidas y abonos para obtener un producto de calidad. Ademas, se dedica a la fabricacion de tejas actividad de la cual obtiene otros ingresos.

José necesita el préstamo para comenzar los preparativos de la siembra, comprara abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, pesticidas y para pagar la mano de obra de las personas que prestan sus servicios.

El sueño de José, es que sus hijos puedan culminar sus estudios y que puedan convertirse en personas de bien y que sean participativos en su comunidad y que sean reconocidos como personas honestas y de confianza dentro de su comunidad.
texts.en:
José is a responsible and hard-working married man who is the father of 12 children. He has been farming since he was quite young. He grows corn, beans and sorghum. His wife is a housewife.

In the winter months José works on the land undergoing the process of preparing it. He starts by getting rid of all the weeds until the fields are clear. Then he seeds and doing this he uses the herbicides and fertilizer to obtain a quality product. He also makes tiles, an activity that creates more revenue.

José needs a loan to begin the preparations for planting buying manure, fertilizer, herbicide and pesticide and pay for labor for the people who help him. José's dream is for his children to complete their studies and become good people who are active in their community and are recognized as honest people who inspire confidence within the community.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide and pay for labor.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es: Ninfa esta casada tiene un hijjo y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Ninfa sigue dedicandose a la costura y en esta ocasion ella necesita un credito para comprar tela para hacer unas sábanas que le ayudarán a elevar sus ingresos Por el momento Ninfa es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Ninfa is married, and she has one child. She lives in La Paz, in a house made of brick and cement that she owns. 

Ninfa continues working as a seamstress; and on this occasion she needs a loan to purchase fabric in order to make sheets, which will help her to increase her income. Currently, Ninfa is her household’s sole source of income, and this is why she needs your help.

loans.use: to purchase fabric in order to make sheets.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora es una mujer casada y con hijos Ella vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es propia Teodora necesita un préstamo para comprar una mayor cantidad de productos para su negocio como frazadas, conservas y otros articulos de consumo Teodora es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda para ampliar su negocio
texts.en:
Teodora is a married woman with children. She lives in La Paz in her own brick and cement home. 

Teodora needs a loan to purchase a large quantity of products for her business, like blankets, canned food, and other items for consumption. Teodora's job is the only source of income in her household, which is why she needs help to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of products for her business like blankets, canned foods, and other items for consumption.

loans.name: Byron

texts.en:
Byron has always been intrigued by the mix of technology and marketing. He also dreamed of owning his own business. He combined both of these passions into one and started his own online advertising company.
 
Pritzer Media offers services including local online marketing, animated business videos, online video production, website design and business branding. He has grow his business to over 25 clients, many of whom are national accounts.

In order to meet the needs of these clients, he needs to purchase additional cameras, computers and software to expand. With this loan, he will be able to purchase the necessary equipment and meet the demand for his services. 

Help this passionate entrepreneur and father build his business and meet the demand for his services!

loans.use: To purchase additional cameras, computers and software.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like needles, thread, feathers and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 22,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her feather duster business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lolita still hopes to have more customers while expanding her business. She dreams to be always fulfilled in all that she will accomplish in business and for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials such as thread, needles, bamboo and feathers for her business.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana es una joven luchadora, soltera y vive en el Distrito de Tinguiña con su familia.
Desde hace más de 8 meses viene trabajando como vendedora en un centro comercial, con mucho empeño y responsabilidad, siempre atendiendo a los clientes con esa sonrisa que la caracteriza y de manera muy amable y respetuosa. 
Por las noches estudia la carrera de Enfermería en una Universidad de la Zona, ella quiere salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia.
Diana está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que con la ayuda brindada ella podrá pagar su matrícula de la Universidad y cubrir otros gastos de estudio, así continuará luchando por conseguir su gran sueño: “Terminar sus estudios superiores y convertirse en una gran profesional”.
texts.en:
Diana is a plucky young woman. She is single and lives with her family in the Tinguiña district with her family.

For over eight months Diana has been working as a saleswoman at a shopping centre. She is determined there, and responsible, and always tends to her customers with her characteristic smile. Diana is friendly and respectable.

At night, Diana studies nursing at one of the local universities. Diana wants to prosper and improve her and her family's quality of life. 

Diana is grateful to Kiva investors as, with this help, she will be able to pay her university tuition fees and cover other university-related costs. With this loan Diana will continue fighting for her dream: to finish her further education and become a great professional.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees and other university-related costs.

loans.name: Ricardo Domingo

texts.es:
Todos los días a primera hora, tras haber tomado un cafecito caliente, Ricardo sale rumbo a su pequeño tramo de productos variados en el mercado, lugar donde brinda una excelente atención, razón por la que gana más clientela. El tiene 30 años de edad, está casado y tiene un hijo. Es un hombre amable y trabajador. Hace cinco años inicio su negocio con el objetivo de obtener mejores ingresos para brindarle a su familia salud y educación de calidad. Tanto su esposa como su hermana han sido su mayor soporte. 
Él solicita el segundo crédito para incrementar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar cosméticos, productos de limpieza, bisutería, entre otros. Ricardo está muy agradecido con el primer financiamiento de KIVA a través de MiCrédito, puesto que logró invertir en el negocio y de las ganancias logró mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y saldar pagos de legalización. Uno de sus planes futuros es hacer crecer su negocio,  establecer un puesto más grande  y ofrecer más productos.
texts.en:
Every day after having enjoyed his hot cup of coffee Ricardo leaves for his small stand of variety items in the market. He gives excellent service so he has created a large clientele. He is 30 years old, married and has a child. He is a friendly and hard-working man.

He started his business 5 years ago with the objective of generating better income to provide his family with quality education and health services. His wife and his sister has been very supportive.

He is requesting his second loan to increase his capital production. He needs to buy cosmetics, beauty products, jewelery etc. Ricardo is grateful for his first loan with KIva through MiCrédito, as he was able to invest in his business and from the profits make improvements to his house and cover payments to legalize it. One of his future plans is to expand his business, creating a larger stand and offering more product.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, beauty products, jewelery, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her business by buying more rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by adding distinct spaces for fitness and beauty and purchasing more equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Aloalome Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ALOALOME est composé de six personnes qui vivent dans la même localité. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Josephine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Josephine est âgée de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Josephine est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Gbégnon. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En dehors des deux enfants le couple a un autre enfant à sa charge. Josephine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Josephine vit avec ses enfants et son mari. Les charges de la famille sont supportés par ce couple. Pour cette raison, Josephine vend de la farine de manioc (gari) et de l'huile de palme dans sa région depuis cinq ans environs. De façon secondaire, Josephine vend aussi des bananes, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et d’assurer les besoins de sa famille. Josephine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Josephine ensemble avec les membres du groupe ALOALOME sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de AlIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Aloalaome group is composed of six persons living in the same neighborhood. It is the third time that the group is seeking financial support from ALIDé, in order to expand their businesses. The group’s representative, by the name of Josephine, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Josephine is 36 years old and lives in Bening. She is married to Gbégnon, a farmer. They have two dependent children, both in school. In addition to their own two children, the spouses have another child in their care. Josephine did not attend school. She lives with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide for various family needs. This is why Josephine has been selling manioc/cassava flour (“gari,” a traditional dish made of dried grated cassava) and palm oil in her region for about five years. In addition, Josephine also sells bananas. This allows her to support herself and her family. Josephine stocks up at a market in Benin. With the goal of meeting customer demand and increasing her sales volume and her revenue, Josephine, together with the other members of the Aloalome group, is seeking a third loan from ALIDé. Their prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts and bananas.

loans.name: Dilbahor

texts.ru: Дилбахор - так зовут эту жительницу города Худжанд, северной столицы Таджикистана. Она соответствует своему имени, что в переводе с таджикского означает в душе весна. Дилбахор по природе позитивный и жизнерадостный человек. Ей уже исполнилось 40 лет. Она имеет взрослого сына и дочь. Ее муж и сын занимаются ремонтом домов. А сама Дилбхор предоставляет услуги швеи у себя дома. Она шьет национальные стеганые одеяла "курпа и курпача". Этой деятельностью она занимается более 10 лет. Дилбахор хочет расширить деятельность и просит кредит для приобретения новой швейной машинки. Она надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Dilbahor is a resident of Khujand, Tajikistan's northern capital. Khujand lives up to its name which in Tajik means, "it is spring in spirit". Dilbahor is, by nature, a positive and cheerful person. She has already turned forty years old. She has an adult son and daughter. Her husband and son work repairing houses. Dilbahor works as a seamstress at home. She quilts traditional kurpa and kurpacha (cotton mats which Tajiks use in lieu of couches and chairs). She has been doing this for more than ten years. Dilbahor wants to expand her business requests a loan to purchase a new sewing machine. She looks forward to your support.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabrics to make up into men and women's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy packaging and a large oven to manufacture pryaniki (glazed honey ginger cookies).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wigs for her business.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel es una persona de 54 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, tiene seis hijos; el primero tiene 32 años de edad trabaja en oficios de la casa, el segundo de 29 años de edad trabaja en oficios de la casa, el tercero tiene 22 años de edad es jornalero, el cuarto tiene 18 años de edad estudia quinto magisterio, el quinto tiene 16 años de edad trabaja en una maquila en la cuidad capital, el sexto tiene 13 años de edad estudia segundo básico, Manuel obtiene sus ingresos en la compra y venta de banano, lo realiza en comunidad donde vive, comenta que le deja buena ganancia ya tiene 10 años de realizar esta actividad, él solicita un crédito por un monto de Q. 6,500 para comprar un lote de terreno, con las ganancias Manuel piensa comprar más terrenos para cultivarlos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel, age 54, lives in the Nahualá municipality in the Sololá department.  He has six children.  The first one is 32 years old and works doing household chores.  The second one is 29 years old and works doing household chores.  The third, age 22, is a day worker.  The fourth, age 18, is studying to be a teacher.  The fifth, age 16, works at a factory in the capital city.  The sixth, age 13, is an upper elementary grade.

Manuel gets his income from buying and selling bananas.  He does this in the community where he lives.  He says that it gives him good profits. He has been engaged in this business activity for ten years.

He is requesting a loan for 6, 500 GTQ in order to buy a piece of land.  With his earnings Manuel plans to buy more land to cultivate and to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
A 600 USD loan is offered to Cecilia to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy everyday. Cecilia will buy vegetables. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money everyday.

Running a business has made Cecilia independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta 7º grado, está acompañado, es padre de  2 hijos que aun no estudian, su esposa se dedica a los oficios varios domésticos, ya que le ayuda en el campo. 

Él se ha dedicado a los trabajos de la agricultura y la ganadería desde temprana edad. El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar ganado, abono y veneno. Sueña con comprar más ganado y terreno para que su familia tenga lo propio para vivir y trabajar.
texts.en:
Pedro is 30 years old and studied up to Grade 7. He is in a common-law relationship and is the father of two children who don't go to school yet. His wife does the various work in the house and helps him in the fields. He has worked in agriculture and raised livestock since he was young.

He will use the loan to buy cattle, manure and poison. He dreams of buying more cattle and having more land so that his family can have what they need to live well and work.

loans.use: to buy cattle, manure and poison.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy onions, garlic, carrots and papaya

loans.name: Dayana

texts.es: Dayana esta soltera y no tiene hijos Ella vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su familia Actualmente Dayana esta trabajando como ayudante de cocina y necesita un credito para iniciar su negocio propio (un pequeño restaurante) y poder independizarse Dayana es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Dayana is single and does not have children. She lives in La Paz in a home made of brick and cement that belongs to her vamily.

Dayana is currently working as a chef's assistant and needs a loan to start her own business (a small restaurant) so that she can be independent.

Dayana's job is the only source of income in her household, which is why she needs assistance.

loans.use: to start her own business (a small restaurant)

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.es: Prudencia vive en concubinato y tiene 4 hijos Ella vive en La Paz en una casa de adobe donde paga un alquiler Prudencia sigue dedicandose a la confección de tejidos pero cuando tiene tiempo libre ella gana dinero extra lavando arena Prudencia necesita un credito para comprar materiales para elaborar mantas Ella es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Prudencia lives with her husband and has four children. She lives in La Paz in an adobe home that she rents. 

Prudencia continues to make a living by weaving, but when she has free time she also earns extra money by washing sand. 

Prudencia needs a loan to purchase materials to make blankets. Her job is the only source of income in her household, which is why she needs assistance.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make blankets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sand, brick, concrete, stone, etc. for the construction of a retaining wall.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
Фотиме 51 год. Она работает продавщицей на рынке своего района Шахритус. В течение 4 лет Фотима занимается продажей фруктов и овощей. Ее муж тоже работает вместе с ней, это их семейный торговый бизнес. Фотима имеет двух детей. Они уже взрослые и самостоятельные. 
Фотима сейчас нуждается в кредите для развития торговли. Она собирается привезти партию свежих фруктов и овощей для перепродажи. Она надеется на поддержку.
texts.en:
Fotima is 51 years old. She works with retail at the market in her region of Shahrituz. Fotima has worked with selling fruit and vegetables for a period of 4 years. Her husband also works together with her, this is their family business. Fotima has two children. They are already adults and independent. 

Fotima currently needs a loan to develop her business. She has decided to purchase a batch of fresh fruit and vegetables for selling. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a batch of fresh fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Faridun

texts.ru: Фаридун 24-летний молодой человек с высшим экономическим образованием. Он год как работает кредитным экспертом в микро кредитной депозитной организации. Фаридун женат и живет с женой, матерью и младшим братом в городке Нурек. У него детей пока нет. Его жена домохозяйка. Брат Фаридуна студент. Он учится в Техническом Университете Таджикистана по специальности энергетик. Его годовое обучение в университете стоит 900 долларов США. Сейчас Фаридун имеет сбережение в размере 100 долларов и остальные недостающие 800 долларов он просит в кредит, чтобы заплатить за учебу брата. Он хочет чтобы его брат тоже успешно окончил университет и работал по своей специальности.
texts.en: Faridun is a 24-year-old young man with a degree in economics. For a year, he has worked as a loan officer for a micro-loan organization. Faridun is married and lives with his wife, mother, and younger brother in the town of Nurek. He has no children yet. His wife is a housewife. Faridun's brother is a student. He studies energy at the Technical University of Tajikistan. His annual university tuition costs 900 US dollars. Currently, Faridun has $100 in savings and has requested a loan to make up the remaining $800.  He wants his brother to successfully graduate from the university and work in his specialty.

loans.use: to pay his younger brother's college tuition.

loans.name: Union Y Prosperidad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “UNION Y PROSPERIDAD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Zoila Monica ella es soltera y tiene 45 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, chompas, casacas y blusas, la socia vende para mujeres y varones, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pantalones, chompas, casacas y blusas.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de productos de belleza.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the “UNION Y PROSPERIDAD” communal bank, situated in the district of Cusco, which belongs to Cusco province and Cusco department

Mrs. Zoila Monica, a member, is 45 years old and single with 3 children. She works in her business selling clothes. She sells pants, raincoats, jackets and blouses, she sells for women and men. She works from 8:00am until 6:00pm. She has had this business for 8 years and it is going well for her. Her dream is to grow the clothes selling business. She is asking for a loan to purchase pants, raincoats, jackets and blouses.

The other members are in the business of selling handicrafts, selling clothes, a grocery store and selling beauty products. 

Zoila Monica is grateful to those who are part of this dream in this way and promises to pay her installments in the agreed time frame.

loans.use: purchase pants, raincoats, jackets and blouses.

loans.name: Lilia Elizabeth

texts.en:
Lilia Elizabeth is 50 years old, married, and has children. She is a resident of Manila, Philippines. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating her business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Lilia Elizabeth operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Lilia Elizabeth is requesting a loan for 43,000 PHP, which she will be using to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She hopes that her business will expand and she will earn a better living.

Lilia Elizabeth meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages .

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia previously accessed a PHP 15,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 20,000, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell should result in greater profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Florencia hopes that her business will last longer and she dreams to be able to buy a house of her own. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Elipa

texts.en:
Elipa is taking a loan of USD 1,000 to improve her business. She is married and she has two children. 

She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

Elipa will use the loan to buy rice. She opened her kiosk a year ago, with her own working capital of USD 600. She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José de 57 años de edad, por el motivo de no tener suficientes recursos económicos no estudio. Esta acompañado, su pareja es ama de casa, tiene 3 hijos y los 3 van a la escuela, solo viven ellos en su casa, sus 3 hijos y su pareja. 

El cliente se dedica a la agricultura, desde muy pequeño y lo aprendió por su familia, su padre y su abuelo se dedicaron a lo mismo, es lo único que hace y su trabajo está a una distancia de 30 minutos, solamente él trabaja y el horario es de 5.30 am a 1.00 pm.

 El préstamo le ayudara para lograr cultivar más tierra y de esa forma sacar una buena cosecha para lograr vender y tener ingresos para su familia. Específicamente comprara abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, semilla de maíz y pago de mano de obra.

Los sueños para su familia,  es que con lo poco que alcanza a darles salgan adelante, para sus hijos que logren ser unos futuros profesionales. El préstamo le ayudara mucho y las ganancias que obtenga de la milpa la utilizara para los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is 57 years old and did not attend school due to a lack of economic resources. He is married and his wife is a homemaker. They have three children who attend school. He, his wife, and their three children live together in their home.

The client makes a living in agriculture. He has worked in agriculture since he was young and he learned the business from his family. His father and grandfather also worked in agriculture. This is his only job and it is located 30 minutes from his home. He works from 5:30 am until 1:00 pm. 

The loan will help him to be able to farm more land so that he can harvest more crops to later sell and earn money for his family. He will purchase manure, herbicides, pesticides, and corn seeds, and pay laborers.
