His dream for his family is that, with the little that he provides for them, his children will become professionals in the future. The loan will help him a lot and he will use the money that he earns from the corn crops to pay education expenses for his children.

loans.use: to purchase manure, herbicides, pesticides, and corn seeds, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à DIASSADENI un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec madame BINTOU débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des semences  2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  85 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women who average 42 years of age and have an average of six children each. The majority of the women live in traditional families in Diassadeni, a village in the Loulouni municipality of the Sikasso region (Mali's third administrative region). They collaborate with the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can successfully carry out their farming activities during the winter season. They are on their ninth loan from Soro Yiriwaso and the previous loans have all been repaid in full.

Within the Benkadi 1 group of women, Bintou, who is standing in the middle of the photo, grows groundnut. With this loan she is planning to buy seeds, two 50kg sacks of fertilizer, two containers of weedkiller and also pay labor costs to maintain 0.75 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and at the Sikasso market to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and on credit. She is expecting to make an average profit of 85,000FCFA per season. This profit will enable her on the one hand to repay her loan and the interest, and on the other, to help her husband with the family's daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, inputs and seeds, and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Lutfiya

texts.ru: Лутфия жительница не большого района Шахритус. Ей 43 года. Она мать троих детей. Им по 18 и 15 лет. Они учатся в школе и помогают маме в работе. Лутфия около 5 лет дома занимается куплей продажей скотин. Она покупает теленка и после определенного времени откорма перепродает его. Такой бизнес приносит ей хороший доход, чтобы обеспечить детей. Сейчас у нее возникли небольшие финансовые проблемы, по которым она просит кредит. Она намерена на заемные деньги купить корм для скотов.
texts.en:
Lutfiya is a resident of the small region of Shahrituz. She is 43 years old. She is the mother of three children. They are 18 and 15 years old. They go to school and help their mother with the work. Lutfiya has worked with animal sales for around five years. She purchases calves and after a certain amount of time of fattening them she resells them.

This business brings her a good income, in order to provide for her children. Currently she is having some small financial problems, for which she needs a loan. She intends to use the borrowed money to purchase fodder for the cattle.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for her cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase sacks of corn

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase palm oil

loans.name: Inmaculada Concepcion De Yungaqui Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “INMACULADA CONCEPCION DE YUNGAQUI II”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ceferina ella es soltera y tiene 72 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales y tambien la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de criazna de animales como cuyes y gallinas, la socia vende maíz, trigo, cebada y quinua, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia y tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maíz,trigo,cebada y quinua.

El socio que está pegado a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidió permiso por motivos de trabajo. 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de verduras.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "INMACULADA CONCEPCION DE YUNGAQUI II" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cucso, part of the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco.

The member is Ceferina. She is single and is 72 years old. She works selling grains, and she also continues to work raising animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. She sells corn, wheat, barley, and quinoa. She has spent many years in this business and it has gone well. She works from 8:00am until 5:00pm. She has spent 5 years in this business, and it is going well. Her dream is to expand her business selling grains. She is requesting the loan to purchase corn, wheat, barley, and quinoa. 

The member whose photo is attached to the group photo had his photo taken after the meeting because he had to miss the meeting because of work reasons. 

The other members make a living selling grains, selling animals, through grocery store businesses, and by selling vegetables.

Ceferina thanks those who have taken a part in her dream through this organization, and she promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and animal feed for her animals.

loans.name: Antonio Irineo

texts.es:
Antonio de 26 años de edad, es bachiller, está acompañado, su esposa se dedica a cuidar la granja que tienen en su casa, son padres de 2 hijos uno de 10 años y otro de 4 años.

Él se ha desempeñado como agricultor desde que tiene uso de razón, sus padres fueron quienes le enseñaron. Aparte de cultivar, tiene una granja de pollos de engorde en el negocio se involucra su esposa a tiempo completo. 

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas para cultivar maíz y lamina para mejorar su granja. Sueña con mejorar sus instalaciones y así tener mejor rendimiento y ganancias.
texts.en: Antonio is 26 years old, a high school graduate and has a partner.  His wife dedicates herself to taking care of the farm that they have at their house.  They are parents of two children who are 10 and 4 years old.  Antonio has worked as a farmer since he can remember.  His parents were the ones who taught him.  Besides cultivating, he has a broiler chicken farm where his wife works full time.  This loan will be utilized to buy compost, fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides to cultivate corn and sheets of metal to improve his farm.  He dreams of improving his facilities to thus have better performance and profits.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides to cultivate corn and sheets of metal to improve his farm.

loans.name: Carmen Noel

texts.es:
El ver a su padre cultivar la tierra desde niño fue motivo suficiente para que Carmen Noel siguiera sus pasos y  se  dedicara a la agricultura. Sus cultivos de maíz, trigo y frijoles son muy populares en la región  porque son de buena calidad, lo que le permite ofrecerlos al mercado nacional a  muy buen precio.  Poco a poco ha ido ingresando al mundo de la ganadería, esto fue posible a través de las ganancias de las ventas de sus siembras.
Carmen Noel es un joven visionario  y aspira  conseguir  más tierras para sembrar, también planea que sus cultivos sean exportados internacionalmente en un futuro.  Ya dio los primeros pasos afiliándose a la familia de KIVA Y MiCrédito, institución que apoya a los pequeños agricultores como él. Carmen Noel  solicitó un finamiento para la compra de supermetrina,  fusilax y carberdacin,  pesticidas que utiliza en sus cultivos para combatir las plagas.
texts.en:
Watching his father work the land was enough motivation for Carmen Noel to follow his footsteps and become a farmer. His crops of corn, wheat and beans are popular in the region because of their high quality. This allows him to sell on the national market at a god price. Little by little he has gotten into the world of cattle raising. This was possible because of his profits from the sale of his grains.

Carmen Noel is a young visionary who aspires to buy more land to plant. He also plans to export his crops internationally in the future. He's taken the first few steps by affiliating with the Kiva and MiCrédito families, institutions that support a small farmer like him. Carmen Noel is requesting a loan to buy Super Metrina, Fusialx and Carberdacin, pesticides which he uses on his crops to avoid infestations.

loans.use: to buy pesticides.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es soltero y vive en EL Distrito de Quilmana con su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que desde hace más de 1 año trabaja en los campos agrícolas de la zona, cultivando productos de excelente calidad y ofreciéndolo al mercado a un precio competitivo.
Jorge está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que con el apoyo brindado el podrá remodelar su casa, así mejorará su calidad de vida, sentirá mayor comodidad y seguirá trabajando con mucho empeño y dedicación para cumplir su más grande sueño: “Tener su negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Jorge is single and lives in the Quilmana district with his family. He is a really driven person looking to get ahead, this is the reason that for over a year he has been working in the agricultural fields in the area farming products of excellent quality and offering them to the market for a competitive price. 
Jorge is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they provide he will be able to remodel his house, improving his quality of life, and feel more comfortable. He will keep working hard, with dedication, in order to make his biggest dream come true: "to have his own business."

loans.use: remodel his residence for increased security

loans.name: Jorge Humberto

texts.es:
Jorge de 75 años de edad, estudio hasta 2do año de contador, es casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, sus hijos son mayores y dependen de sí mismos, uno vive con ellos. De él depende solo su esposa, él es pensionado. Lo pensionaron hace 14 años después de que su profesión fuera mecánico textil, se dedicó a este trabajo por unos 27 años, después que unos amigos lo recomendaran. 

El necesita el préstamo para consolidar algunas deudas que obtuvo de algunas comerciales. La situación económica dice será diferente,  así como también las formas de pago ya que ahora solo tendría que dedicarse a pensar en una cuota y no en varias ya que a su edad dice le afecta la preocupación por más de dos compromisos, dice que le da gracias a Dios por haberles dado estudio a sus hijos, ya que uno es psicólogo y el otro técnico en computación.
texts.en:
Jorge is 75 years old, and he studied through the second year of accounting. He is married, and his wife takes care of the household chores. His children are grown up and provide for themselves, and one of them lives with Jorge and his wife. Only Jorge's wife depends on him, and he receives retirement money. He has received pension money for 14 years, and before that he worked as a textile mechanic. He worked at this job for 27 years after some of his friends recommended him.

He needs this loan to consolidate some debts that he has from some businesses. He says that his economic situation will be different, and that the credit terms will also be different because now he will only have to think about one quota instead of several. He says that at his age, he is affected by worrying about more than two commitments. He says that he gives thanks to God for having given education to his sons; now one is a psychologist and the other is a computer technician.

loans.use: to consolidate some debts that he has from some businesses.

loans.name: Khishig-Togtokh

texts.en:
Mrs. Khishig-Togtokh, 41 years old, lives with her husband and son in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as barber since 1994. Her husband is engineer and works at a construction site. Their son studies at university. 

She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy and install an electric heater in her house. As a result, her family will live in warmer house and burn less coal for heating, emitting less smoke into the air.

loans.use: to buy and install an electric heater in her house

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 9 membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à DIASSADENI un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt de campagne ( PC ) avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame ABI assise à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  73 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The nine members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women who average 29 years of age and have an average of three children each. The majority of the women live in traditional families in Diassadeni, a village in the Loulouni municipality of the Sikasso region (Mali's third administrative region). They collaborate with the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can successfully carry out their farming activities during the winter season. They are on their ninth loan from Soro Yiriwaso and the previous loans have all been repaid in full.

Within the Benkadi 2 group of women, Abi, who is sitting on the far left of the photo, grows groundnut. With this loan she is planning to buy a 50kg sack of fertilizer and a container of weedkiller and also pay labor costs to maintain 0.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and at the Sikasso market to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and on credit. She is expecting to make an average profit of 73,000FCFA per season. This profit will enable her on the one hand to repay her loan and the interest, and on the other, to help her husband with the family's daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and inputs and also pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married and she runs a kiosk that helps her generate income for her family. 

Gabriela will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as cement, rice, slippers and oils. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $500. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy cement, rice, slippers and oils

loans.name: Rolando Heriberto

texts.es:
Rolando de 39 años de edad, no asistió ala escuela debido a la época en que se creció,  los padres no le daban la importancia necesaria al estudio, en el transcurso del tiempo aprendió sus oficios como lo es mecánico en estructuras metálicas y ahora esta acompañado, su pareja le ayuda con los oficios del hogar.  Ademas tienen una crianza de pollos de engorde.

El oficio de  estructuras metálicas  tiene nueve años de trabajar y  hace un año esta trabajando con pollos de engorde, lo cual le ayuda su esposa con los cuidos de los pollos.

El prestamos que esta solicitando, es  para comprar 150 pollos de engorde, es una cantidad mas grande de lo que ha manejado, ya que de eso obtiene ingresos.

En un futuro no muy lejano, planea tener una granja de pollos de engorde,  podrá distribuirle a todo el mercado  y tiendas,  lo cual le generaran mas fuentes de ingresos y darle una buena educación a su hija para que sea una persona profesional en el futuro y no se quede como él sin estudiar.
texts.en:
Rolando, 39 years old, never went to school because of the era he grew up in; his parents did not attach enough importance to education. Over time, he learnt his trade as a mechanic working with metal structures and now is married: his wife helps him look after the household. 

He also rears broiler chickens. He has spent 9 years working as a mechanic with metal structures and has been raising broiler chickens for one year, during which he has helped his wife take care of the chickens. A loan will help Rolando to buy 150 broiler chickens, a larger quantity than he has had before, so that he can earn money from them.

In the not-too-distant future, he plans to have a farm of broiler chickens which he will be able to sell in markets and shops, which will increase his income and ensure that his daughter can enjoy the good education that Ronaldo never had in order to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy 150 broiler chickens, a larger quantity than he has had before, so that he can make a profit from them.

loans.name: Doris Yohana

texts.es:
Doris de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta 2º año de bachillerato, es soltera, en su casa vive con su abuela, de ella depende solo su abuela. 

Doris es empleada, tiene 4 años de ser empleada en ruteo en toda la zona oriental, al trabajo viaja en bus urbano. Ella  usara el crédito para mejorar su casa, comprara ladrillo y lamina, ya que su casa estará en mejores condiciones. Doris sueña que su casa este en mejores condiciones y podrá vivir mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
Doris is 27 years old, she studied until the second year of high school. She is single and lives in her home with her grandmother who is her only dependent. Doris is a maid, she has been working as a traveling maid on route in the eastern zone, she commutes in an urban bus. 
She will use the loan to improve her house, purchase bricks and sheeting, which will render her home in better conditions. Doris dreams for her home to be in better conditions and therefore be able to live better with her family.

loans.use: purchase bricks and sheeting, which will render her home in better conditions

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier  es un joven emprendedor que vive en el Distrito de Imperial junto a su esposa y su hijo.
Tiene un negocio de más de 2 años en venta de chancho, realizando entrega a sus clientes de todo lugar. Es sin lugar a duda una persona muy amable y emprendedora, tiene por sueño poder expandir su negocio y tener más clientes ofreciendo productos de primera calidad.
Este hombre trabajador busca mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia y poder ofrecer una buena educación y un futuro mejor para su hijo.
Javier está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que con el apoyo brindado el comprará alimento para los animales y así vender un producto de mejor calidad para el gusto del cliente.
texts.en:
Javier is a young entrepreneur who lives in the District of Imperial with his wife and child. He has had a business of buying and selling pigs for more than two years selling them to clients from all over. With no doubt he is a friendly and enterprising person. His dream is to expand his business and have more clients offering a first class product.

This hard-working man is looking to raise his family's standard of living and be able to provide a good education and a better future for his son. Javier is grateful to the lenders at Kiva as with their support he can buy feed for his animals so he can sell a better quality product to satisfy the tastes of his clients.

loans.use: to buy feed for his animals.

loans.name: Merlys

texts.es: Merlys de 27 años de edad habita en un municipio cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla donde vive con su hijo de 9 meses de nacido. Ella tiene un negocio donde ofrece servicios de juegos,  transcripciones vende refrescos y vende dulcería en general, el cual abrio sus puertas hace 1 año, cuando quedando desempleada, aprovechó la experiencia de su madre en esta misma actividad para satisfacer las necesidades de la comunidad. Así fue como con sus propios ahorros los invirtió y hoy está entusiamada en hacerlo crecer. Su meta es logarar tener su propio local y aumentar la calidad de vida de su pequeño hijo, pero su mayor desafio es obtener fuentes de finaciación patra alcanzar las metas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, rimer fianciamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comrpara una impresora mulktifuncional que le permita ofrecer una mejor imagen de calidad al negocio y un nuevo servicio, contando con proveedores que le ofrecen equipos, herrameintas e inusmos, comprandole de contado.
texts.en: Merlys is 27 years old and lives in a municipality in the city of Barranquilla with her nine-month-old son. Merlys has a business business offering video game outlets and selling drinks and sweets. Merlys opened this business one year ago when she was unemployed. She took advantage of her mother's experience in this same work in order to fill a need in the community. With her own savings, Merlys invested in the business and is enthusiastic to expand it. Merlys' dreams are to have her own premises and to increase her young son's quality of life. Merlys' biggest challenge, however, is to earn the necessary income in order to achieve these goals. Merlys is currently applying for a Kiva loan via the "Fundación Mario Santo Domingo". She will use this loan to buy a printer. This will allow her to give her business a better image, and offer a new service. Merlys will buy equipment, tools and supplies on credit.

loans.use: to buy a printer.

loans.name: Martha Idalia

texts.es:
Martha de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta 4º grado en la escuela de su cantón, está acompañada, su pareja es empleado y agricultor. Tienen 2 hijos que aún no estudian.

Martha se dedica a los oficios del hogar y al trabajo agrícola y junto a su esposo trabajan la tierra. El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar abono, veneno y mano de obra. 

Ella sueña con poder darles a sus hijos el estudio necesario, para que en el futuro tengan mejores oportunidades para conseguir un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
Martha, age 25, studied up to the 4th grade in her canton's school. She lives with her partner, who is employed, and is also a farmer. They have two children who are not yet attending school. 

Martha devotes herself to the household tasks and to agricultural work; together, she and her husband work the land. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and poison, and to pay for labor.

She dreams of being able to provide her children with the education that is necessary, so that in the future, they may have better opportunities for obtaining good employment.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and poison, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Karina Yamileth

texts.es:
Karina es una joven de 24 años de edad, quien curso hasta quinto año en la primaria y decidió aprender el oficio de la familia ayudando a sus padres en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de café. Ella está acompañada y de su relación junto a su compañero de hogar tiene un hijo. Con mucho esfuerzo ella y su conyugue han salido adelante para superar los diferentes obstáculos que en el trabajo de campo se dan como las enfermedades, plagas, la varianza de precios en el mercado sobre el café, el incremento de los precios sobre los insumos comprados entre otros. Otra pequeña fuente de ingresos que tienen como familia es el cultivo de hortalizas (papa) la cual ejercen desde hace 5 años. La propiedad que en equipo trabajan y asisten es propia la cual la obtuvieron como herencia de sus suegros (padres del conyugue) la cual esta cerca de su casa de habitacion.
Por lo que ella solicita financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de insumos agrícolas con los cuales dará asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café para lograr obtener una excelente cosecha y pueda mejorar sus ingresos para el bienestar de su familia. Karina tiene como meta mejorar sus ingresos económicos para salir adelante, así poder comprar más propiedades para seguir cultivando más y apoyar a su esposo para lograr mucho éxito en la vida como familia y con su negocio.
texts.en:
Karina is 24 years old and completed up to fifth grade at primary school. She then decided to learn the family trade, helping her parents to look after her coffee crops. Karina has a partner and, with him, a son. With a lot of effort, Karina and her partner have prospered and overcome different obstacles in their work in the field. These difficulties include diseases, variations in world coffee prices, increases in the costs of farming supplies and more. Another source of income for Karina's family is growing potatoes; they have been doing this for five years. Karina and her family own the land where she and her family work; they inherited the land from Karina's partner's parents and it is located close to the family home.

Karina is applying for a loan from "COMIXMUL" in order to buy farming supplies to look after her coffee crops. These supplies will help Karina to obtain a good harvest and to increase her income in order to look after her family's well-being. One of Karina's goals is to improve her income in order to prosper. With more money she can buy more property in order to grow more crops and support her partner more so that the family and business will be successful.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies in order to look after her coffee crops.

loans.name: Sandy Lorena

texts.es:
Sandy, es una persona que actualmente está estudiando el segundo  semestre como  auxiliar de enfermería y  dentro  de poco  tiempo  hará el  tercer semestre, donde desempeñara todo  lo  aprendido  en clase, ella es una persona con grandes metas planeadas para el  futuro; también es una persona a la que le gusta estar informada sobre los temas con relación a la salud, especial  mente los temas que tienen relación con los niños, puesto  que uno  de los planes a futuro es irse al  exterior a estudiar medicina y  especializarse en pediatría.
Para que Sandy  pueda lograr esta meta ella deberá ahorrar dinero, y  los medios que ella puede utilizar es el  de los  convenios, en este caso ella se entero del convenio con kiva y le pareció una buena oportunidad para poder terminar los estudios que tanto la apasionan, también deberá trabajar con esfuerzo, ya que nada es fácil  y lo  que uno  quiere se gana con esfuerzo, para ello, ella cuenta con el  apoyo  de la  familia, ya que es lo  más importante para ella, económicamente ella tendrá que buscar recursos como  el  del  trabajo y ahorros realizados. 
Sandy  en un futuro  después de haber terminado  la  especialización  quiere volver a Colombia para así  poder trabajar y ayudar a los niños más necesitados, ser una persona de ejemplo  y que la sociedad la reconozca por los méritos y trabajos realizados.
Para Sandy  el estudiar medicina es más que un sueño  o  una meta por cumplir, para ella poder estudiar y  ejercer esta profesión significan pasión por la labor y el tener una forma más para ayudar a las personas.
texts.en:
Sandy is currently studying in her second semester as a nursing assistant and in a short time she will begin her third semester where she will do her practicum. She is a person with big future plans. She is also a person who likes to be kept up-to-date on health news especially topics regarding children because one of her plans in the future is to go abroad and study medicine and specialize in pediatrics.

In order for Sandy to achieve this goal she has to save money and the methods in which she can use it is the agreements. In this case she entered an agreement with Kiva and she feels it’s a good opportunity to be able to finish her studies, which she is so passionate about. Also she must work very hard as nothing is easy and what one wants, one needs to work for. She has her family’s support, which is the most important thing for her. Financially she will have to find ways such as look for work and save money. 

Once Sandy has finished her specialization, she wants to return to Colombia to be able to work and help children in need. She wants to be an exemplary person, known in society for her achievements and her work.

For Sandy, studying medicine is more than a dream or a goal to accomplish, for her to be able to study and practice this profession signifies passion for the work and a way to help people.

loans.use: to pay for a semester.

loans.name: Patricia Guadalupe

texts.es: Patricia tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijas de 3 año, 10 años y 15 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace siete años. La venta la realiza de  forma ambulante y ofrece variedad de prendas de vestir como: faldas, vestidos, blusas, pantalones, etc. De esta forma se gana la vida y apoya en la economía del hogar dado que los ingresos del esposo no logran cubrir los gastos del hogar. Patricia solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en el negocio de ropa para el cual desea comprar variedad de faldas, blusas, vestidos, ropa interior, camisas, etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder contar con mayor capacidad para satisfacer  a más clientes y así aumentar ventas e ingresos.
texts.en:
Patricia is 35 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and her three daughters, a 3 year old, a 10 year old and a 15 year old. She has worked selling clothing for seven years. She has a mobile stall that she sells from and offers a variety of clothing such as: skirts, dresses, blouses, pants, etc. She makes a living from this and supports the household since her husband´s income doesn´t cover the household expenses. 

Patricia is asking FUSAI for this loan to invest in her clothing business, for which she wants to buy a variety of skirts, blouses, dresses, underwear, shirts, etc. She hopes to get this funding to be better able to have the capacity to help more customers and to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy: skirts, blouses, dresses, underwear, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a tailor. She previously accessed a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000, which she used to purchase raw materials like fabric and thread for her business. Her increased earnings were a big help in her family's personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for another PhP 10,000 loan. She will use her loan funds to buy fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her tailoring business. The expanded profits from her business will significantly help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
 
Erlinda hopes that her business will grow stronger and bigger. Her greatest dream is for her grandchildren to finish their studies. 

She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work, as well as to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her tailoring business

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
This is Dina, a 45-year-old resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Noel, a painter, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Dina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a five PHP-worth amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Dina dreams of buying a vehicle and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Desederia

texts.en:
Desederia is 64 years of age. She lives in Bagumbang, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Desederia has a sari-sari store where she sells different types of products that help her to continue supporting her children's education.

She availed herself of a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to have additional capital, to purchase basic commodities for her sari-sari store. Desederia hopes to have her own mini-mart someday.

loans.use: to purchase basic commodities for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Herminia Yuliana

texts.es:
Herminia es una joven trabajadora, soltera, que vive en Chiclayo junto a sus padres.
Esta mujer emprendedora tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por eso, que desde hace 3 años trabaja como mesera en una Pollería de la Ciudad donde reside.
Es una persona muy luchadora, atiende a los clientes con la sonrisa que siempre la caracteriza y de manera muy amable y respetuosa.
Herminia está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que con la ayuda brindada ella podrá remodelar su vivienda para su seguridad y el de sus padres, de esta manera se despertará cada día con muchas ganas de trabajar y cumplir su sueño: “Tener su propio negocio”.
texts.en: Herminia is a young single worker who lives in Chiclayo with her parents. This enterprising woman has a lot of desire to get ahead. For this reason she has been working in a poultry shop in her city for the past 3 years. She is a fighter who takes care of her customers with a smile that is typical of her. She is always friendly and respectful. Herminia is grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to their support she can remodel her house for her security and that of her parents. In this way she will wake up every morning with the desire to  work and fulfill her dream, which is to have her own business.

loans.use: to make improvements to her house for better security.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 34 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Jocelyn's house was destroyed by super-typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Jocelyn is taking out a PHP 5,000 housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Jocelyn has been with NWTF since 2013, in her pursuit of her rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and married, with six children. With five children currently in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine's business and family home were destroyed by super-typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Josephine has restarted her food-vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Josephine has taken a PHP 9,500 housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Josephine is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and, in the future, would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie, age 43, runs a fishing business to earn a living. Her business and her family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fishing business, and she now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Leslie and her husband have four children, two of whom currently attend school. Leslie works very hard to provide for them.

She has requested a housing loan in the amount of PhP 5,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase materials with which to rebuild her family home and to pay for construction labor.

Leslie is committed to rebuilding her life after the devastation brought by the super typhoon. In future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials with which to rebuild her family home after super typhoon Haiyan, as well as to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to take care of her coffee crops.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
María de 65 años de edad, debido a la situación económica de sus padres no le pudieron ofrecer ningún tipo de estudio, ya que tenían que trabajar para mantener a sus hermanos menores, su pareja se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad ya han formado su propia familia solo vive con su compañero de vida y una hija quien le va a ayudar durante el día en los oficios domésticos.

María sea dedicado a trabajar desde muy pequeña con su madre a la venta de pescado y ademas con su padre tenia que ayudarle a trabajar en la agricultura, en la actualidad se dedica a ayudarle a su compañero de vida en la actividad de la agricultura en la época de invierno, esto lo realiza todos los días cuando esta en proceso la milpa ya que se le hace muy difícil pagar empleado para que le ayude, también se dedica a trabajar en la venta de pescado en las comunidades mas cercanas de la comunidad.


Los fondos del crédito serán destinados para pagar el arrendamiento de las tierras para la siembra de 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes necesarios para para favorecer bien el producto.

Los sueños a futuro de ella, son  mejorar la vivienda ya que es de lamina, con la ganancia después de la venta del producto de maíz para tener una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, 65, wasn’t able to go to school because of her parent’s financial situation; she had to work to support her younger siblings. Her partner works in agriculture. Her children are all older and have their own families. She lives with her life partner and one daughter who helps her during the day with house work.

Maria has been working since she was young helping her mother sell fish in addition to helping in farming. Currently she helps her partner in farming during the winter. This is done every day when the corn is being processed because it’s very difficult to pay helpers. She also sells fish in the communities closest to hers.

The loan will be used to pay for the lease of the lands, for the cultivation of 7,000 square meters of corn and for the purchase of manure and fertilizer needed to have good product.

Her dream for the future is to improve her house, which is made of sheet iron,  with the earnings of the sale of the corn to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for the lease of the lands, for the cultivation of 7,000 square meters of corn and for the purchase of manure and fertilizer needed to have good product.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Devinson Armando

texts.es: Devinson de 19 años de edad, es el propietario de una peluquería desde hace 7 años.  Él aprendió de su padre, también peluquero en la fuerza militar este oficio; Devinson desde sus 13 años, empezó   a hacer los cortes de cabello para hombres,  ganando una gran experiencia que trasladó a su negocio de hoy, en el cual trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana, hasta las 7 de la noche.  Su meta mas adelante es adecuar su local y tenerlo bien amueblado, con el fin de mejorara sus condiciones de trabajo y la calidad de vida de su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y su hijo de 1 año de edad. Su mayor desafío es lograr fuentes de financiación y con su credikiva estaría respondiendo a esta necesidad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará cemento, enchapes, para hacer adecuaciones locativas, que le permitan mejorar la imagen del negocio y brindarle un ambiente confortable a su clientela. De esta manera Devinson inicia su asenso hacia el logro de sus objetivos de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Devinson is 19 and the owner of a hairdressing establishment for the past 7 years. He learned the trade from his father, who is a military hairdresser. Devinson began at 13 years old to cut men's hair gaining a lot of experience which he translated into his own business today. He works this business from 7am until 7pm. 
His goal is to eventually proportionate his establishment and furnish it properly. In this way, he plans to improve his working conditions and the quality of life of his family, which consists of his marriage partner and his 1 year old son. 
His biggest challenge is to find sources of financing and he making use of Credikiva for this reason. He is currently applying for a Credikiva which he will use to purchase cement and veneers to make on-site repairs which will allow him to improve his business' image and give his clients a comfortable atmosphere. In this way Devinson begins his assent towards achieving his objectives of prosperity.

loans.use: purchase cement and veneers to make on-site repairs

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
José de 40 años de edad, sea dedicado a trabajar desde que era muy pequeño con mucho esfuerzo sus padres le dieron la oportunidad que cursara hasta un noveno grado, debido a la situación económica de la familia ya no pudo seguir estudiando luego empezó a trabajar ya por su cuenta, su esposa se dedica a vender ya que tiene una pupuseria que vende todas las tardes, sus 3 hijas se encuentran estudiando 2º,8º,9º grado en la escuela de la comunidad.

José se dedica a trabajar 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz para venta en elote, hace 3 cosechas en el año,  cuando tiene sus cultivos lo hace desde muy temprano ya que tiene que ordeñar unas vacas,  luego se traslada hasta el lugar de trabajo a un kilómetro de distancia, por las tardes tiene que ir a traer los animales donde pasan todo el día y en la fecha que le toca regar lo hace por la noche y tiene que cuidar que no se desborde y se inunde sus cultivos, esto lo aprendió de su padre quien también se dedicaba a esta misma actividad.

Los fondos del crédito serán destinados para el arrendamiento de las tierras, para el cultivo de maíz para todo la temporada.

Los sueños a futuro de José es sacar adelante a sus hijas, darles el estudio para que tengan una mejor situación económica, y lograr construir un pequeño cafetin para que su esposa pueda tener su propio negocio y ayudar a la familia en los gastos que se generan.
texts.en:
José, 40 years old, has been dedicated since he was very small to working with a lot of effort. His parents gave him the opportunity to study up to ninth grade. Due to their economic situation, he could not continue with his education so he began to work on his own. His wife is dedicated to selling since she has a pupuseria (place where a typical El Salvadoran dish is sold) where she sells every afternoon. Their three daughters are in 2nd, 8th, and 9th grade in the community school.

José is dedicated to working 21,000 square meters of maize to sell in a corn sale. He produces 3 harvests a year. When he has his crops, he starts very early since he has to milk his cows. Then he travels to where he works 1km away. In the afternoons his has to go bring his animals from where they spend all day and he irrigates at night but has to take care not to overflow and flood his crops. He learned this from his father who also was dedicated to the same work.

The loan funds will be destined to fix the land so he can grow corn all season. José's dream for the future are to get his daughters ahead, given them an education so that have a better economic situation and manage to build a small cafe so his wife can have her own business and help the family with their bills.

loans.use: to fix the land so he can grow corn all season

loans.name: Orlis

texts.es: Es originario de Waspan, tiene 45 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 son adolescentes que estudian su secundaria y un menor de edad de 4 años. Cuenta con una experiencia de 8 años de trabajar como agente de seguridad interna en el Hospital del Municipio de Waspam. Su esposa trabaja como empleada doméstica. Con el objetivo de mejorra y ampliar su vivienda de tambo de madera, solicita financiamiento préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción: madera, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una vivienda de concreto.
texts.en:
He is from Waspam, 45 years old, married, and has three children, of whom one is four years old and two are teenagers who go to high school.

He has been working as a security guard at the Waspam Municipal Hospital for a 8 years. His wife works as a domestic. With the aim of improving and expanding his wooden stilt home, he is requesting a loan in order to buy construction materials such as wood and nails, and to cover labor costs. His dream is to have a concrete house.

loans.use: To expand his wooden stilt house.

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA BEATRIZ”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maranura, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Sabino se dedica al negocio de venta de cereales, el socio vende maiz,cacao y quinua, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar cacao, maíz y quinua.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sabino is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Beatriz” which is located in the District of Maranura in La Convención Province, Department of Cusco. He sells dry goods such as corn, cacao, and quinoa. Sabino works from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. He has been in this business for four years and is doing very well. Sabino’s dream is to have a shop where he can sell dry goods.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy cacao, corn, and quinoa. Sabino is pleased with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy cacao, corn, and quinoa.

loans.name: Rey Dionny

texts.es:
Rey es un joven trabajador, soltero y vive en el Distrito de Subtanjalla, Departamento de Ica con su familia.
Desde hace más de 4 años trabaja como operario de construcción en distintos puntos de la Ciudad. Actualmente está trabajando en la construcción de un Hotel de la Zona.
Sale desde muy temprano a trabajar para poder apoyar a su familia y mejorar su nivel económico y así ellos puedas sentirse más cómodos en su vivienda.
Rey está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que con el apoyo brindado él podrá realizar la construcción de una Cisterna en su casa para que su familia pueda tener más agua y sentir mayor comodidad, de esta manera, Rey podrá salir a trabajar tranquilo y ahorrar su dinero para más adelante poder cumplir su gran sueño: “Tener su propia empresa de construcción”.
texts.en:
Rey is a hard-working young man. He is single and lives with his family in the district of Subtanjalla in the department of Ica. For more than 4 years, he has been working as a construction worker in different parts of the city. Currently, he is working on the construction of a hotel in his neighborhood. He leaves very early in the morning to go to work to support his family and improve their financial position so that they can feel more comfortable in their home.

Rey is grateful to the Kiva lenders since with the provided support, he will be able to build a cistern in his house so his family can have more water and feel more comfortable. That way, Rey will be able to go to work in peace and can save his money until later to fulfill his dream, which is to have his own construction company.

loans.use: to build a cistern to have more water in his house.

loans.name: Jossary

texts.es: Jossary de 34 años de edad se dedica al oficio de confeccion de ropa para cama, accesorios y cubrelechos. Desde el año 2013 inició su experiencia y en el año 2013 su emprendimiento de negocio. Su tía fue su referente y educadora en este oficio, que mucho llamaba su atención, especialmente en todo lo que tenia que ver con el diseño, preparación, ensamble y acabado de piezas. Los productos mas representativos en su inventario,  son los centros de mesa, edredones, sabanas y fundas para almohadas. Su comercialización la realiza mediante avisos y sus clientes, tambien son sus mayores promotores; a ellos les vende a crédito y de contado, durante todos los días trabajando sin cesar. Para ellos compra en almacenes de textiles, que le ofrecen buenos precios para poder ser competitiva. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una máquina recubridora, con esta inversión logrará un acabado perfecto y aumentará la calidad de sus prendas, porque su meta es consolidar su taller de confecciones, y finalmente continuar estudios que le permitan actualizarse permanentemente. Aunque tenga que afrontar el desafío de no contar con el suficiente capital de trabajo, para lograr muy pronto sus sueños de prosperidad.
texts.en: Jossary, 34 years old, is dedicated to the job of making bed linens, accessories and comforters. Since 2013, she began her experience and in 2013 she started her business. Her aunt was her reference and educator in this role that grabbed her attention, especially in everything having to do with the design, preparation, sewing and finishing of pieces. The products most representative of her inventory are table centerpieces, quilts, sheets, and pillowcases. She makes sales through notices and customers, who are her greatest promoters. To them she sells on cash or credit, every day working without stopping. For them, she buys in textile shops that offer good prices in order to be able to be competitive. Currently, she is applying to CrediKiva, the first loan she is taking from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, through which she will buy an overlock machine. With this investment, she will achieve a perfect finish and will increase the quality of her products because her goal is to consolidate her shop and finally continue her studies that allow her to stay updated continually. Although she has to face the challenge of not having enough working capital, she will soon achieve her dreams of prosperity.

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos es una humilde persona al cual le inculcaron excelente pensamientos y valores desde muy pequeño, un ejemplo de esto es algo que le decía su padre “siempre debes trabajar duro y con humildad para lograr tus sueños no hay otro camino”, creciendo con estos pensamientos Carlos se empleó en una gran empresa a la cual renuncio por que le iban a realizar un traslado lo que implicaría que apartarse de su familia.
Con el dinero de la liquidación y por consejo de sus amigos Carlos monto un negocio de distribución de pollo frito y apanado el cual muy orgullosamente trabaja junto a su esposa a quien vemos junto a Carlos en la foto y es que por más que pasen los años no se arrepiente de las decisiones que tomo ese día. 
Carlos solicita un crédito para remodelar, pintar y realizar algunos movimientos publicitarios para hacer de su negocio es más atractivo en el sector, con el resto de dinero quiere comprar surtido. Su gran sueño es posicionar su local generando mayores ventas para abrir otro punto de distribución solo pensando en asegurar los estudios universitarios de su hija.
texts.en:
Carlos is a modest person who was instilled with excellent ideas and values since he was small. An example of this is something his father used to tell him " always work hard with humility to achieve your dreams. There is no other way." Growing up with these thoughts Carlos went to work for a large company which he quit when he was going to be transferred which would have meant a separation from his family.

With the money he got on leaving and on the advise from his friends, Carlos opened a business selling fried and breaded chicken where he is very proud selling alongside his wife, as you can see in the photo. And as the years go by he has not regretted the decision he took that day.

Carlos is requesting a loan to remodel, paint and do some publicity to make his business more attractive in the market. With the rest of the money he wants to stock his business. His big dream is to position his business to make more sales so he can open another outlet thinking of assuring his son's university studies.

loans.use: to adapt, paint and improve his stand and create publicity and invest in his stock.

loans.name: Virigilia

texts.es: Es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, sin embargo por razones laborales desde hace 28 años se trasladó a Waspam, es docente, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada, tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 son adolescentes, que estudian su secundaria  y dos menores de edad. Su esposo es agricultor. Con el objetivo de construir una casa de concreto, solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales: cemento, hierro, zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es construir poco a poco su vivienda de concreto y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: Our borrower is from Puerto Cabezas and moved to Waspam 28 years ago for work.  She is a 46-year old teacher, married, with 5 children: three, in school and two, younger.  Her husband is a farmer.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to build a cement-construction house.  The investment will allow her to pay for the labor and materials--concrete, iron bar, roofing material, nails--she needs for the project.  For the future, she wants to finish the house and ensure that her children get good educations.

loans.use: to build a cement-construction house.

loans.name: Monica Johanna

texts.es:
Mónica es una joven madre de un niño de 2 años al cual ha procurado darle lo mejor con el fruto de su esfuerzo.
Ella trabajaba en un taller de confección en compañía de una amiga, pero hace un año decidió independizarse y comprar sus propias maquinas para iniciar con su producción y contratación con terceros.
Ella trabaja todos los días incansablemente para cumplir con sus contratos.
Hoy en día siente la necesidad de aumentar su producción y capital de trabajo, por eso solicita el crédito para comprar tela, hilos, cierres y demás elementos que le permitan desarrollar su actividad de una manera más eficiente sin perder el poco capital con el que ahora cuenta, adicional necesita una cortadora de tela.
Todos sus esfuerzos están dirigidos al sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Mónica is a young mother of a two-year-old son. For this reason, she tries to provide him the best through the fruit of her efforts.

Mónica worked at a sewing workshop with a friend. A year ago, she decided to become independent and bought her own machines so that she could start production and obtain third-party contracts. She works tirelessly every day in order to fulfill her contracts.

As of now, Mónica feels that she needs to increase her production and her operating capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy fabric, thread, scissors, and other supplies that will allow her to develop her business in a more efficient manner without having to use the little bit of capital that she has saved up. She also needs a fabric cutter.

All of her efforts are geared toward supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, scissors, and a fabric cutter.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Es originaria de Waspam, tiene 40 años de edad, casada, con 5 hijos, en edad escolar.  Cuenta con una experiencia de 11 años de dedicarse al arte culinaria, trabaja en el hospital del Municipio de Waspam, su esposo es agricultor. Con el objetivo de ampliar y mejorar su vivienda solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: 800 pies de madera, clavo, zinc y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es vivir en una vivienda más cómoda con su familia y apoyar en la educación sus hijos.
texts.en: Our borrower, from Waspam, is 40-years old and married with 5 school-aged children.  She has 11-years of cooking experience and works at the local hospital.  Her husband is a farmer.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to expand and improve her house.  The investment will allow her to pay for the labor and materials--800-feet of lumber, nails, roofing material--she needs for the project.  Her hopes for the future are to provide her children with a decent place to live and a good education.

loans.use: to expand and improve her house.

loans.name: Helario Ernesto

texts.es:
Helario de 49 años de edad, estudio hasta 5º grado, es casado, su esposa se dedica a vender productos agrícolas, tiene 2 hijos, que trabajan en la agricultura y también estudian. 

Helario posee una venta de productos de granos básicos en la casa desde hace 4 años y también es empleado como seguridad en un hotel, para llegar a su trabajo viaja en autobús. 

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar 20 pliegos de lámina y 20 bolsas de cemento, para reparar su vivienda. Sueña que su casa quede en buenas condiciones y que él y su familia tengan una mejor comodidad y vivan en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Helario is 49 years old, he studied until the 5th grade. He is married, his wife sells agricultural products. He has 2 children who work in agriculture and also study.

Helario sells basic grains out of his home for the past 4 years and also works as a security guard at a hotel which he travels to by bus.

He will use the loan to purchase 20 metal sheets and 20 bags of cement to repair his residence. He dreams for his home to be in good conditions so that him and his family become more comfortable and live in better conditions.

loans.use: purchase 20 metal sheets and 20 bags of cement

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina tiene 48 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Ella se gana la vida por medio de la venta de medicinas de forma ambulante desde hace 6 años. Es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar y junto a su esposo mantienen la economía de su familia. Reina desea construir un corredor en su vivienda y reparar la pila con lavadero dado que se encuentra deteriorada. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra polines, lamina, pernos, hierro, cemento, ladrillo y pago de mano obra necesaria para la construcción.
texts.en:
Reina is 48 years old and resides in her own home along with her husband and children. She has been making her living by selling medicines as a street vendor for the past six years. This is how she sustains her household and helps her husband with maintaining their family’s finances.

Reina wants to build a corridor in her home and repair the wash basin that has worn out. For this reason, she requested a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in the purchase of lumber, laminate sheets, bolts, iron, cement, and bricks. She will also pay for the necessary labor that is required for construction.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor in order to build a corridor and repair a wash basin.

loans.name: José Ernesto

texts.es: José tiene 21 años de  edad y habita en casa propia junto a su mamá y sus 5 hermanas. El se dedica a la compra y venta de frijoles de seda desde hace mucho tiempo y de esta forma colabora con la economía del hogar. Él es un joven con espíritu emprendedor y muy visionario. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio de venta de frjoles y así poder mejorar sus ventas e ingresos para apoyar un poco más a su familia.
texts.en: Jose, 21, lives with his mother and 5 brothers and sisters.  He has made a living buying and selling beans for several years and his income from the business helps to support his family.  He's an enterprising young man with an eye on the future.  He is applying for a FUSAI loan that he will use to buy beans for resale.  The investment will allow him to increase his sales and better help his family.

loans.use: to stock his food sales business.

loans.name: Selene Sonia

texts.es:
Selene es una joven soltera, vive en Ica con sus padres.
Es una joven muy emprendedora y luchadora, terminando el colegio estudió la carera profesional de secretariado y actualmente trabaja como Secretaria en una empresa prestigiosa de la zona.
Su sueño más grande es “Obtener su Título profesional” para que sus padres se sientan orgullosos de ella y para que pueda conseguir mayores ofertas de trabajo y así pueda sacar adelante a su familia. 
Selene está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que con la ayuda brindada ella podrá realizar sus trámites de Titulación y así, con un mejor trabajo dar un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Selene is a single and lives with her parents in Ica.  She is a hard-working, enterprising young woman who finished a secretarial course after high school and now works as a secretary for a prestigious local company.  She tells us that her next goal is "to earn a professional degree", something that would not only advance her own career but also be a source of pride for her parents.  
Selene is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support because she will be able to use this loan to pay her education costs.  The investment will ultimately provide her and her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay school costs.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jasmin works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. Jasmin is borrowing PHP 8,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Jasmin has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza, age 33, runs a fishing business to earn a living. Her business and her family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Liza has restarted her fishing business, and now she needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Liza and her husband have three children, two of whom attend school. Liza works very hard to provide for them.

She has requested a PhP 7,000 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home and to pay for construction labor.

Liza is committed to rebuilding her family's life after the devastation of the super typhoon. Her goal is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials with which to rebuild her family home, which was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, as well as to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Merlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines and also earns additional income from rice retailing and pig fattening. Merlyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell to customers.

Merlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mengie

texts.en:
Mengie is 34 years old and married. She has one child who is in school.

Mengie is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Mengie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Mengie has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Mengie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing. Melanie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fruits to sell to customers.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 31 years old and has three children. Liza is married and all her children are in school.

Liza is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Liza requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Liza has been in pig fattening for 3 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

Liza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies and seeds.

loans.name: Sigifredo De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Sigilfredo es un hombre de 64 años de edad el cual se desempeñó gran parte de su vida como agricultor y debido a ciertos problemas como la baja rentabilidad que daba el campo en ese tiempo, el conflicto con los grupos armados, abandono sus tierras y se aventuró en la ciudad donde trabaja todos los días de la semana en un pequeño puesto de comidas, donde vende productos típicos como: (papas rellenas, empanadas, panzerotis, gaseosas, pasteles de pollo, tintos, pandequesos entre otros), su esposa ha sido de vital importancia pues a pesar del cambio de vida que realizo ella siempre lo apoyo y Sigilfredo manifiesta que sin ella no hubiera podido acoplarse a tal cambio. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos como: (maíz, pollo, carne, servilleta, gaseosas) pues quiere seguir laborando hasta que su salud se lo permita dándole la mayor calidad de vida posible a su familia y poder tener un capital para disfrutar su vejez con una sonrisa que le demuestre que su vida valió la pena.
texts.en:
Sigilfredo is 64 years old. He spent the majority of his life as a farmer, but because of certain problems - like low profitability and conflict with armed groups - he abandoned his land and traveled to the city, where he now works seven days a week at a small food stall. There he sells typical dishes such as stuffed potatoes, empanadas, stromboli, sodas, chicken fritters, cheesy breads, and more. His wife has been of great help to him through this life transition. She has always supported Sigilfredo, and it turns out that without her, he would not have been able to adapt to such a change.

He requests a loan to purchase supplies such as corn, chicken, meat, napkins and sodas, because he wants to continue working until his no longer healthy enough to do so. He wants to give his family the best quality of life possible. He also wants to be able to have savings to enjoy his old age with a smile that shows that his life was worth all the struggle.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as meat, corn, napkins, chicken, sodas and coffee.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 40 years old and married with eight children. With six children currently in school, Ma. Luz works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Luz's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Ma. Luz has restarted her fishing business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Ma. Luz has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Ma. Luz is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic, age 33, saw her family home and her business destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business. She is a hard-working entrepreneur and is committed to regaining what her family lost. 

She and her husband have four children, three of whom attend school. 

Marivic has requested a PhP 5,000 housing loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so that she can build a house for her family.

Marivic has been with NWTF since 2012 in her efforts to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. 

Marivic's goal is to build and expand her business so as to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so that she can build a new house for her family, since their home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 40 años de edad, viven con su familia en el municipio de Santa Cruz La Laguna, departamento de Sololá, tiene 4 hijos; 2 ya se casados y viven en otro lado, 2 viven aún con él y lo ayudan en sus actividades, se dedica a comprar y vender maíz, se dedica a vender maíz porque es un producto que tiene mucha demanda y es uno de los principales alimentos de la gente, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, Juan solicita un crédito Q. 4,000.00 para compra maíz y luego vender, con las ganancias que le dejen esta actividad Juan quiere darles una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 40 years old and lives with his family in the town of Santa Cruz La Laguna in the Department of Sololá. He has four children. Two of them are married and live elsewhere. The other two children still live with him and help with his business activities.

Juan buys and sells corn. He sells corn because it is a product that is in great demand and is a staple food that is consumed among the people. Juan has been in this business for 10 years. He is requesting a loan of 4,000 GTQ so that he can buy corn that he can sell later. With the profit he earns from his business, Juan wants to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy corn to sell.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.es:
Yuri es soltera y vive en el Distrito de San Vicente con su familia.
Es una joven emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Desde hace 2 años trabaja en los campos agrícolas de toda la zona de Cañete.
El sueño más grande de Yuri es tener su propio negocio, es por ello que sale muy temprano a trabajar para poder ahorrar dinero y formar su empresa.
También quiere apoyar a su familia y ofrecerles un mejor nivel de vida para que puedan vivir tranquilos.
Yuri está agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que con la ayuda brindada ella podrá comprar una cama, para que pueda descansar mejor y despertar todos los días con muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Yuri is single and lives with her family in the District of San Vicente. She is an enterprising young woman who has tremendous drive to succeed. For the past two years, she has worked on farms in the District of Cañete. Her greatest wish is to have her own business. For this reason, she leaves early for work so that she can save enough money to start a business. She also wants to support her family and provide them a better standard of living so that they can live peacefully.

Yuri is grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, she will be able to buy a bed so that she can be more rested and wake up early every day. This will help her succeed in her work and move forward.

loans.use: to buy a bed for her home.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is 28 years old and a married man. He lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. Chantha has been working as a cook for more than 5 years. This type of job can allow him to make USD 5 per day. Chantha has 5 children, one of whom is already married.

Recently, Chantha requested a loan in the amount of USD 1500 to purchase a new motorbike for his daily use. In the future, he hopes to continue developing his job and thereby generate better yields and income. He is thankful for this useful loan and is willing to pay all the money back to Hattha Kaksekar on time.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay is from the village of Ou Chork, Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She is married and has five children. To make a living, she grows and harvests rice crops to sell in the local markets. She has been engaged in this business for many years and earns well from these activities. Farming is the primary source of income for her family.

Lay has been with Hattha Kaksekar for four loans already and she successfully repaid them.  As for this loan, she will use it to purchase farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds and to hire laborers to work on her farm. She hopes this loan will be granted to her and she promises to repay it timely as scheduled.

loans.use: to pay for farming supplies.

loans.name: Melencia

texts.en:
Melencia is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her direct selling business. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP for her to buy Vita Plus products like multivitamins, coffee, lotion and other products that she can sell. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Melencia hopes to have her own stall in the mall and dreams that her family is always in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy Vita Plus products like multivitamins, coffee, lotion and other products that she can sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is very thankful for the 50,000 PHP loan assistance extended to her as she was able to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial assistance with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elizabeth hopes that she can have her own Service Center. She also dreams of working abroad to give her family a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, undergarments, etc. to sell in her business.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
