Julie previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to buy herbal medicines and food supplements to sell. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a variety store and an apartment for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy Vita Plus products like food supplements and vitamins. She will also use the loan to buy grocery items for her variety store. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Julie dreams of expanding her market and hopes that her family will live a comfortable life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy Vita Plus products like food supplements and vitamins and grocery items for her variety store.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 26 years old and has two children. Maricel is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Maricel and her family survived super-typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Maricel is taking out a housing loan, amounting PHP 10,000, to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Maricel has been an Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) borrower since 2013 and she plans to recover through her food-vending business.

With your help, Maricel can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super-typhoon Haiyan. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 42 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Nora works very hard to provide for them.

Nora's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Nora has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Nora has taken a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Nora is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rodeline

texts.en:
Rodeline works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her fishing business and has been in NWTF since 2012. She is now requesting a PHP 8,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Rodeline will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Rodeline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is 42 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Rosalita works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalita's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Rosalita has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Rosalita has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Rosalita is committed to rebuilding her devastated life. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 60 years old and has a live-in partner with four children. 

Rosita and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Rosita is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 6,500 to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Rosita has been an NWTF borrower since 2010 and plans to recover through her fishing business.

With your help, Rosita can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Ella es Daniela, tiene 20 años, nació el 17 de septiembre, estudia en el instituto Campo Alto, Cosmetología y estética integral 1 Semestre, necesita el convenio con KIVA porque los recursos son escasos y los gastos básicos incluyen cubrir el pago de pensión mensual, desplazamiento todos los días sábados del lugar de residencia hasta el instituto, alimentación y los materiales para las prácticas. 
Los planes a futuro son ejercer la profesión como esteticista en las propias instalaciones en donde dedicara todos los conocimientos en beneficio al bienestar y buena salud de la comunidad en general.
texts.en:
This is Daniela. She is 20 years old and was born on September 17. She is studying Make-up and Beauty Therapy for one term in the Campo Alto High School, 

She needs the contract with KIVA because resources are scarce and her basic expenses include her monthly pension payment, travel every Saturday from her place of residence to the school, food and materials for practical sessions.

Her future plans are to work as a professional beautician from her own premises where all her knowledge will be dedicated to benefit the health and wellbeing of the community.

loans.use: to pay for a term of tuition

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more items for her "piaya" business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting another PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional 'piaya' (a flat unleavened bread filled with muscovado sugar) to increase her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to cover her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Melinda hopes to give her children a better future and dreams for her business to continue growing. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more 'piaya' (unleavened bread) to sell.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 27 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Christina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, cereals, etc. to sell.

Christina has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, cereals, etc.

In the future, Christina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, cereals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina is 46 years old and single. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Fedelina has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Fedelina has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 55 years old and married with two children.

Helen is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Helen has been in the pig fattening business for seven years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Helen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 39 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Liezel has a salted peanut vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like peanuts, cooking oil, salt, etc. for her business.

Liezel has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like peanuts, cooking oil, salt, etc. for her business

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 48 years old and the married mother of eleven children. Five of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Aida has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Aida has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad de 56 años de edad,  él no estudio ya que cuando ella creció en su lugar no había escuela y decidió dedicarse al trabaja de la jarcia, (elaboración de hamacas) ella es casada su esposo es agricultor. Son padres de 3 hijas, 1 está casada y las otras dos están solteras. 
 
Ella tiene 25 años experiencia en la elaboración de hamacas, ella aprendió este trabajo gracias a sus padres que se lo enseñaron, ella decidió dedicarse a este negocio ya que atreves de este trabajo ella obtiene sus ingresos, ya que ella lo realiza en su casa y así a la misma vez atendiendo las actividades de su hogar. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar insumos agrícolas, ya que esta es la época en la cual ellas hacen su milpa, comprara 5 sacos de fertilizantes,  2 bolsas de semilla, insecticidas y pago de mano de obra.  

Ella a futuro desea que su cultivo de maíz obtenga un buen rendimiento en cosecha, para tener alimentación para su familia, para darles una buena dieta alimenticia a sus hijos, y a la vez de lo que le sobra poder vender una parte de producto para sacar algunos ingresos para cubrir gastos en vestuario de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Natividad is 56 years old. She did not study since the place where she grew up did not have a school. Natividad devotes her time to working with rope (making hammocks). She is married and her husband is a farmer. They are the parents of three daughters. One is married and the other two are single.

Natividad has 25 years of experience in making hammocks. She learned this type of work from her parents. Natividad decided to pursue this business because she is able to generate an income from this work. She performs her work at home, which also allows her to complete the chores.

The loan she is requesting from CrediCampo will be used to buy farming supplies. For this season, these supplies will be used for a cornfield. She will buy five sacks of fertilizers, two bags of seeds, and insecticides. In addition, she will pay for labor.

In the future, she wants her corn crop to result in a good yield at harvest time. This will allow her to feed her family and provide a good diet for her children. She will also be able to sell part of her harvest so that she can earn some income for her daughters’ clothing expenses.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro de 73 años de edad, con mucho esfuerzo estudiaba por las tardes, después que trabajaba con su padre en la agricultura, logro un 3º grado;  pero después se le hizo difícil y no pudo seguir, su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos y sus hijos son mayores de edad y ya formaron su propia familia.

 Alejandro se a dedicado a trabajar la agricultura desde que estaba muy pequeño, ya que su padre se dedicaba a esta misma actividad en compañía de sus hermanos mayores, hoy en día cultiva 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz en época de invierno tiene que trasladarse al lugar de trabajo para  salir temprano de donde tiene las tierras donde labora, también se dedica a trabajar con bueyes los utiliza cuando lo buscan para trasladar un producto cuando a lugares donde no pueden entrar  vehículos, esto lo hace en todo tiempo siempre y cuando lo soliciten.


Los fondos del crédito serán destinados para la preparación de la tierra para cultivo y la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, necesarios para el trabajo agrícola.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando para  mantener a su esposa hasta donde sea posible.
texts.en:
Alejandro, age 73, made a great effort to study in the afternoons, after he had finished working with his father in the fields. He was able to complete third grade, but later it became difficult for him, and he could not continue.  His life companion is a housekeeper. Their children are grown, and have already formed their own families. 

Alejandro has worked in agriculture since he was very young, as his father did the same work, accompanied by his older brothers. Today, he cultivates corn on 14,000 square meters (about 3.5 acres) during the winter season.  He has to travel to the work area, leaving early for the place where he has the land that he works. He also works with oxen; he uses them when he is asked to transport produce in places that vehicles are unable to enter. He does this anytime, whenever he is asked.  

The funds from the loan will be used to prepare the land for planting, and to purchase compost and fertilizers necessary for agricultural work. His desire is to continue working in order to provide for his wife as much as possible.

loans.use: to prepare the land for planting, and to purchase compost and fertilizers necessary for agricultural work.

loans.name: Nixon

texts.en:
This is Nixon, 39 years old and married with one kid. He is very devoted to his family. Nixon is a very hardworking person; he has been engaged in a farming business for nine years. 

Nixon is asking a loan amounting PHP 35,000 to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for his farming business so that he can sustain the needs of his family. 

He dreams that he can save enough money for the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for his farming business

loans.name: Deogracia

texts.en:
Deogracia is very thankful for the loan assistance extended to her as she was able to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and other expenditures. She looks forward to this financial assistance with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Deogracia hopes that her regular customers will increase in number and dreams of living a well-off and sustainable life with her children. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Roleza

texts.en:
Roleza is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Roleza has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

Roleza has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 48 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Teresita has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Teresita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Redgin

texts.en:
Redgin is 39 years old and married, with four children who are all in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Redgin is borrowing PHP 50,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Redgin has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mildreda

texts.en:
Mildreda is 47 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Mildreda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like soft drinks, chocolate drinks, juice, shampoo, sanitary pads, diapers, etc. to sell.

Mildreda has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, chocolate drinks, juice, shampoo, sanitary pads, diapers, etc.

In the future, Mildreda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like soft drinks, chocolate drinks, juice, shampoo, sanitary pads, diapers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ma. Jenny

texts.en:
Ma. Jenny is 42 years old and married with eight children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.

Ma. Jenny is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for two years, and also earns additional income from selling sand and gravel.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and been in NWTF since 2012.

She is now requesting a PHP 8,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Apolonia will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Apolonia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Chineta

texts.en:
Chineta is 49 years old and has five children. She is married, and two of her children are currently in school.

Chineta and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Chineta is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She has been an NWTF borrower since 2009, and plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Chineta can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. 

In future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Geneve

texts.en:
Geneve works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her food vending business and as she has been with NWTF since 2009 she is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Geneve will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Geneve would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Felista

texts.en: Felista is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a profitable place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 61 years old but she is single. Elisa is very loving daughter and sister to her family. When she was young she saved money for her future and she worked hard for her dream to build a house for her parents. 

Now that she doesn't have her own family, she focuses herself on her sister and brothers' needs. And to help her sister and brothers in their school she is asking for a loan amounting PHP 20,000 to buy farm supplies to have additional income.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 57 years old, married with three kids. She loves to serve her family most especially when she cooks food for them. She feels relaxed when she sees her family happy. 

Lately, Norma has problems with her farm due to the bad weather conditions. Norma is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 40,000 to buy fertilizer and a sack of seed for her farm business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow her farming business.

loans.name: Sherry

texts.en:
Sherry is a married woman. She has 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sells drinks. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are adults. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of stock and seasonal changes. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of drinks. Her business goal is to open a depot within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a supplier. This is her third loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of drinks.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a Kiva borrower. He has five children. He describes himself to be creative.

William operates a restaurant where he cooks food to sell. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

William will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food for sale. His business goal is to expand within five years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life. William will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be serious in business. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. Her business goal is to improve business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
This is Lilian. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her tailoring business. She has also utilized the loan to buy additional products for her direct selling business, likewise pay for more stocks of dried fish as her secondary sources of income. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting another PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy a buy additional supplies of raw materials and other products needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lilian hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams of giving her children a better future. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
This is Ariel, 26, resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Arlene, a vendor and they have children. He and his wife are managing their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ariel operates a market stall. He sells fruits and vegetable products in the community market. He buys quantity of fruits and vegetables and sells it per kilo. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruits and vegetables to expand his product inventory.

Ariel hopes to have another stall and dreams that his family will always be in good health. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more varieties of fruits and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 51 years old and has three children. Remedios is married and has two children who are in school.

Remedios is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Remedios requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Remedios has been raising pigs for 24 years now, and has borrowed 27 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Remedios would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 51 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Elizabeth's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business buying and selling scrap materials and is committed to regain what she lost. Elizabeth is taking out a PHP 9,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Elizabeth has been with NWTF since 2010 in her pursuit of her aim to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Elizabeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 58 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur

She has a business selling seashells in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years. 

Virginia requested a 50,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more empty seashells to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more empty seashells to sell.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia is 51 years old and married with one child. With one child still in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Her business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Ignacia has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a 10,000 PHP housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Ignacia is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 61 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for nine years. She sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business and to repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lolita is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lolita's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her pig-fattening business and is committed to regain what she lost. Lolita is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Lolita has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit of her goal to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea is 48 years old and married with four children. With one child currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Her business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Irenea has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Irenea has taken a 5,000 PHP housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Irenea is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Mary is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary has been farming sugarcane for five years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 43 years old and married with two children. Judith works very hard to provide for them.

Judith's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Judith has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Judith has taken a PHP 7,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Judith is committed to rebuild her devastated life and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 42 years old, married and has four children. 

Violeta is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Violeta requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to raise.

Violeta has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 40 years old, married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nenita has a general store business in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like snack foods, laundry soap and beverages.

Nenita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, laundry soap and beverages.

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en:
A $1,000 is offered to Madalena to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as oils, water, sugar, salt, milk, noodles and coffee. She has been involved in her business activities since 2009. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Madalena independent because she can be responsible for herself and help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy oils, water, sugar, salt, milk, noodles and coffee

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorna is 36 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Lorna's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what she lost. Lorna is taking out a PHP 6,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Lorna has been with NWTF since 2011 in her pursuit of her aim to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Hello World!!! Meet Joan, a farmer living in the Kitale area of North Rift where she lives with her husband and four children. She loves and enjoys doing farming, as it is her main source of income. On her farm, she has dairy cows, poultry, maize, and vegetables, which are her main source of income. Her hobby in farming is milking her dairy cows, while her challenge is looking after the cows during dry weather.

Joan says that this loan will improve her dairy farming because she will be able to construct a dairy unit that will be good for her dairy cows. With this, she will earn more from her cows and improve the liters of milk that the cows produce.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Getrudes

texts.en:
Getrudes is applying for a loan of $ 800 from TRM (TubaRaiMetin). She is 33 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as a refrigerator, fanta, coca cola, sprite, sagiko, beer, water, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, bread and slippers. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future. 

Getrudes is living in a town near by the school; her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people come to buy including students.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, fanta, coca cola, sprite, sagiko, beer, water, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, bread and slippers.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 42 years old. He is a farmer while his spouse is a retail store owner. They have two children. 

He plants and harvests rice crops for income. His spouse also helps him with the farming business. 

Now, he will plant rice and wants to increase his crop production, but he needs additional capital. He is asking for additional capital of 50,000 PHP to buy fertilizers (urea) and insecticides used in farming. These items will help nourish his crops and attain a plentiful harvest someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers (urea) and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary is a 41-year-old resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nilo and a mother of one child. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. She works hard to save for her child's future.

Mary Rose operates a community pharmacy store. She sells basic medicine and vitamins to the community. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also manage her own variety store for added income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she requests 10,000 PHP. She will utilize the loan to buy additional stocks of medicine and groceries to expand her product inventory. She expects an increase in her business income as she expands her business.

Mary Rose hopes to be able to open another branch soon and wants her child to finish school. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work  and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy medicine and groceries to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 38-year-old lady. She is married and blessed with four children. She has been in the farming activity for the last three years. She earns a monthly income of 600,000 shillings, which she uses to support her family. 

This is her third loan with Vision Fund Kenya. She plans to use the loan to pay for farm labor and to buy farm inputs like seedlings and fertilizers.

She plans to use the profits to educate her children and expand the farm.

loans.use: to pay for farm labour and buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man with 4 children between the ages of  7 and 13. He describes himself as optimistic. 

He operates a retail business where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a populated area and he has frequent customers. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. He will use 40,000 KES to buy meat. He hopes that in the future, he will have good cash flow.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia, 43, is a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nataniel, a van driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to  provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Ofelia sells different kinds of soft drinks and also has a variety store to sell inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her to continue business operations, she requests 15,000 PHP to buy different kinds of soft drinks. She will also use the loan to buy groceries for her variety store.

Ofelia hopes to have more customers and dreams that her family will always have good health. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of soft drinks to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Bayarsuren

texts.en:
Bayarsuren, 35 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has provided taxi services to local people since 2010 and has accumulated a vast amount of experience. His wife is a Mongolian language teacher and has been teaching at the local school since 2007. 

Their daughter is 12 years old and studies at the 6th grade. Their son is 2 years old and goes to kindergarten.

He requests  2,500,000 MNT to purchase planks to complete a fence and extend his house. After he completes the fence  and house, he can provide the family with amenities and comfort. The house extension will improve his heating system  and the winter coal consumption will be reduced.

The borrower is a hard worker and plans for his family's bright future.

loans.use: to build an extension to his house.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet lives at Dalaoig with her family. She and her spouse are farmers. They plant and harvest rice to sell. They used their income for family’s expenses and revolving capital in the business. She wanted to improve her income and that is why she is asking for additional capital of P30,000 to buy pesticides, herbicides and fertilizers used in farming. Someday, with good crop production and harvest, she will save more funds and attain financial stability.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, herbicides and fertilizers used in farming

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
This is Arlene, a resident of Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Arielito, and together, they manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Arlene operates a food stall. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.

In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during the evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking food for one to two people when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than the raw food ingredients. 

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen foods.

Arlene hopes to grow her business and dreams to have a good life for her and family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and other products needed for her business.

loans.name: Veverly

texts.en:
Veverly is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her loan helped, not just with her business, but also with the education of her children. Her income from the business is assisting with their everyday expenses. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She also has an electronic loading station for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. 

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Veverly dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes that her family is always in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is a farmer and she is raising hogs, too.  She had two children. Her spouse is her partner in managing the business. In the farming business, they plant and harvest rice to sell. They also pay for laborers who help them in the business. She applied for loan of P20,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pay laborers in farming. This loan will be a great help in maintaining good nutrition to crops. Someday, with proper nutrition and maintenance, she will harvest crops abundantly. She will save additional revenue for the hog raising business as an additional source of income. She hopes to continue managing her businesses for the overall welfare of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pay laborers in farming.

loans.name: Magret

texts.en:
Magret is 43 years old, married and blessed with five children; all attend school.  She has been in this business for 12 years and earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

She has applied for her first loan of 10,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya and plans to use the entire loan to buy more potatoes to sell. Magret will use the anticipated profits to pay her children's school fees.

She hopes to expand her business and provide basic needs to  her family.

loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries and beverages.

loans.name: Ma. Katielyn

texts.en:
Ma. Katielyn works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her fish vending business and has been in NWTF since 2010. She requests a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs so she could build a house for her family.

Ma. Katielyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.  
With your help, Ma. Katielyn will be able to rebuild her devastated life.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a 53-year-old married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur with her fishing business in the Philippines. Norma has been in this business for twenty-two years.

Norma requested 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

 In the future, Norma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Victoria's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Ma. Victoria has restarted her fish vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Ma. Victoria has taken a 7,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

Ma. Victoria is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

loans.name: Rocel

texts.en:
Rocel works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her fish vending business and has been with Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) since 2012. She is now requesting an 8,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Rocel will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Ronora

texts.en:
Ronora is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ronora is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ronora's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what she lost.  Ronora is taking out a PHP 9500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Ronora has been with NWTF since 2010 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Ronora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her general store business and been in NWTF since 2013 and is now requesting a PHP 9500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Rosalie will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.  In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is 36 years old and married with five children; three attend school. Rosalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalyn's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Rosalyn has restarted her food vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Rosalyn has taken a  6,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

Rosalyn is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 59 years old and married with five children. Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, shampoo, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Maria to improve her business.  She opened her business in 2011 with her own working capital of $100. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store selling flowers.  Maria is generating a good income from selling her things from the business.
She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buying and selling flowers

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга уже около года занимается торговлей овощами и фруктами. Она арендует точку недалеко от своего дома. Раз в неделю приторговывает на местном рынке. 
Ольга планирует использовать сумму в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить помидоры, огурцы, клубнику под реализацию, а также прилавок для киоска для большего удобства торговли. Со временем Ольга планирует развивать свой бизнес и дальше, расширяя при этом и ассортимент товара. Она, возможно, откроет еще одну стационарную точку.
texts.en:
Olga has worked with selling vegetables and fruit for around a year already. She rents a sales point not far from her home. Once per week she trades at the local market. Olga plans to use the amount of 10,000 hryvnia to purchase tomatoes, cucumbers and strawberries for selling and also a counter for her kiosk to make it more convenient to sell. 

Currently Olga plans to develop her business and further expand the range of goods. If possible, she will open another point of sales.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, cucumbers and strawberries for sale, as well as a counter for her kiosk

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.ru:
С момента получения предыдущего кредита бизнес Юрия значительно вырос. Точку на рынке он закрыл, взял в аренду магазин в центре города, расширил ассортимент товара. Более того, в семье появилось пополнение — родился второй ребенок. Семье намного легче сейчас жить, так как пропорционально вырос и доход. 
В этот раз Юрию необходима сумма в 24 000 гривен для того, чтобы переконструировать крышу собственного дома и построить мансардные комнаты для своих детей. Юрий стремится создать для семьи самые лучшие условия проживания, какие только сможет.
texts.en:
On receipt of his previous loan, Yuryi's business has grown considerably. He closed the sales point at the market and rented a store at the center of the city, and expanded his assortment of goods. He also got an addition to his family - his second child was born. It is now a bit easier for the family to lives, as their income grew proportionally. 

This time Yuryi needs an amount of 24,000 hryvnia in order to reconstruct the roof of his house and build rooms in the attic for his children. Yuryi strives to give his family as good living conditions as he possibly can.

loans.use: to reconstruct the roof of his house and build rooms in the attic for his children

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена живет и работает в Мелитополе. Она торгует на местном рынке, у нее есть свой киоск. Елена реализует мужскую одежду в ассортименте. 
Дополнительные средства в размере 32 000 гривен нужны Елене для того, чтобы закупить сезонный товар под реализацию летом.  В дальнейшие планы Елены входит развитие бизнеса и улучшение благосостояния семьи за счет стабильного роста своего небольшого предприятия.
texts.en:
Yelena lives and works in Melitopol. She trades at the local market, she has her own sales point. Yelena sells a range of men's clothing. 

Yelena needs additional funds of 32,000 hryvnia in order to purchase seasonal goods for selling this summer. Yelena's future plans include the development of her business and increasing the well-being of the family through a stable growth of her small business.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing for selling in the summer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 44-year-old married woman who has three children. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes and also sells vitenge (an African garment). She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a vibrant place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a stock of vitenge. Her business goal is to own a tailoring school within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of kitenge (an African garment) for her business.

loans.name: Jerusa

texts.en:
Jerusa is a married woman with 3 children. She operates a retail business to sell clothes. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. 

Her business is located in a vibrant area and she has all types of customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. She will use the 40,000 KES to restock clothes. 

Her business goal is to own a boutique within 5 years. This is her seventh loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
This is Celso, 51, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. He is married to Margarita, his business partner, and they have three children. He and his wife manage their own household while operating the business. He is working hard to continually provide income to meet their everyday expenses.

Celso operates a "Piso-Net" business and also owns a printing business. Piso Net basically merges computer and arcade rental services so customer can pay for services by inserting coins into the machine. There is more need than before for services like these as customers’ demand increases. His main patrons are students, who require his services for school assignments. He also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume or for office documentation as well as people who just love to surf the net and access social networks. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 450 in profit every day.

To help him continue operation of his business, he is requesting a PHP 60,000 loan. He will use the loan to buy additional Piso Net units and printing materials for his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.

Celso hopes to expand his business and dreams for his children to finish all their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies for his business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in meeting her family's personal, household and business expenses.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Aida dreams that her business will last for a long time and hopes that her family stays in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Angelito

texts.en:
Angelito, 49, is a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is single and works hard to provide for his everyday needs. He  helps his parents and siblings financially.

Angelito maintains a tricycle business. He owns and drives one Tricycle (motor cycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He works from early in the morning until late in the evening. There are times when he drives late evening until the wee hours in order to earn a bigger profit. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 PHP in his transportation business every day.

He requests 10,000 PHP to help continue his business. He will use the loan to buy motorcycle parts to maintain his tricycle unit. He has to keep his unit in good condition in order to have a regular income and meet the daily needs of his family. 

Angelito dreams of expanding his business and having an apartment. He hopes that he will always be in good health. He meets weekly with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work  and  draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his Tricycle unit.

loans.name: Great

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 28-year-old Great from Mutare. She is married with two children, one attending school. She also cares for one other dependent. Great runs a retail business selling processed timber. The business has been in operation for three years. She says the main challenge she faces is a shortage of structural timber materials from suppliers. Great has requested a loan of $1,500 to buy logs for timber processing. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's general welfare. In the future, Great plans to own a hardware shop.

loans.use: to buy logs for timber processing

loans.name: Shinning Stars Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe!  Ketsina, 48, from Mutare is widowed with three children, one attending school.  Ketsina runs a retail business selling jerseys, winter jackets and blankets. The business has been in operation for 14 years. She says the main challenge she faces are late payments from clients who buy on credit. Ketsina's group has requested a loan of $2,100 and her portion of $700 will be used to purchase jerseys, winter jackets and blankets for resell during this winter season. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's general welfare. In the future, Ketsina plans to own her own boutique shop. Ketsina is a member of Shinning Star group.

loans.use: to buy clothes, blankets and plates

loans.name: Celia Rosa

texts.es:
A lo largo de su vida, Celia ha tratado de encontrar una actividad que le permita tener ingresos estables y le dé la oportunidad de compartir más tiempo con su familia y es así como se decidió a montar una tienda general hace aproximadamente 5 años con la cual ha logrado sostener a su familia y estilo de vida.
Ella vende productos de la canasta familiar y uno que otro producto de limpieza y para el hogar.
Ella desea darle un impulso a su negocio y consolidarlo de una manera eficaz ofreciendo productos oportunamente y de calidad, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de surtido como abarrotes, granos frituras, entre otros.
Así podrá fortalecer su negocio y continuara con su actividad.
texts.en:
Throughout her life, Celia has tried to find an occupation that would allow her to have a stable income, and also give her the opportunity to spend more time with her family. This is why she decided to open a general store about 5 years ago, and with it she has been able to support her family and her lifestyle.

She sells family food staples and some household cleaning products. She wants to move her business forward efficiently, and strengthen it, offering quality seasonal products. This is the reason that she is requesting a loan: to purchase supplies such as groceries, grains for making fritters, and similar items. In this way, she will strengthen her business and carry on with her work.

loans.use: to purchase family food staples to stock her store.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 53 years old and married with four children. Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Rosita has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Rosita has taken a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

Rosita is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future, would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy jerseys, winter jackets and blankets.

loans.name: Elena

texts.ru:
Елена — жительница юго-востока Украины. Занимается торговлей на рынке уже 15 лет. Торгует пряжей и принадлежностями для вязки. Торговое место у нее собственное. 
Елена планирует закупить пряжу разного качества и состава на продажу на сумму в 15 000 гривен. Елене нравится работать с данным товаром и она хочет развивать свое дело и дальше, вкладывая полученные от реализации товара средства в последующее развитие своего предприятия.
texts.en:
Elena is a resident of the south-east of Ukraine. She has worked with trade at the market for 15 years already. She sells yearn and knitting accessories. She owns her own sales point.

For the amount of 15,000 hryvnia, Elena plans to purchase yarn of different quality and composition for sale. Elena likes to work in this business. She  would like to expand her activity and further invest the income from the selling goods in expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies of yarn

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина живет и работает в Мелитополе. Она торгует на крупном местном рынке женской обувью. Торговое место Ирина арендует. Опыт ее работы в этой сфере составляет 4 года. Ирина — молодая и трудолюбивая, намерена последовательно развивать бизнес и дальше. 
На сумму в 20 000 гривен Ирина планирует закупить женскую сезонную обувь в ассортименте для последующей реализации на рынке.
texts.en:
Irina lives and works in Melitopol. She sells women's shoes at a large local market. Irina rents her sales point. She has four years of experience with working in this area. 

Irina is young and hardworking. She intends to successively develop her business further. For the amount of 20,000 hryvnia, Irina plans to purchase an assortment of women's seasonal shoes in order to sell at the market.

loans.use: to purchase women's summer shoes for selling at the market

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a married man; he has two children. He operates a retail business where he sells fish, and he has been involved in this business for nine years. His business is located in a good area, and he has all types of customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a shortage of funds. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. 

His business goal is to reach higher heights within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, Ruth has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells raw food. 

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase for more raw foods to sell, and will help Ruth to generate greater profits and improving on her food selling business. 

Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a wholesale shop. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase for more raw foods to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 41-year-old gentleman who is married to Dorcas. Together, they have two school-going children. He has been running a general shop for the last 11 years and makes a monthly profit of KES 17,500. 

He has applied for his fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya to purchase more sugar, fat, and wheat flour to sell. He plans to use the anticipated income to expand his business and educate his children.

 He hopes to have a bright future with a lot of success and also hopes to educate his children to a high level.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, fat, and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Raymund

texts.en:
This is Raymund, 36, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Angielyn, a housekeeper and mother to their children. Raymund and his wife manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income to meet their everyday expenses.

Raymund operates a rolling (mobile) store which is basically a small household product store. He sells plastic containers, dippers, pails plastic flowers, and basins to the local neighborhood. He drives the rolling store within the local community to sell the products. He earns income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

To help him continue operation of his business, he is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. He will use the loan to buy pails, plasticware, hangers, clothes pins, plastic flowers, and other items to expand his product inventory. 

Raymund dreams that his business will last for a long time and hopes to live a simple yet happy life. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for different products like pails, brushes, plates, hangers, and other household products.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
This is Marietta, 44, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Sabas and she has children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Marietta operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. Seasonal orders for clothing like uniforms and such occur all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 19, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other items needed in her business. 

Marietta hopes to have more customers and dreams that her family will be always in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Sinoun's Group

texts.en:
A villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sinoun is 31 years old and a mother of three kids who are still in school. For her entire family, rice farming is the only source of income to cover the daily basic needs in her household. 

This is the second cycle loan for Sinoun and her joint borrower;  the same group of two is requesting the same loan amount of 700,000 KHR with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

She has repaid back her past loan completely, and it has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle in a gradual pace. 

As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fee and to buy fertilizer for her crop. 

She hopes that she can boost her yield better than last year so she can gain more income.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fee and to buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is requesting a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her business such as wheat and bread. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600.  She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future

loans.use: To buy wheat and bread

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is a 39-year-old housekeeper. She is from the village Ikatro and lives with her husband, son, and grandfather. The family is slightly involved in agricultural activities, harvesting products only for family use. Khatuna's husband and son are private artisans, filling private orders that generate approximately 300-400 GEL monthly. As the existing income isn't enough for family of four, Khatuna decided to start her own business to do her bit for the family's welfare. She has already built a little store in her home territory and now requests a loan to purchase needed products to open her general store. Khatuna will have various kinds of food and home products and will serve clients herself. 
Khatuna hopes she will earn a good income and improve the standard of living for her family members in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase needed products for a general store.

loans.name: Rusjin

texts.en:
Rusjin has a live-in partner with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rusjin is 41 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Her house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what she lost. She is taking out a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Rusjin has been with NWTF since 2010 in her effort to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
