texts.es: Keren tiene 28 años de edad y trabaja como empleada doméstica desde hace dos años. Keren es una mujer muy trabajadora y comprometida con su familia. Ella habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 11 y 12 años de edad. Keren y su esposo  dieron inicio a su vivienda a base de ladrillo hace algún tiempo y por falta de recursos económicos no la han logrado terminar. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro para terminar la vivienda.
texts.en:
Keren is 28 years old and has worked as domestic help for two years. Keren is a very hard-working woman and is committed to her family. She lives in her own house, along with her husband and their two children, who are 11 and 12.

Keren and her husband began their house with a brick foundation some time ago, but due to lack of economic resources, they have not been able to finish it. For this reason, they are requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of brick, cement, sand, and iron to finish the house.

loans.use: to purchase brick, cement, sand, and iron to finish her house

loans.name: Sieb's Group

texts.en:
A resident from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Sieb is a 38-year-old mother of two kids. One is under-aged for school and one is in school. 

She has only one business, rice farming, to generate a decent income for her family. New with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she forms a group of two to obtain a loan of 500,000 KHR each. 

As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for a plowing fee and to buy fertilizer for her crop. 

She highly believes that she can gain yield with a good selling price in return.

loans.use: To pay for the plowing fee, and to buy fertilizer

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan es un productor que reside en una pequeña comunidad del norte de Nicaragua. Desde muy joven se dedica a la caficultura. Es padre de tres niños, a los cuales les enseña el alto valor que tiene la caficultura para muchas familias en su comunidad y en el país, al ser uno de los principales rubros de la economía nacional. Además del café, él cultiva musáceas como actividad económica.

Cada año. Juan ha venido estableciendo nuevas áreas de café. Para este ciclo está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar los insumos y abonos que requiere su cafetal para mejorar su nutrición, y obtener así una mayor producción e ingresos para su familia.

Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de su familia, y proveer a sus hijos todo lo que necesiten para que puedan abrirse oportunidades que les permita obtener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Juan is a coffee producer who lives in a small community in the northern part of Nicaragua. Since he was very young, he has farmed coffee. He is the father of three, to whom he has taught the great value coffee farming holds for many families in his community and in the country. Coffee farming is one of the main pieces of the national economy. In addition to coffee, Juan also farms musáceas (banana-type plants) for income.

Each year, Juan has come to establish more coffee crops. For this loan cycle, he is requesting a loan that will allow him to purchase supplies and fertilizers that his coffee plantation needs for better nutrition. This will also help yield greater production and more income for his family.

His goal is to improve his family's living conditions and to provide his children with all they need so they can pursue opportunities that will allow them to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and fertilizers that he needs for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Favio Alexander

texts.es:
Favio es un pequeño productor de café de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Tiene 36 años y desde pequeño ha estado relacionado con la agricultura. Antes se dedicaba al cultivo de granos básicos, pero estos rubros no son muy rentables dice Favio por lo que desde hace unos 5 años se dedica a la producción de café.

Este pequeño emprendedor ha venido mejorando la productividad de su finca, logrando el último ciclo una producción de 50 quintales de café oro en 3.2 hectáreas. Para este año, él se ha propuesto incrementar ese rendimiento, para ello está solicitando un crédito que le permita garantizar en tiempo y forma las actividades de mantenimiento de su cafetal que incluyen la compra de insumos y fertilizantes requeridos por su plantación.

Su dedicación al trabajo y las condiciones climáticas donde se ubica su pequeña finca, considera son factores clave para mejorar las condiciones de su familia, que es una de sus metas.
texts.en:
Favio is a small coffee producer in the northern zone of Nicaragua. He is 36 years old, and since he was young, he has been involved with agriculture. Before, he farmed basic grains, but those crops are not very profitable, says Favio. This is why he has been farming coffee for five years.

This small businessman has been improving his plantation's productivity. In the last growing cycle, he produced 50 quintals (hundredweights) of cafe oro on 3.2 hectares. For this year, he has proposed increasing this output. To do this, he is requesting a loan that will allow him to guarantee the time and ability to do maintenance activities needed on his plantation, which include purchasing the required supplies and fertilizers.

Favio's dedication to his work and the climate conditions where his small plantation is located are the key factors for improving conditions for his family. Improving conditions for his family is one of Favio's goals.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and fertilizers needed for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch is 64 years old and a villager from Takeo province. She strives for a living via rice farming, and raising pigs and cows. This is the main source of income to support her big family consisting of six kids. She has occupied the current business for ages. Touch used to be a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and has repaid the past loan completely. Now, she wants to focus on her daughter’s education instead. Therefore, she requests a new loan in order to pay school fees for her daughter who currently is pursuing a bachelor’s degree majoring to be a doctor. Touch hopes that her daughter can become a doctor.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia está muy feliz y agradecida con la cooperativa COMIXMUL por haberla apoyado con la compra de abonos, insecticidas y fertilizantes para abonar y proteger sus cultivos de papa. Gracias a su primer financiamiento la producción obtenida fue de 45 quintales de papa de primera calidad y 20 de segunda calidad logrando un total de producción de 65 quintales producto que pudo vender a muy buen precio con los habitantes de la zona, intermediarios y demás que sobreviven del comercio. La ganancia obtenida dio lugar a poder cancelar con mucha satisfacción su primer financiamiento aunque con un poco de atraso pues el precio no era el mejor en el tiempo que ella se animó reteniendo está un poco mientras el precio subía y así no tener perdida ya que este varía de un día para otro. Hoy nuevamente Virginia ha decidido solicitar su segundo financiamiento con el cual podrá afinar los últimos detalles de preparación de tierra para nueva mente cultivar papa de primera calidad logrando de esta forma mayores incrementos en la producción y mayores ingresos económicos para el bienestar de su familia ya que ella espera ser apoyada nuevamente y cumplir sus metas, propósitos y sueños.
texts.en:
Virginia is very happy and grateful to the cooperative Comixmul for having supported her purchase of compost, insecticides, and fertilizers to enrich and protect her potato plants. Thanks to her first loan, she obtained 45 quintals [~4500 lbs] of potato of highest quality and 20 [2000 lbs] quintals of second quality, yielding a total production of 65 quintals [6500 lbs] that she could sell at a very good price to area residents, middlemen, and others who work in commerce.

The income obtained enabled her to pay back her first loan with much satisfaction, although a little behind schedule. The price [of potatoes] varies from one day to another, and it was not best during the time that she would have liked, so she held back for a short time while the price rose to avoid losing money. 

Now Virgina has again decided to request her second loan, with which she will be able to perfect the final details of soil preparation to again cultivate high quality potatoes. In this way she will achieve better improvements in her production and more income for the well-being of her family. She hopes to be supported once again to fulfill her goals, intentions, and dreams.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, compost, and herbicide to help her potato plants

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en: Mzia is a 50-year-old, woman from Sabue village. She lives with her husband and son. The only breadwinner in their family is Mzia, who works hard to make financial stability for her family members. She works as a private worker at any kind of agricultural activity and is paid according to the work done. However, the income is insignificant to cover all daily expenses of the three-member family. The family lives below the poverty line. Mzia has a great desire to somehow improve their lifestyle and increase her monthly income. That's why she requested a loan and wants to open a mini-grocery store near her house. She claimed a loan of 2,000 GEL to purchase stocks of products and was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, the start-up program that enables poor people like Mzia to start or re-start businesses. The family's living conditions will significantly increase, as Mzia will have a stable source of income and not depend only seasonal activities. She will be really grateful for the help and regards Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of products for her grocery store.

loans.name: 11 Thôn 1 Hoa Lộc Group

texts.en:
Như is 44 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 11 Thôn 1 Hoa Lộc solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

Như works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Như has been involved in this business for 5 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her are illnesses. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in future.

In 2012, Như joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Như has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Như hopes for her children to graduate from college, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Paulyne

texts.en:
Paulyne is a 36-year-old single lady and a mother of two children aged 14 and eight years. She has been operating an M-PESA business for the last two years and makes a monthly profit of KES 25,000. 

She has applied for her second of loan of KES 40,500 with Visionfund Kenya to add to her business float and to buy more air time cards for sale. She plans to use the anticipated income to expand her business and educate her children.
	
She hopes to have a bright future and also to educate her children to a high level of education.

loans.use: to add to her business float and to buy more air time cards for sale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells mobile phone accessories. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of phone accessories. His business goal is to own a big shop within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of phone accessories.

loans.name: Pilato

texts.en:
Pilato is a 39-year-old married woman and has been blessed with five children and a supportive husband who adds additional income to their family. Pilato operates a livestock-rearing and a dairy farming business which has been in operation for 17 years, earning herself an income of KSh 9,800 monthly.

Pilato is now servicing her first loan with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the amount to buy additional and healthy feed for her livestock in order to meet the expectations of her clients.  

She plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and be able to further their education to higher levels. She also hopes to have growth in her business and live a stable life.

loans.use: To buy additional and healthy feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Aghunik

texts.en:
Aghunik is from Shirakamut village of the Lori region. She lives there with her husband and two sons (her granddaughter is in the photo).
 
Aghunik's elder son is a migrant worker. To take care of the family's needs, Aghunik is extensively engaged in agribusiness. She breeds cattle, livestock of sheep and hens, and cultivates barley and potatoes. With the help of her sons and husband, she sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of the family's income. 

Land cultivation is the most essential component in Aghunik's agribusiness. She currently wants to expand it a little bit. To reach that goal, she needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase barley seeds. As this is Aghunik's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

Aghunik and her family will be very thankful to the lenders for their goodwill and support in collecting the needed amount of the loan.

loans.use: to pay for barley seeds for land cultivation.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Hello Kiva! Here is Peter, a young and energetic farmer, living in the rich highland area of Siongiroi. He lives with his wife and two children. He has been doing farming for three years. He produces and sells milk, and eggs, which he gets from his farm; he also has a retail business. His main hobby in farming is dairy farming. Peter has a passion for being the best milk producer in the area, and that’s why he applied for this KIVA loan. This is because he wants to buy a dairy cow that will lead to an increase in milk production. This will help him to expand his farm and to give his children a better education.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kibet

texts.en: Kibet is a 40-year-old man. He describes himself to be viable. He operates a retail business where he repairs shoes. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His business is located in an area fit for the business and his primary customers are the general public. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy stock of materials for repairing shoes. His business goal is to be successful within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy stock of materials for repairing shoes.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Hello World! Meet Leonard, a farmer living in the Siongiroi area of South Rift Kenya with his wife and 5 children, all of whom are of school-going age. He loves and enjoys farming and has been doing it for the past 8 years where he has dairy cows, poultry, and a variety of mixed vegetation. He earns his income out of farming and his hobby is milking his dairy cows. His biggest challenge is milk prices are quite low.

Leonard wants to borrow a Kiva loan to construct a dairy unit which will enable his dairy cows to have a good environment where they can feed well and thus produce more milk. The increase in income will help him pay his children’s school fees. He also will expand his farm.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Ella

texts.en: Ella lives with her son in Ghursali village of the Lori region. For more than 10 years, Ella has been involved in cattle breeding, aviculture, breeding sheep, beekeeping, and the cultivation of potatoes. She sells the agricultural products in the local market. As it becomes harder to earn a living with time, Ella wants to expand her agribusiness in order to more effectively meet the daily costs of the family. A loan of USD 1,500 will be a great support to this hardworking woman and her son, enabling her to purchase 100 chickens and forage for the livestock (barley). Ella and her son rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: to pay for 100 chickens and forage for the livestock (barley).

loans.name: Saruon's Group

texts.en: Saruon, a villager from the Srey Snom district of the Siem Reap province, is a 48-year-old mother of seven children. Nowadays, only one child still counts on her as this child is in school. To cope with the family’s hardship, she grows rice on five hectares of farmland and cassava on two hectares of farmland as the main source income. She has been involved in the current business for ages and it generates about 40,000 KHR per day. Saruon and her group consisting of four borrowers are seeking their first loan in order to pay for plowing for her cassava farm. She highly hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to pay for plowing for her cassava farm.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Norman Otoniel

texts.es:
Norman es un pequeño productor que vive en su pequeña finca de 7.4 hectáreas, de las cuales 4.6 hectáreas son destinadas a la producción de café. Cuenta con más de 40 años de experiencia en este rubro Su finca se ubica al norte de Nicaragua, donde existen condiciones edafo-climáticas adecuadas para este tipo de cultivo.

En los últimos dos ciclos, los rendimiento de café obtenidos por este pequeño productor han disminuido debido a la Roya, que es una plaga que afectó el 60% de su cafetal, para lo cual se ha propuesto implementar un plan de renovación de manera gradual. Para este ciclo, Norman está solicitando un crédito que le permita garantizar el adecuado mantenimiento a su cafetal, mediante la compra y aplicación de insumos que le ayuden a recuperar la productividad de su plantación de café.

El sueño de este pequeño emprendedor que se caracteriza por ser muy responsable con sus obligaciones, es garantizar a su familia mejores condiciones que las que él tuvo, por eso se esfuerza cada día para incrementar su producción y con ello los ingresos de los cuales depende su familia.
texts.en:
Norman is a small coffee producer who lives on his small plantation of 7.4 hectares, 4.6 hectares of which are dedicated to coffee production. Norman has more than 40 years of experience in this field. His plantation is located in the northern part of Nicaragua where there are climate conditions suited to this type of farming.

In the last two growing cycles, this small producer has had diminished coffee outputs due to la Roya, which is a plague that affected 60 percent of his coffee crops. Because of this, he has proposed implementing a gradual renovation plan. For this growing cycle, Norman is requesting a loan that will allow him to guarantee sufficient maintenance of his plantation, through the purchase and use of supplies that will help him recuperate productivity on his coffee plantation.

This small-businessman is characterized as being very responsible with his obligations. His dream is to give his family better conditions than what he had. For this, he works every day to grow his production and, thereby, the income that his family depends on.

loans.use: with the purchase and use of supplies for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza, tiene 36 años y es madre de 4 hijos. Junto a su esposo e hijos mayores, se dedican a la caficultura como medio de ingresos económicos para su familia. Maritza lleva 6 años desempeñando esta labor y ha logrado aumentar hasta en un 50% la producción de su pequeña finca; esto gracias al buen manejo nutricional que ha brindado a su plantación.

Maritza logra beneficiar a 3 familias de su comunidad, dando trabajo a 14 obreros en tiempo de cosecha. De esta forma no solo brinda estabilidad económica en su hogar, sino que, comparte de su esfuerzo con coterráneos.

Para seguir manteniendo este rubro, ella ha decidido mejorar continuamente la nutrición de sus plantas, esto a través de la solicitud de crédito para la compra de los fertilizantes y abonos recomendados por los técnicos que le brindan asistencia.
texts.en:
Maritza is 36 and is the mother of 4 children. Along with her husband and older children, they work growing coffee as a means of economic income for the family. Maritza has been performing this labor for 6 years and she has achieved increasing up to 50% of the production of her small plot. This thanks to the good nutritional management that she's given to her plants.

Maritza achieves benefitting 3 families of her community, giving work to 14 laborers at harvest time. In this manner, she not only brings economic stability in her home, but also shares her effort with her fellow citizens.

To continue maintaining this activity, she has decided to improve the nutrition of her plants continually. This through the loan request for the purchase of the chemical and organic fertilizers recommended by the technicians that give her assistance.

loans.use: to buy chemical and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Lerb's Group

texts.en: Lerb is a villager from Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district. She is a mother of three schoolchildren and a local farmer who grows rice and cassava as her main source of income. She is able to generate about 37,000 KHR per day from the current business that she has had for ages. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is a second time borrower requesting  1,200,000 KHR. Her co-borrowers are first-time borrowers applying for 500,000 KHR each. Lerb's past loan, which she has fully repaid, has enabled her to earn a decent income to buy decent food her family. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing and to buy fertilizer for her crop. She highly believes that she can gain a better yield than last year with a good income.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and to buy fertilizer.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Chenda's Group

texts.en:
Chenda, 57, is married with seven children, three who are all still in school. Her family lives in a house with a thatch roof, located in Battambang province’s Kam Rieng district.  The main source of her family’s income is growing oranges. To supplement the income, her husband also works for others for a fee. She and her husband have been running her business for 19 years.

Chenda has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili is a 27-year-old married woman from the small village of Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri. She attended school until the seventh grade. She is a housewife, and her husband Bulu, aged 37 years, works in agriculture. They have two school-going children who are in grade 4 and grade 2 respectively. They all live together in their own small house. Consequently, the whole family depends on Lily's husband's income.

Her husband works as a farmer, and he has been doing this for five years. He makes a living for the family working in the field. He has a small plot of farmland, and he cultivates mainly seasonable vegetables such as tomatoes, cabbage, cauliflower, carrots, etc. He is the only source of income for the family, but it is very much difficult to bear all the household expenses of a four-member family with his income. So, Lili and her husband have decided to cultivate jute, which is a profitable crop.

Lili is a tenacious woman, and she is ready to give her best effort for the betterment of her family. She has taken an economic support from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy agricultural supports, such as good-quality jute seeds, fertilizers, etc., to start cultivation. Her long-term goal is to go ahead with this jute cultivation so that when it is harvested it is in abundance.

As a mother, she wishes to strengthen her children's patrimony and support them in their goals, studies and the other necessities, that they may be successful and get ahead. In addition to this, she dreams to construct a better house for them to live in.

She thanks BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating jute.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Yan, 54, lives with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Bovel district, Cambodia. Two of her four children are still in school. To feed the family, Phoeun and her husband earn a living as farmers who have been farming rice for 18 years, earning about 55,000 KHR per day to spend for the family’s needs. 

Yan is just with VisionFund for this cycle. She is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Ruma

texts.en:
Ruma is a 32-year-old woman. She lives with her husband, Anup, and their only son in a small village, Promodnagar, in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She studied up to seventh grade and could not study further because of the financial crisis of her family. Her husband is a professional cook. Their only son is too young to go to school.

Ruma's husband has no permanent income, so it is very difficult to run the family smoothly. So, Ruma has been working in animal husbandry for five years. She is a hardworking lady and has the courage to go ahead in life. She keeps faith on her own ability. She has a milk cow, and she sells milk in her neighborhood.

In order to expand her business, she wants to purchase a cow, and for that she needs money. So, she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’spartner). She will utilize the loan to purchase another cow, and she hopes to improve her milk supply business. It will provide her with a steady income to tide them over rough patches and allow them to save up for their son's future.

She wants to save money to construct a house for them to live in. She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married woman, 32 years old, and blessed with three children. Her spouse, Gilbert, adds an additional income to their family.  Susan has been operating a milk supply business for the past two years and earns a monthly income of KES 4,200. Susan was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and she is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000.  She plans to buy additional feed for her livestock, so that they may produce more to satisfy the needs of her clients.  She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand her business. She hopes to be become a famous milk vendor supplier and to build a permanent house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a fifty-four-year-old lady. She is married with five children. She sells fish and has been in this business for six years now. She earns a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings. 

This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the loan to buy more stock of fish for sale. 

She plans to use the profits to educate her children and buy her own plot.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: It is already six years that Susanna has run her store in Kapan town. She lives there with her 18-year-old daughter and retired mother. Susanna is a very enthusiastic and hardworking breadwinner for her family. Her nice attitude and care toward her customers, gives Susanna an opportunity to gain people's love and loyalty. Susanna currently applied for this loan of USD 3,000 to be able to purchase new stocks of supplies (clothing, shoes, and accessories) for the store. The loan will be a big support for Susanna, as she will be able to meet customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy new stocks of supplies like clothing, shoes, and accessories, for the store.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be trustworthy. He operates a retail business where he sells bread, drinks, cooking fat, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a business friendly area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of sufficient working capital. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, bread, sugar and other items to sell. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, bread, sugar and other items to sell

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simion is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be trustworthy. 

He operates a retail business where he sells bread, drinks, cooking fat, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a business-friendly area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient working capital. 

He will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, bread, sugar and other items he sells. 

His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, bread, sugar and other items he sells.

loans.name: Mzevinar

texts.en:
Mzevinar, who is a 56-year-old married woman, lives in the village of Lelashkha in Gadrabani district. She has son and daughter-in-law, who is a student. Her son is in the military and has a fixed salary. 

Mzevinar takes care of her own vineyard, produces wine and sells it locally. However, her activity isn't stable, as she has only seasonal income. Mzevinar wants to start more stable work and somehow increase her productivity. 

She decided to be involved in a trading business; particularly, she will purchase stock of home products at wholesale prices and will sell them in her community in increased prices. This business will be lucrative, she thinks, as she will get private orders and have her own customers. 

Mzevinar is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure her family has a good style of living. This credit will be a great support for the family. Mzevinar is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to increase her income.

loans.use: to start a trading business with home products.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma lives in Meghri. She lives there with her husband, who is a doctor in a local clinic. Emma has been running a farm for many years. She currently keeps a cow, calf and five chickens, as well as growing peach, apricot, plum, nut, apple and pear trees. She realizes the gathered harvest in the local market, and that is an important source of income for the family. 

To continue running her farming business in a sustainable way, Emma needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase a cow, calf and forage for the livestock. Emma and her husband will be grateful to the lenders for their help in collecting the needed loan amount.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, calf and forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Hugo Gonzalo

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos un Cantón hermoso, muchos turistas Nacionales y extranjeros visitan este Cantón por su maravillosas cascadas una de ella es la cascada del amor a la cual hoy en día se puede llegar muy rápido por el teleférico que está construido junto a esta cascada, aledaños a este Cantón existen varios recintos uno de ellos es el recinto rio macas en el mismo vive y tiene el negocio el señor Hugo un hombre luchador de 39 años es soltero padre de 3 hijos el mayor de ellos tiene 17 años y el ultimo 13 ellos están estudiando en el colegio del Cantón san miguel de los Bancos, Don Hugo se dedica a la producción de cerdos gracias a este negocio y a el trabajo que tiene en una finca del sector está saliendo adelante junto con sus hijos ayudando a que ellos se preparen y puedan ser profesionales, entre el empleo y negocio trabaja un promedio de 10 horas diarias durante este tiempo recibe la ayuda de sus hijos en las mañanas antes de Salir a estudiar 
Del negocio de los cerdos aprendió en su niñez junto con los papas, solicita este crédito para arreglar y ampliar las chancheras para incrementar la producción, con esta nueva inversión mejoraran sus ingresos económicos y podrá seguir ayudando a sus hijos a prepararse, el señor Hugo agradece a Fundación Alternativa y  Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos is a beautiful area; many local and international tourists visit the region for its marvelous waterfalls. One of these is the waterfall of love which you can get to very quickly now because of the cable railway that was built alongside it. Neighboring this region are other precincts, one of which is the Rio Macas precinct, where Hugo lives and has his business. Hugo is a fighter; he is 39 years old and the single father of three children, the oldest of whom is 17 years old, and the youngest of whom is 13. They are studying at the school in Canton San Miguel de los Bancos. Hugo farms pigs. Thanks to this business and to the work he has on a farm in the area, he is getting ahead, along with his children. He is helping them prepare themselves so they can be professionals. Between his job and his business, he works around 10 hours a day. He has help from his children in the mornings before they leave for school.

Hugo learned the pig business from his parents when he was a child. He is requesting this loan to repair and expand the pig stalls in order to increase production. With this new investment, his income will grow and he will be able to continue helping his children prepare themselves. Hugo is grateful to Kiva partner Fundacion Alternativa and to Kiva for the support and the provided opportunities.

loans.use: to repair and expand the pig stalls.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, es un pequeño productor que tiene una pequeña finca en el norte de Nicaragua, con una extensión con cafetos de 2.33 Hectáreas. Junto a su esposa, han emprendido la caficultura desde hace 30 años, aumentando en los últimos tres ciclos hasta en un 65% su rendimiento de café; y esto lo ha logrado gracias al buen manejo que provee a sus cafetos, lo que le ha valido para la obtención de la certificación Comercio Justo. 

Pedro es un ejemplo tanto para sus hijos como en su comunidad; posee cualidades que lo ayudan a ser líder en la comunidad. Provee 2 empleos de manera periódica y 15 temporales durante la época de cosecha de café. 

Para el nuevo ciclo 2014-2015, él está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas que le ayuden a mantener la cantidad y calidad de su café, a fin de contribuir al bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is a farmer who has a small, 2.33-hectare coffee plantation in northern Nicaragua. He and his wife have been in the coffee-growing industry for 30 years, and they have increased their yield up to 65% in the last three cycles. He has earned a Fair Trade certification thanks to the good management he gives to his coffee trees.

Pedro is an example for his children and community; he possesses qualities that help him be a leader in the community. He employes two regular workers and fifteen temporary workers during the coffee harvest season.

For the new 2014-2015 cycle, he is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies to help maintain the quantity and quality of his coffee, and to contribute to the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods for her business.

loans.name: Patricia Dolores

texts.es:
Patricia tiene 36 años, vive en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua. Desde pequeña ha estado vinculada a las actividades agrícolas. Estudio hasta secundaria y luego se casó y ahora tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 14 años. Desde joven ha sido bien trabajadora, inició como obrera en plantaciones de tabaco, y luego se dedicó a manejar la finca que le heredó su padre, en la cual además de café cultiva musáceas y hortalizas para el auto consumo de su familia.

Esta pequeña emprendedora ha venido haciendo frente a los problemas de plagas y enfermedades que han afectado su cafetal, en particular la Roya. Para este ciclo, ella está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar y aplicar los fertilizantes que requiere su plantación de café, a fin de mejorar los rendimientos de este rubro y con ello los ingresos para su familia.

El sueño de esta mujer es que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro y no tengan que ser obreros como fue ella inicialmente, para ello se esfuerza cada día para darle mejores oportunidades a sus hijos, y que puedan estudiar y aplicar su conocimiento en el negocio de la familia.
texts.en:
Patricia is 36. She lives in a rural community in the north of Nicaragua. Since she was young, she has been linked to agricultural activities. She studied until secondary school and later she married; now she has 2 children ages 4 and 14. Since she was young, she has been a good worker. She started as a laborer on tobacco plantations. Later, she worked managing the land that her father left her, where in addition to coffee, she grows bananas and vegetables to be consumed by her family.

This small entrepreneur has confronted problems of pests and disease that have affected her coffee farm, particularly coffee rust. For this loan cycle, she is applying for a loan that will let her buy and apply the fertilizers that her coffee plants require. The goal is to improve the yield of this activity and, in turn, the income for her family.

This woman's dream is that her children have a better future and don't have to be laborers like she was initially. Therefore, she pushes herself every day to give the best opportunities to her children, so that they can study and apply their knowledge to the family business.

loans.use: to buy and apply fertilizers that her coffee plants demand.

loans.name: Nilima

texts.en:
Nilima is 43 years old.  She hails from the remote village of Baroghoria in Jalpaiguri district.  She lives there with her husband Aswini and two children who are students.  One is in college and the other is in 12th grade. Nilima and her husband both are illiterate and can only sign their names. They did not even get a primary education because of their parents' poor economic resources.

Nilima's husband has been farming land for many years.  With lots of dedication, he grows different vegetables and fruits like potatoes, chilies, eggplant, gourds, cucumbers, and watermelon on his farmland, which allows him to support his household every day. He is characterized as being a hardworking, honorable and honest man. Together with Nilima, he works hard to move their family forward and give them better conditions than what they have had.  They want to go ahead with their business by cultivating jute, which is a profitable crop and in much demand.

With many dreams of improvements to their business, Nilima came to BJS (Kiva's partner) to request a loan for the purchase of necessary farming supplies like seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for sowing the crop. She wants to start cultivation very soon as the rainy season is the best time for the crop. She believes that this way, she will achieve having an abundant harvest, which will permit her to have a better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating jute.

loans.name: Rajina

texts.en:
Rajina is a cheerful and hardworking 28-year-old woman. She is married and has three children (two sons and one daughter). She studied up to grade 10.  It was not possible for her to go for higher studies due to her family's financial difficulties. Her husband Gafur has a secondary education.  They live in Molaigram in Jalpaiguri district.  All their children are students in different classes in primary schools.

Rajina's husband is associated with a small business of buying and selling wood. He buys timber from his own village and neighboring villages and sells it to the local carpenters. His earnings are hardly sufficient to cover all the expenses of such a big family. So, to assist her husband financially, Rajina is involved in a sewing and needlework business.  She learned the business from her mother.  Currently, this knowledge helps her to have a normal income for food and other household expenses.  She sews women's clothing.  She earns a good income for the family.

She would like to purchase a more modern sewing machine, which will work better and stitch higher quality clothing.  So she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She hopes for a better result and she dreams of having her own tailoring shop in the future in the market, where she can employ more women like her.

She is grateful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for her  tailoring business.

loans.name: Majd Baysour Group

texts.en:
Sanaa is the featured borrower of Majd Baysour Group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because the group members have always been neighbors and friends. 

Sanaa is a 50-year-old married mother of two who has been working in souvenir sales for six years to help her husband cover their family's living expenses. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to develop her business through increasing her business merchandise with newly released souvenir and accessories items. This will attract customers' attention and increase her income. She is working hard to stay capable of developing her business in a well-managed way to make sure that she can cover her child's education expenses.

Sanaa is the lady standing at the right side of the picture. As for the other group members, Mountaha is the lady with a red top at the left side of the picture, while Roweida is the lady at the center.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with newly released souvenir and accessories items.

loans.name: Qristine

texts.en: Qristine lives in Kapan with her husband and three children, two girls and son. Together with her husband, Qristine opened a small store last year. She trades with different home supplies and due to her hard work the store has a big number of loyal customers. As life is getting more expensive day by day, Qristine needs to expand the stocks, which are offered to customers, in order to stay competitive in the market. The requested loan of USD 3,000 will greatly help her to buy new stock of supplies for her store. Please help this hardworking family to continue developing their small family business.

loans.use: to pay for new stocks of supplies for their store.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en: Marieta lives with her husband and two sons in Sarigyugh village of Tavush region. The whole family is engaged in farming. They keep a livestock (sheep, chickens) and cultivate land (wheat, corn, haricot and potatoes). Marieta and her family live in their relative's house, as they have no home of their own yet. On the nearby land, they have already started to build their own home, and plan to greet their own home at the end of the year. So, in order to accomplish their goals, Marieta and her family work hard. They ask  for this loan of USD 2,600 to be able to purchase a truck for gathering the harvest and transporting it to the market. The loan will be a big support for the family and will make their farming work more effective.

loans.use: to purchase a truck for gathering the harvest and transporting it to the market.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23-year-old single man, who quit school at the primary stage. Two years ago he established a small coffee shop, where he serves his delicious-flavored coffee to the neighborhood and to tourists passing by. He has worked in auto body repair in the past, but he decided to follow his passion for coffee. This pushed him to learn this profession from a friend in the same field.

Ali has successfully repaid three loans from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, to the benefit of his family. Now, he has acquired a new YOUTH loan. He will use part of it to settle the legal fees of registering his car, so it can provide him with the transport he needs to expand his business further. Another part of the loan, he will use to buy the supplies that he needs, for his business development. He dreams of making more progress in his business, which would enable him to improve his family's livelihood.

loans.use: To settle the legal fees of registering his car for business use, and to buy supplies for his coffee business

loans.name: Yadis Judith

texts.es:
Yadis es una mujer de familia trabajadora y emprendedora, desde siempre ha estado en busca de un buen futuro para su familia.
Ella se dedica al negocio de cría y venta de cerdos en un chiquero que tiene ubicado a un lado de su casa. Esta actividad la aprendió desde muy niña trabajando al lado de su padre.
Hoy en día desea tener un negocio más consolidado y con más fuerza, por eso pide una ayuda para comprar algunos cerdos para capitalizar su actividad y además desea comprar alimento y concentrados para el sostenimiento de los mismos.
Este crédito impactara favorablemente su entorno familiar ya que podrá brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yadis is a hard-working and enterprising family woman who has always sought a good future for her family. She has a business raising and selling pigs in a pigsty located beside her home. She learned this work at a young age at her father's side.

Today she wishes to have a more consolidated and stronger business, so she is asking for help for a loan to buy some pigs to leverage her business and in addition to buy food and supplements to feed them. This loan will favorably impact her family's situation as she will be able to provide a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise, food and supplements for her business.

loans.name: Eladia Claudina

texts.es:
La señora Eladia es una mujer muy trabajadora, casada, con 6 maravillosos hijos por quienes ha luchado incansablemente para sacarlos adelante y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.
Esta mujer emprendedora vive en el Distrito de Quilmana junto a su familia.
Desde hace 3 años trabaja como comerciante, se dedica a la venta de comida con el cual tiene ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares. 
La señora Eladia está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que con el apoyo brindado ella podrá implementar su negocio, de esta manera ganará mayor número de clientes y podrá llegar a cumplir su más grande sueño: “Tener su restaurante ”.
texts.en:
Eladia is a hard-working, married woman with 6 marvelous children for whom she has fought tirelessly to help them be successful and offer them a better quality of life. She is an enterprising woman who lives in the Quilmana district with her family. She has worked as a vendor for 3 years selling food. With the income she pays her family's expenses.

Eladia is thankful to the Kiva lenders because with their provided support she will be able to implement her business and in this way she will gain a greater number of customers and be able to achieve her largest dream: to have a restaurant.

loans.use: to implement a food business.

loans.name: Corinza Aracely

texts.es: Corinza, tiene 42 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene dos hijos, vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella trabajó por varios años en una escuela vendiendo comida y hace 6 meses decidió poner su propio negocio de venta de frutas como mangos, sandia, bananos, ciruela, naranjas y otras de temporada.  El negocio lo tiene al frente de su casa. Ha solicitado el cuarto ciclo de préstamo que es por 8,000 Lempiras con el propósito de surtir más con frutas de temporada  y variada para ofrecer mejor servicio al cliente. Su plan es crecer con este negocio y volver a poner la venta de comida y mercadería.
texts.en:
Corinza is 42 years old, lives in a civil union with her husband, has 2 children, and lives in Choloma, Cortes. She worked for a few years in a school selling food and 6 months ago she decided to open her own business selling fruit such as mangos, watermelon, bananas, plums, oranges and other seasonal fruit. Her business is located in front of her home.

She has asked for a 4th loan cycle of 8000 Lempiras with which she will stock her business with a varieties of seasonal fruit in order to offer improved service to her customers. Her plan is to grow her business and eventually sell food and merchandise.

loans.use: to stock her business with fresh seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a single woman; she has two children. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows, which produce milk to sell. She also grows maize and beans. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

Her business is located in a favorable location, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor weather and fluctuation of prices. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. 

The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Tupendane C Group

texts.en:
Hamisa is aged 30 and has got three children, two in school and one still a baby. She is married and supports her family by running a business selling sarongs and Muslim types of dresses. She has run the business for two years. Hamisa starts working from 10am to 1pm per working day and is able to make a fair profit each month. Hamisa's capital is not enough to support her customers' demand. She believes that Kiva will support her project to grow her business and maximize her income. 

This is her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy sarongs and Muslim types of dresses to resell. She dreams that one day she will be able to open another successful project. Hamisa will share this loan with her loan group "Tupendane C" which totals two members who will be accountable to repay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sarongs and Muslim types of dresses to resell.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: Ana tiene 25 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su  compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 9 años y 6 años de edad. Ana se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo desde hace 6 años. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar y junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía de su hogar. Ana desea construir un poso de absorción para el tratamiento de aguas grises por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra del material necesario (arena, ladrillo, cemento, grava, etc.) para la construcción de la fosa.
texts.en:
Ana is 25 years old and lives in her own house with her life companion and her two children, who are 9 and 6 years old. For the past 6 years, Ana has been selling beauty products by catalog. In this way, she makes a living and provides the daily sustenance for her household. Together she and her life companion maintain the household economy.

Ana wishes to build an absorption pit for the treatment of greywater. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of the materials necessary (sand, brick, cement, gravel, etc.) to built the pit.

loans.use: to buy sand, brick, cement, gravel, etc. to build an absorption pit.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Mary es una mujer trabajadora y muy dedicada, desde siempre ha estado en busca de un buen futuro para ella y sus tres hijos.
Ella se dedica al negocio de cría y venta de cerdos en un chiquero que tiene ubicado a un lado de su casa. Esta actividad la aprendió desde muy niña trabajando al lado de su padre y es una de las principales fuentes de trabajo de la región.
Hoy en día desea tener un negocio más sólido y con más impulso, por eso pide un crédito para comprar algunos cerdos de cría y levante para capitalizar su actividad y además realizar algunas mejoras locativas a su chiquero. De este modo tendrá la oportunidad de formar una unidad productiva sostenible y obtendrá los ingresos necesarios para la manutención de su familia.
Su principal desafío es la competencia tan fuerte que hay en el sector.
Este crédito impactara favorablemente su entorno familiar ya que podrá brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mary is a hard-working and dedicated woman. She has always sought a good future for herself and her three children. She has a business raising and selling pigs in a pigsty located beside her house. She learned how to raise pigs as a young girl working at her father's side, and it is one of the main types of work in the region.

Today she wants to have her business be more solid and with more growth potential, so she is asking for a loan to buy some pigs to raise to capitalize upon her business and in addition make some improvements to her pigsty. In this way she will have the opportunity to form a sustainable productive business and obtain the necessary income to support her family. Her primary goal is to be a strong competitor in this business sector. This loan will impact favorably on her family and she will be able to provide them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and make improvements to her pigsty.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Es una persona amable, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 38 años de edad, casada, tiene 1 hijo, en edad escolar. Su esposo trabaja en el mar de marinero. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 3 años estableció su pequeño negocio, en una pequeña vivienda de tambo de madera que alquila, pagando una mensualidad de C$ 600 (Seis cientos córdobas), inicio con capital propio y con el primer financiamiento que le otorgó PANA PANA, en la modalidad de grupo solidario.  Con el objetivo de incrementar su inventario de mercadería y construir su propia vivienda, solicita su primer financiamiento, en la modalidad de créditos individual, para comprar materiales de construcción: zinc, clavos, madera rustica y madera cepillada. Su sueño es tener una vivienda que le brinde las condiciones y comodidades a su familia y trasladar su negocio a su propia vivienda en espacio más amplio.
texts.en: Luz is a friendly woman, originally from Puerto Cabezas. She is 38 years old, married, and has 1 school-age child. Her husband works as a fisherman. With the goal of generating her own income, 3 years ago she established a small business in a rented thatch hut for which she pays C%600 per month. She began with her own money and the first financing she received from PANA PANA was in a group loan.  With the goal of increasing her merchandise inventory and constructing her own home, she is seeking her first individual financing. She will buy construction materials such as zinc, nails, and wood. Her dream is to have a home that provides comfortable living conditions for her family and to move her business to her own home in a bigger space.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of merchandise and construct her own home.

loans.name: Milan

texts.en:
Milan is 45 years old. She is from a remote region in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She is married to Ratilal who is a 50-year-old farmer.  They have only one son who is in college.  Milan and her husband are uneducated and can only sign their names.  They live in their own kachha house (made of mud, straw and bamboo).

Her husband is a farmer and she is a housewife. She helps her husband in his agricultural activities after managing her household work. They have been growing vegetables, mainly potatoes, for a long time.  Her husband was the one who taught her this business activity. The family income depends on this agribusiness. They have had to face lots of problems due to poverty; however, this did not stop them from continuing to struggle to get ahead. The land that they work is their own. In order to expand their business, they want to cultivate chilies on their farmland.

Milan has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. She wants to cultivate the crop as soon as possible because this is the season for growing this crop.

Her plans for the future are to give a higher education to her son, upgrade their financial condition and save money to build a better house to live in.

She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating chilies.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is a 44-year-old housekeeper, from the village Skra. She has a disabled husband, who gets monthly assistance from the local government. She also has a widowed daughter, who takes care of three children alone. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, as this 6-member family has no source of significant income. Khatuna requested a loan and was approved through the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, which enables rural poor people to start or re-start businesses. Khatuna plans to start a trading business with clothing. She will purchase stocks of clothing in another district and will sell locally in her community for increased prices. 

It is obvious that the job is hard for Khatuna, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased. Regards to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to start a trading business with clothing.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 29-year-old divorced mother of two children enrolled in private school. She was left by her husband and now looks after and provides all the basic needs for her two children. Maryam is a beauty specialist with ten years of experience in this domain. Four years ago she started her own home business. She had worked in a paper products factory in the past, but since she got married she decided to explore her beautician skills in a more desirable profession. Her business' development has been smooth and she hasn't faced any difficulties yet.
 
Maryam acquired a YOUTH loan for the first time from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to settle some of her expenses. She intends to buy more equipment for her home salon, and to take her family on a vacation for which she's been working so hard. The remaining money will help her to pay the maintenance fees for her car. In the future she hopes to establish her own salon so she can earn even more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more equipment for her home salon, and to take her family on a vacation for which she's been working so hard.

loans.name: Pamba Group

texts.en:
Agness is mother of three children. Two of her children are in school and one is still young.  She is 30 years old and married. She has supported her family by running a charcoal store and a genge, selling fruits and vegetables for three years now. She runs her business from 8 am to 6 pm daily and makes a small profit each month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her fifth loan request. She will use the loan to build a charcoal store and replenish it with more sacks of charcoal to resell. With her previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, Agness bought more fruits and vegetables to serve more people. She believes that through Kiva's support, her business will grow and raise her income very much. She earned a profit, which she used to buy a plot of land and cover school fees and home food expenses. Though her business profit is small, Agness sets aside a small amount for saving. She dreams of taking her children to a better school and greatly improving her family's life.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Pamba", which is made up of nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to build a charcoal store and replenish it with more sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Micaela Bastida Ii Group

texts.es: Hellen de 38 años de edad soltera  y con 2 hijos, hellen  se dedica ya hace 5 años a la venta de productos de belleza  en un pequeño  puesto todos los días, hellen   nos cuenta que ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes lo cual a generando ingresos  para cubrir los gastos de su casa,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos de belleza  y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en ampliar su negocio de productos de belleza y a la vez poder hacer compras de cosméticos para su posterior venta   y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez a hellen se encuentra sentada se le distingue por su chompa de color rojo, se despide con un abraso a Kiva y   diciéndoles que cumplirá todas su metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Hellen, 38, is single with two children. For the past 5 years, she has made a living selling beauty products from her small shop every day. Hellen tells us that that she has gained loyal customers and is earning income to cover household expenses. In the future, she would like to have a shop of her own where she can sell beauty products and earn more income.

With this loan, she will invest in increasing her beauty product business and buy cosmetics that she can sell so she will have more income. In the photo, Hellen is seated and is wearing a red sweater. She sends hugs to Kiva and says that she will meet all of her planned goals.

loans.use: to increase her business premises.

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es: Apolinar habita en el Municipio de Nueva Guinea, es Agricultor y se ha dedicado a las actividades del campo desde muy pequeño, siempre ha sido un hombre esforzado y muy responsable, se empeña  en dar lo mejor a su familia la cual esta compuesta por él, su esposa y su pequeña hija de 4 añitos, junto a su esposa quien también tiene mucha experiencia en las actividades agrícolas desean plantar tres manzanas de cacao, para esto necesitan financiamiento para la compra de herramientas como  Cierra, tijera de podar arboles, insumo agroquímico, bolsas, arena de rió, urea, entre otros insumos especiales para el cultivo de cacao.  Ambos pondrán en práctica lo aprendido por sus padres, la cual señalan como una profesión,  desea explotar su parcela plantando cultivos para así obtener mayores ingresos y brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Apolinar lives in the town of Nueva Guinea. He is a farmer and has worked in the fields since he was little. He has always been dedicated and responsible. He works to give his best to his family, which includes his wife and their four year old daughter. Together with his wife, who also has a lot of farming experience, he wants to plant 5.25 acres of cacao. To do this, they need a loan to buy tools like a saw, tree pruning scissors, agrochemical inputs, bags, river sand, urea and other inputs specific to cultivating cacao. They will both put into practice the skills that they learned from their parents. They want to use their land to grow this crop and make more money to improve their family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy inputs such as fertilizer and urea, and a nursery for cacao plantings.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es: Marcial, de 46 años de edad, toda su vida se ha dedicado a las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas heredada de sus padres quienes le enseñaron el manejo del campo, con esfuerzo propio y financiamientos ha incrementado su inventario ganadero, con la ayuda de su esposa y sus hijos que son mayores de edad han logrado sacar las cosechas agrícolas, y de esta manera obtener sus ingresos para la manutención del hogar.  Aunque son una familia muy unida y trabajadora no logran recaudar el dinero suficiente para el mantenimiento del área de cacao que tienen sembrado, por lo tanto Don Marcial solicita este crédito para comprar herramientas como tijera para podar arboles, Cierra, Machetes, insumo agroquímico, bolsas para realizar vivero y así cosechar su manzana de Cacao sin problemas.  Se esfuerza cada día para administrar sus propios recursos y contar con capital de trabajo disponible en un futuro.
texts.en: Marcial, 46, has been a farmer and cattleman all his life, a trade he inherited from his parents who taught him to manage the fields. Through his own hard work and financing, he has increased his herd of cattle. With the help of his wife and their grown children, he has been able to harvest crops and earn money to maintain their home. Even though they are a hardworking and united family, they do not have enough money to maintain the area where they have planted cacao. Because of this, Marcial asks for a loan to buy tools like tree pruning scissors, saws, machetes, chemical inputs, and bags for seedlings. This will help him harvest his cacao without problems. He works hard each day to manage his own resources and to have business capital available for the future.

loans.use: to buy inputs to care for 1.75 acres of cacao.

loans.name: Felicita Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Felicita a sus 41 de edad años se dedica a las actividades agrícolas, ella es viuda tiene 4 hijos los dos mayores ya son independiente y los dos menores en edad escolar. Ambos después de realizar sus estudios ayudan a su mamá con las actividades diarias, la pérdida de su esposo no ha sido tan fácil para ella y sus hijos, lo que ha ido superando poco a poco y luchando por sacar adelante a su familia.  Felicita tiene la necesidad de darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de cacao, lo cual es una de las fuentes de ingresos, pero para poder obtener mayores ganancia hay que invertirle, pues logró sembrar con mucho sacrificio, ella necesita comprar tijeras de podar, fertilizantes, preparar el suelo y plantar plátanos y arbustos para el establecimiento de sombra en cultivo cacao, dado que con sus ingresos no ajusta para esta inversión, por lo que solicita crédito para poder realizar su proyecto y así obtener mayores ingresos con la venta del mismo dentro de un año.  Su propósito es que sus hijos aprendan las actividades de la finca, de esta manera ellos en un futuro podrán dar el manejo adecuado y se independicen.
texts.en:
Felicita, 41, is a farmer. She is widowed and has four children, two of whom are grown and independent, and two who are still in school. The younger ones, after finishing their school work, help their mom with the daily chores. The loss of her spouse has been difficult for the family, but they have been overcoming it little by little and working to get their family ahead.

Felicita needs to do maintenance on her cacao crop, which is one of her income sources. In order to make more money, she needs to invest in it. She sacrificed a lot in order to do the planting; now she needs to buy pruning scissors, fertilizers, to prepare the soil and to plant plantains and shrubs to shade the cacao plants. She doesn't make enough money to pay for this investment herself, which is why she asks for a loan to finish this project and improve her income from the sale of the cacao within the year. Her goal is for her children to learn the activities of the farm so that they can manage it in the future and be independent.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs like fertilizers for cacao.

loans.name: Luis Gonzalo

texts.es: Luis tiene 34 años de edad, toda su vida se ha dedicado a las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas, el cual ha sido una herencia de sus antepasados, quienes le enseñaron el manejo de las actividades del campo; con sacrificio y esfuerzo ha ido creciendo en su propiedad, su esposa tiene su propio negocio el cual es una pequeña panadería con la que ayuda en los gastos del hogar y sus tres hijos se dedican a las actividades del campo como es la Ganaderia y Agricultura, siendo esta la principal fuente de ingresos para el señor Luis,quien aprovecha el suelo para producir tubérculos, maíz, y sobre todo cacao.  A pesar de ser una familia unida y trabajadora con los ingresos no logran realizar su proyección de establecer una manzana de cacao, por lo que requiere financiamiento para la compra de tijera para podar, cierra, Machetes, insumo agro químicos, bolsas, arena de rió, urea, fertilizantes entre otros insumos especiales para el cultivo de cacao.  Don Luis como hombre responsable se esfuerza cada día para darle lo mejor a sus hijos y enseñarles el trabajo de campo.
texts.en: Luis, 34, has worked as a farmer and cattleman all his life, a trade he inherited from his ancestors who taught him how to manage the fields. With sacrifice and hard work he has been able to increase his property. His wife has her own small business selling bread, which helps with the household expenses. Their three children work in the fields doing farming and cattle work. This is Luis's main source of income, and he takes advantage of the land to grow root vegetables, corn, and mostly cacao. In spite of being a hardworking and united family, their income isn't enough to establish almost two acres of cacao. He needs a loan to pay for pruning scissors, a saw, machetes, chemical inputs, bags, river sand, urea, fertilizers and other inputs specific to cacao. As a responsible man, Luis works hard every day to give his children the best and teach them to work the fields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, urea, river sand and other inputs to establish his cacao crop.

loans.name: Jameel

texts.en: Jameel is a 52-year-old man who is married and a father of six sons and one daughter. His daughter is a university student majoring in nursing. Jameel has been running his brick workshop, which was his family's only source of income, for 23 years. He started his business using one brick machine. Now he has three machines and is planning to purchase a new one because one of them needs repair. But he doesn't have enough money to do so because of the household expenses he has to pay. For that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a new brick machine for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer and stock up to start selling ice cream, her mother's business.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Don Francisco de 47 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura, su esposa es ama de casa y se dedica al cuido de su hija que está en edad escolar, su hijo mayor ya trabaja por  sí solo. Son una familia muy unida, a pesar de su esfuerzo laboral y que cuenta con su propia parcela explotando el potencial en el ramo de la Ganadería y la Agricultura, pues no logra obtener los recursos necesarios para la siembra de Cacao por lo tanto solicita financiamiento para invertirlo en compra de insumos y preparación del área para   el  proyecto de siembra de una manzana de cacao   y mejorar sus fuentes de ingresos.  Se esfuerza cada día para que su hija continúe sus estudios y brindar lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Francisco is 47 years old and works in agriculture. His wife is a homemaker and cares for his school-age daughter. His eldest son already works for himself. They are a very united family despite their hard work. He owns a plot of land that has exploited its potential due to ranching and farming. As such, it fails to obtain the necessary resources to plant cocoa. For this reason, he seeks funding to invest in the purchase of supplies and prepare the area to plant 7,000 square meters of cocoa and improve his revenue source. He strives each day so that his daughter can continue her studies and to bring the best to his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for growing cocoa.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Don Pedro es un hombre conocedor de las actividades agrícolas y Ganaderas, toda su vida se ha dedicado a esta labor en su propiedad que con esfuerzo ha adquirido. Su esposa es ama de casa y los dos hijos le ayudan en las actividades del campo.  Tiene la necesidad de darle mantenimiento a una manzana de Cacao que pretende cosechar, para ello necesita crédito para comprar Agroquímicos, como: Oxicloruro de cobre, Fertilizantes, formula 15-15-15; material de manejo como tijera de podar, sierra, y así poder  obtener una excelente cosecha.
texts.en:
Pedro is a man knowledgeable in livestock and farming. He has devoted his entire life to these activities on property that he acquired with his efforts. His wife is a housewife and their two children help him in farming activities. 

He needs to tend to a field the size of a city block in which he plans to sow cocoa. He needs a loan to buy agrochemicals, such as copper oxychloride, fertilizers, 15-15-15 formula, and to buy hand tools like pruning shears, a saw, and thereby obtain a bumper crop.

loans.use: to buy agrochemicals to grow cocoa plants

loans.name: Jesner Antonio

texts.es: Jesner, habita en el Municipio de Nueva Guinea, es un agricultor con mucha experiencia, se ha dedicado a las actividades del campo desde muy pequeño, siendo un hombre esforzado y trabajador lucha para dar lo mejor a su familia compuesta por él, su esposa y una pequeña hija de 4 añitos, junto a su esposa quien tiene mucha experiencia también en las actividades agrícolas desean plantar dos manzanas de cacao, para esta importante actividad necesitan financiamiento que les permitirá la compra de herramientas como cierra, tijera de podar arboles, insumos agro-químicos, bolsas, arena de rió, urea, entre otros insumos especiales para el establecimiento de este cultivo. Jesner desea aprovechar al máximo su área productiva y explotarla a través de la diversificación, de esta manera podrá obtener mayores ingresos que únicamente con la actividad ganadera no ha logrado.
texts.en: Jesner is a very experienced farmer who lives in the town of Nueva Guinea and has done farm work since he was very young. He's a dedicated, hard-working man who tries to provide the best for his family, which consists of himself, his wife, and his four year old daughter. He shares with his wife, who also has lots of experience with farm work, plans to set up two cacao plots and they need a loan for this important undertaking. The loan would enable them to purchase tools such as saws, pruning shears, agrochemical supplies, bags, sand, and urea among other special supplies to establish this crop. Jesner wants to fully utilize his land's productive capacity and take advantage of it through diversification, so he can obtain income higher than what he's been able to earn with raising livestock.

loans.use: To purchase supplies, tools and pruning for two cacao plots

loans.name: Melquisedec

texts.es: Melquisedec, productor, su esposa es ama de casa y le ayuda con las actividades del Negocio como es la compra  y venta de tubérculos como quequisques y yuca lo cual cierta cantidad la produce en su finca y otra cantidad la compra y revende al por mayor de esta manera obtiene sus ingresos, el cuenta con su propia unidad de trabajo donde tiene inventario ganadero, que también forman parte de sus ingresos.  Melquisedec  junto a su esposa  tiene dos hijo menores de edad que estudian la primaria, él con mucho sacrificio y financiamientos ha venido logrando su propósito de ser comerciante y ganadero;  y esta vez solicita Crédito para plantar dos manzanas de Cacao y de esta manera explotar su propiedad y mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Melquisedec is a farmer and his wife, a housewife, helps him with the business activities.  He buys and sells tubers like ‘quequisques’ and yucca.  He produces a certain amount on his farm, and he buys another amount and resells it wholesale.  This is the way that he maintains his income. 

He has his own work entity where he has an inventory of livestock.  This is also part of his income.  Melquisdec and his wife have two minor children who attend elementary school.  

With great sacrifice and loans, he has been fulfilling his intentions of being a merchant and a cattle dealer.  This time he is requesting a loan to plant two ‘manzanas’ [a manzana is a land measurement unit equivalent to 7000 square meters] of cacao.  This way he will develop his property and improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy cacao seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is from Ardenis village, where she lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband is a teacher working at a local school and her elder son is employed in the private sector: He is an operator. 

Aida herself has been involved in agriculture. She keeps a big livestock of cows, sheep, calves and chickens, as well as cultivates some grass as forage for them. The farm is big so it is very difficult for Aida alone to take care of it. She asks for this loan of USD 2000 to be able to hire workers for land cultivation, purchase fuel and make some previous credit repayments. Aida hopes for lenders' good will as her wish to make her farm more successful is very strong.

loans.use: to hire workers for cultivation, purchase fuel and make previous credit repayments.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as creative. 

She operates a salon where she offers hair dressing services. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a shortage of hair products. 

She will use the 75,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use. 

Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will start another salon. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. Previous loans were paid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 29 year old gentleman who is married.  His spouse also works and brings in additional income for their family.  They have been blessed with one child.

Joseph owns a hardware shop which has been in operation for four years, earning him a monthly income of 8,000 KES.  He is now applying for his second loan of 27,000 KES, which he plans to use to buy additional inventory for his hardware shop and maintain repeated business with his customers.

He plans are to use the anticipated profits to expand his business and provide full support to his family.  He hopes of becoming a successful business man.

loans.use: to buy addition inventory for his hardware shop, in order to meet the expectations of his customers

loans.name: Kabibi

texts.en:
Kabibi is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be friendly. She operates a grocery store where she sells fruits and vegetables. 

She describes her family challenge to be shortage of clean water. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use.
