She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Micro finance. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi is a widowed woman with six school-going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mnyazi has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past four years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over two years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase a stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
This is Mesalimu. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more items for her business. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing.

She would like to apply for a loan, to buy more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of  wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Tamari

texts.en:
Tamari is a 36-year-old married woman, from Kutaisi city. She lives with her pensioner mother and doesn't have a stable job. Sometimes Tamari is involved in a trading business, particularly when her sister, who lives abroad sends her women's underwear and Tamari sells it locally. However, the income is insignificant and isn't enough for covering daily costs.

This motivated woman wants to start her own business and that's why she requested a loan. Her application was approved for a loan of 1,300 USD, which she will use to purchase inventory to open a used clothing store. Tamari will purchase stock of clothing at wholesale prices and will serve clients herself. She will be able to generate her own income and make a better living condition for her mother. Tamari will be grateful for the help and will highly appreciate it.

loans.use: to buy inventory to open a used clothing store

loans.name: Qristine

texts.en:
Qristine is an experienced farmer, from Kapan town. She lives with her husband and 12-year-old daughter. Her husband is employed in the private sector. His salary, however, is so low that it is impossible to afford a living, based on that salary alone. With the help of her husband, Qristine is engaged in cattle breeding, aviculture and in cultivation of cherries and apples. Her husband sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is a very important source of the family's income.

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Qristine needs a loan of USD 3000. She will use this amount to purchase a cow and three calves. The loan will help the family run their agribusiness in a more productive and efficient way. Qristine has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to her hard work during the more recent times, she has been able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Qristine and her family will be thankful to all the lenders, for helping them to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and three calves

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Maha was born in 1973. She is married and is the mother of two sons and one daughter. Maha decided to assist her husband in covering their children's needs by creating another source of income. She has been running her beauty salon for one year, where she gets to use the experience she got from the courses she took. Now she is seeking a loan to expand her business by buying new tools and decorating to her salon.

loans.use: to buy new tools and decorations for her salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drink, pure water, and soap for resale

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos mayores de edad, independientes, desde hace 3 años estableció su pequeña pulpería, inicio con un pequeño crédito otorgado por PANA PANA, en la modalidad de grupo solidario con PANA PANA. Con el objetivo de incrementar su mercadería, solicita su primer financiamiento en la modalidad de crédito individual, para comprar: granos básicos, chiverías, detergentes, sopas instantáneas, papel higiénico, jugos y gaseosas, entre otros productos. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y vender ropa nueva.
texts.en: Graciela is 45 years old, a single mother of 2 children, now adults and independent. Three years ago, she established her little general store. It began with a loan granted by PANA PANA to members of its solidarity groups. With the objective of expanding her merchandise, Graciela is requesting her first financing as an individual, to purchase basic grains, snacks, detergents, instant soups, toilet paper, juices, and soft drinks, among other products. Her dream is to expand her business and begin selling new clothing.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks, detergents, instant soups, toilet paper, juices, and soft drinks among other items of merchandise.

loans.name: Nuha

texts.en:
Nuha was born in 1974. She is a married woman, and a mother of six sons and daughters. Her husband is a truck driver, and his income wasn't enough to cover his children needs. So Nuha started selling clothes and cosmetics at her house 13 years ago. Her business was their second source of income, and was profitable to them. 

Now she is seeking a loan to purchase a new collection of clothes for the upcoming season.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, pure water and sugar to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods such as coal, water, handbags etc.

loans.name: Emilly

texts.en:
Emilly is a 31-year-old, married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a retail business, where she sells drinks and potato chips. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a vibrant location, and her customers are of all types. She says her biggest business challenge is a lack of capital.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy a fridge, to store drinks. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her child to university. This is her second loan with SMEP. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for her business

loans.name: Al Farah 1 Group

texts.en:
Etidal is the featured representative of Al Farah group. She and the other group members are best friends and have come together to ask for a loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to make some much-needed life improvements.

Etidal is a 45-year-old, married mother of six. Her husband works as a herdsman and a security guard. They work hard together, to make their family more financially stable. She has diversified her fields of work in order to cover all the increasing living demands. Nine years ago she started her own home business, preparing homemade meals. This business has become a favorite of residents in the surrounding area. In addition, Etidal provides cleaning services, in the same workplace as her husband. In the past she worked in a hospital, but she decided to explore her passion of cooking in a more worthwhile profession.

Etidal is a second-time borrower from Al Majmoua. She has been approved for a new loan, after having successfully completed the previous loan, which she used for home renovations. She is using this new loan to plant a vine tree, and to buy necessary wheat to trade with. She is the woman with the long white veil, the first from the far left side. Sanaa is the second lady from the left, wearing black, and Ola is the second lady from the right, wearing eye glasses. Salwa is the first lady, on the far right side.

loans.use: To plant a vine tree, and to buy necessary wheat to trade with

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is a married man; he has one child. He describes himself to be honest. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive area, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

Shadrack will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. 

His business goal is to have many motorcycles within five years. 

This is his third loan with SMEP Micro Finance Bank. 

He will use the anticipated profits to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Hello World! This is Gilbert, a dairy farmer living in Siongiroi area of South rift Kenya with his wife and four children, all of school going age. He really enjoys farming and has been doing it for five years. He has dairy cows and tea in his farm. He loves ploughing his tea farm so that he can get more produce out of the tea farm, while his biggest challenge is pests affecting crops.

Gilbert has chosen this loan because he wants to construct a dairy unit for his dairy cows where they can feed well in a good environment. This will make them produce more milk for sale. The income he gets out of this project will help in the betterment of his children’s education.

loans.use: purchase a dairy unit.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is 22 years old. He is a university student living with his parents and four siblings. Ibrahim is majoring in Computer Information Systems, and he is in his first year. As his family is facing a financial crisis that is not helping them pay for his upcoming semester fees, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods to sell, like bitter-ball, pepper, okra, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchases more used clothes for resale

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen is a 36-year-old married woman. Her husband works at a restaurant.  

Nisreen has been helping her husband in improving their living conditions by selling clothes at her house for four years.  Now she is planning to bring in a new collection of clothes for the upcoming season as her customer requested. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchases more tie dye (Gala) clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Maria Suyapa

texts.es:
Maria Suyapa es una mujer joven muy trabajadora y luchadora de 23 años de edad, la cual esta soltera y no tiene hijos, con un grado de estudio cursando la primaria completa. Desciende de una familia humildemente económica pero muy trabajadora la cual se ha dedicado al trabajo de campo siembra y cultivo de café por muchas generaciones ya que como fuente de empleo y de ingreso económico en la comunidad y en las diferentes familias ella también decidió aprender dicha actividad la cual ejerce desde hace 5 años de forma independiente siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar en el campo a muy temprana edad. El terreno que trabaja es propio el cual le pertenece a su padre pero el trabajo que ella desarrolla y lleva a cabo los ingresos por parte de su esfuerzo son de ella igual que las ganancias generadas siendo este su medio para poder auto sostenerse y ayudar a sus padres con algunos gastos en el hogar.
Como productora de café ella ve como una problemática el incremento de los precios en los diferentes insumos a utilizar para dar asistencia a sus cultivos, las plagas como la paratrioza y la enfermedad de la roya pero sobre todo la inestabilidad de precios en el mercado sobre la compra/venta del grano ya que algunas basculas muchas veces los dueños o compradores las alteran aprovechándose de la necesidad de la venta.  Maria Suyapa necesita ser apoyada financiera mente para la compra de fertilizantes, abono 12-24-12, urea, foliares, entre otros insumos que ayudaran a poder mantener sus cultivos de café protegidos y acondicionados para esta temporada los cuales buscara un nuevo mercado para su venta y evitar tener pérdidas. Maria Suyapa tiene como meta la obtención de su propia tierra en un futuro cultivar la mayor plantación posible para que sus ingresos sean mejores al momento de la venta del grano.
texts.en:
Maria Suyapa, age 23, is a very hardworking young woman with a fighting spirit. She is single, with no children, and she has completed her primary school studies. 

She comes from a family of modest means, but a very hardworking one, that has been dedicated to coffee farming for many generations. As it is a source of income for the community and for different families, she also decided to learn this occupation, which she has been engaged in independently for 5 years, as her parents taught her to farm at a very early age. 

The land that she cultivates belongs to her father, but the work that she carries out, and the earnings that she generates through her efforts are hers. This is the way that she supports herself and helps her parents with some of the household expenses.

As a coffee producer, the problems that she faces are: price increases of the supplies that she uses for tending her crops, plagues such as paratrioza and rust disease, and above all, the instability of the market price for buying and selling coffee beans, as many times the owners or buyers tamper with the scales, taking advantage of the necessity to make a sale. 

Maria Suyapa needs financial support in order to purchase fertilizers such as 12-24-12, urea, foliar feed, and other supplies that will help her to keep her coffee crop protected and prepared for this season, when she will seek a new marketplace in which to sell her coffee, and avoid losses. Maria Suyapa's goals are to obtain her own land in the future, and to grow the best crop possible, so that she will earn more when she sells her coffee.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as 12-24-12, urea, and foliar feed, in order to tend her coffee crop.

loans.name: Deisy Argentina

texts.es:
Deisy se graduó de perito mercantil y contador público pero no ejerció la profesión. En compañía de su esposo se dedican al trabajo de campo la agricultura y de su matrimonio tienen cuatro hijos la mayor de 22 años ya se graduó y sigue estudiando en la universidad, la segunda de 17 años está en segundo de carrera estudiando magisterio, la tercera tiene 15 años está en tercero de ciclo y el varón que tiene 10 años está en quinto grado viviendo en su casa solo ella su esposo y sus hijos. En el campo se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijoles desde hace más de 5 años lo cual aprendió de su esposo. A parte de eso también se dedica a cuidar estudiantes como otra pequeña fuente de ingresos. La tierra que trabajan la han adquirido por compra propia y los desafíos encontrados es el problema de plagas ya que en este rubro la competencia no es factor de problema pues hay mucha demanda la cual está a una distancia de 4 kilómetros de su casa de habitacion a la cual se transporta en carro involucrándose únicamente ella y su esposo.
Sus planes como productora seguir ampliando sus áreas de cultivo para que sus hijos en un futuro tengan un patrimonio favorable, de las ganancias de su negocio las invertirá en el estudio de sus hijos para que sean mejores personas en la vida. Ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos como: abono, urea, gramoxone, estelar y el pago de mano de obra para poder asistir sus cultivos ya que con este préstamo mejorara la producción de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Deisy graduated as a commercial expert and public accountant but does not practice the profession. Together she and her husband make a living in agriculture working in the field. From their marriage they have four children. The oldest is 22 years old. She has graduated and continues to study in the university. The second is 17 years old. She is on her second degree studying teaching. The third is 15 years old. She is in the third phase of her studies. The male, who is 10 years old, is in fifth grade. Only Deisy, her husband, and their children live at home.

In the field, she has been planting corn and beans for over 5 years, which she learned from her husband. Other than this, she also looks after students, which is another small source of income. They have acquired the land that they work through their own purchase. The challenge that they encounter is plagues now that in this area competition is not a problem since there is a high demand. The land is at a distance of 4 kilometers from their house. She and her husband commute by car.

Her plan as producer is to continue expanding her cultivation area so that her children have a favorable inheritance in the future. She will invest the earnings from her business into her children's education so that they become better people in life. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and supplies such as compost, urea, Gramoxone, and Estelar and to pay for the manual labor to help her corn crops. With this loan she will improve the production of her crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her corn crops.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à FATIA un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le mil  avec madame KADIATOU assise au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  73 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The six members of the BENKADI 3 group are married women who are, on average, 38 years old with three children each.  Most of them live in traditional families in Fatia, a village located in the Sikasso Cercle (third administrative region of Mali).

They work with Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.  They are on their seventh farming loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Kadiatou, a member of the group, grows millet.  In the photo, she is the woman in the middle of the front row.  She is planning to use her loan to buy one 50-kilo bag of fertilizers, one can of herbicide, and to cover the plowing costs to maintain 0.5 hectare of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production in her village and in Sikasso.  Her customers are both men and women and they pay her in cash and on credit.  Kadiatou is expecting to make an average profit of 73,000 CFA francs per farming season.  This profit will allow her to repay her loan and the interest, and also to help her husband with the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, farm inputs, and to pay for the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe es un hombre de 39 años, padre de 4 niños, a los que ha logrado educar y criar con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Desde hace más de 12 años, se dedica a la producción de café, el cual maneja bajo los procesos de certificación de Comercio Justo, C.A.F.E. Practices y UTZ.

Además de dedicarse a la caficultura, junto a su esposa posee una pequeña venta (pulpería) donde ofrece productos básicos a un precio accesible para la comunidad, ya que debido a su ubicación, para los habitantes es difícil trasladarse a la ciudad más cercana por las distancias y los medios de transporte limitados que existen en la zona.

Para este ciclo de café, Guadalupe requiere un financiamiento para mejorar la nutrición de sus cafetales, mediante la aplicación de insumos y fertilizantes que requiere su plantación, dada la afectación causada por la Roya en los últimos años.

El sueño de este emprendedor es aumentar su área de café y la productividad, a fin de tener mayores ingresos para reinvertir y darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Está seguro que con su esfuerzo y trabajo, y disponiendo de los recursos necesarios, logrará sus metas.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 39 years old, the father of 4 children, whom he has succeeded in raising and educating with much effort and work. For more than 12 years, he has worked in coffee production, which he manages under the certification processes of Comercio Justo, C.A.F.E. Practices and UTZ.

In addition to working in coffee production, he and his wife own a small grocery store where they offer basic products at an affordable price for the community. Due to the community's location, it is difficult for the residents to go to the nearest city because of the distance and the limited means of transportation available in the area.

For this coffee season, Guadalupe requires a loan to improve the nutrition of his coffee plants, through the application of chemical products and fertilizer that his plantation requires, given the effects caused by coffee rust [a fungal disease] in recent years.

This entrepreneur's dream is to increase the size and productivity of his coffee plot, so he will have a higher income to reinvest and provide a better future to his children. He is sure that with his effort and work, and having the necessary resources, he will achieve his goals.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and fertilizer for his coffee plantation

loans.name: Fenny

texts.en: Fenny is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes and clothes. She describes her family challenge to be a lack of enough water during the dry season. She will use the KES 75,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: María Ramona

texts.es:
En la Estancilla del cantón Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito La Estancia, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 67 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija mayor de edad que aun vive en su casa con su hijo. Su esposo es jubilado.
Doña María y su familia tienen un negocio familiar en  el cual trabajan todos, ellos tienen un bazar y papelería en su casa, este negocio lo tienen dese hace mas de 30 años, allí venden ropa, zapatos, perfumes, tarjetas, cosas para regalos, además de todo tipo de útiles escolares y artículos para los estudiantes, allí trabaja junto a su querido esposo que ya por la edad se tuvo que jubilar pero gracias a este negocio salen adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y útiles escolares. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque  los créditos son rápidos y a bajo interés. Sus sueños es seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
The credit group "La Estancia" meets every two weeks in the Estancilla del cantón Tosagua.

This place is known for being very dynamic, most of its inhabitants work in agriculture and animal husbandry, as it is an area with lots of vegetation.

This is where Maria lives. She is 67 years old, and is married, from this relationship has a grown-up daughter who lives at home with her son. Her husband is retired.

Doña Maria and her family have a business in which they all work, they have a bazaar and stationery shop in their home,which they've had for more than 30 years.

There they sell clothes, shoes, perfume, cards, gift items, plus all kinds of school supplies and items for students
She works alongside her beloved husband, who because of his age had to retire, but thanks to this business they are able to get ahead.

This loan is going to be used to buy clothes, shoes, perfume, jewelry, cosmetics, creams and school supplies. From the beginning Maria has enjoyed working with this credit group because the loans are fast with low interest. Her dream is to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, perfume, jewelry, cosmetics, creams and school supplies.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Doña Silvia, tiene 59 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos, vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella ha buscado generar sus propios ingresos y ha puesto un negocio para vender ropa como blusas, vestidos, pantalones, faldas etc. sandalias, medicamentos naturales, y otros. Este pequeño negocio lo tiene desde hace 8 meses y lo instaló en una galera frente a su casa. Ha invertido varios prestamos a su negocio para mantenerlo activo, actualmente solicita otro por 25,000 lempiras para surtir de mercadería como ropa, sandalias y medicamentos naturales para vender. Tiene como meta seguir creciendo con el negocio.
texts.en:
Siliva, 59, is married, has two kids and lives in the town of Choloma, Cortes. She has sought to create her own source of income and has a business where she sells clothes like blouses, dresses, pant, skirts, etc., natural medicines and other products.

She has had this small business for 8 months, which she set up in front of her house. She has invested various loans into her business to keep it open and now she is asking for another 25,000 lempiras to stock up on merchandise such as clothes, sandals and natural medicines to sell. Her goal is to continue growing her company.

loans.use: To stock up on merchandise such as clothes, sandals, and natural medicines to sell.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
Moisés es un productor de 65 años de edad, originario de una pequeña comunidad situada al norte de Nicaragua. Desde hace 20 años, con mucho esfuerzo, sudor y compromiso; trabaja como caficultor. Su finca es un modelo en su comunidad, lo cual es validado al ser parte de las certificaciones de Comercio Justo, C.A.F.E. Practices y UTZ.

Siempre ha fomentado en sus hijos el amor al trabajo y los deseos de superación, además de valores que hacen de ellos buenos ciudadanos. En su pequeña finca de 2.8 hectáreas brinda trabajo a 1 empleado permanente y 12 temporales en época de cosecha del café; con lo que ayuda a la economía de su comunidad. 

Para garantizar una buena cosecha este año, él está solicitando un financiamiento que le permita comprar los insumos que requiere su plantación de café y así mejorar su nutrición. Su meta es incrementar sus ingresos a través de este rubro que es su principal actividad económica, y con ello brindar a su familia mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Moisés is a 65 year old coffee producer.  He is from a small community situated in northern Nicaragua.  He has been working as a coffee farmer with great effort, sweat, and commitment for 20 years.  His farm is a model in his community.  It is certified as being part of Fair Trade, C.A.F.E., and UTZ.

He has always encouraged his children to have a love of work and the desire for self-improvement.  He has also encouraged values that make them good citizens.  His small farm is 2.8 hectares.  He provides work to one permanent employee and 12 seasonal employees who work during the coffee harvest.  This helps the economy of his community.

In order to guarantee a good harvest this year, he is requesting a loan to buy the supplies that he needs for his coffee crops.  This way his will improve their nutrition.  His goal is to increase his income through this line of work, which is his main financial activity.  By doing so he will provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for his coffee farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her coffee crops this season.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Фарзона молодая и еще незамужняя девушка, которой недавно исполнилось 23 года. Она родом из района Дангара и живет там с отцом, матерью, братом и тремя младшими сестрами. Отец Фарзоны радиотехник, а мать медсестра. Брат занимается услугой предоставления такси. Фарзона и ее сестры дома занимаются шитьем. Они на заказ шьют женские национальные платья. Их услуга всегда востребована. Фарзона энергичная и целеустремленная девушка. Она сейчас хочет расширить деятельность. Фарзона планирует за счет кредита купить еще одну швейную машинку и другие необходимые швейные принадлежности, чтобы принимать учениц на обучение кройки и шитья. Она надеется на успешную реализацию своих намеченных планов.
texts.en:
Farzona is a young and as yet unmarried woman who just turned 23. She was born in the Dangara region and lives there with her father, mother, brother and three younger sisters. Farzona's father is a radio mechanic and her mother is a nurse. Her brother works as a taxi driver. She and her sisters work at home sewing women's national dresses to order. Their services are always in demand.

Farzona is an energetic and purposeful woman. She now wants to expand her business and plans to use the loan amount to buy one more sewing machine and other necessary sewing accessories to bring on an apprentice to learn cutting and sewing. She hopes to be able to successfully carry out her plans.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and related tools to develop her business

loans.name: Sa'odat

texts.ru: Саъодат 56 лет. Она разведенная женщина и живет в районе Дангара с 20-летней дочерью, 23-летним сыном, невесткой, а также с сестрой и ее двумя маленькими детьми. Ее сестра занимается продажей фруктов на рынке. Сама Саъодат тоже занимается торговым бизнесом. Вот уже 10 лет как она занята в сфере купли-продажи конфет, шоколада и печенья.  Она опытная продавщица, умеющая находить подход к каждому клиенту, что очень важное качество в ее бизнесе. Саъодат обратилась за кредитом, чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара в своем магазине и таким образом получить больше дохода от бизнеса и улучшить условия быта в семье. Она надеется на этот кредит и вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Sa'odat is 56 and divorced and lives in the Dangara region with her 20-year-old daughter, her 23-year-old son and his wife, and her sister and her two small children. Her sister works selling fruit at the market. Sa'odat also works in retail - for 10 years she has been busy buying and selling candy, chocolate and cookies. She is an experienced salesperson, good at getting along with every kind of client, a skill that is very important in her business. 

Sa'odat is looking for a loan to increase the selection of goods in her shop and in this way to bring in more revenue and improve her family's standard of living. She hopes for this loan and for your support.

loans.use: to buy a selection of candy and cookies for resale

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe BENKADI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à FATIA un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le mil  avec madame NACHITAN assise à droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 4. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  73 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The five members of the BENKADI 4 group are married women who are, on average, 38 years old with two children each. Most of them live in traditional families in Fatia, a village located in the Sikasso Cercle (third administrative region of Mali).

They work with Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their seventh farming loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Nachitan, a member of the group, grows millet. In the photo, she is in the front row, on the right.  She is planning to use her loan to buy one 50-kilo bag of fertilizers, one can of herbicide, and to cover the plowing costs associated with maintaining 0.5 hectare of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production in her village and at the Sikasso markets. Her customers are both men and women and they pay her in cash and on credit. Nachitan is expecting to make an average profit of 73,000 CFA francs per farming season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and the interest, and also to help her husband with the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay for the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Los Sauces Group

texts.es: LA Sra. Julia  de 66 años de edad conviviente  y madre de 4 hijos mayores de edad,  la Sra. Julia   es una mujer muy emprendedora que gracias  a sus esfuerzos a sabido superarse, la Sra. Julia  tiene una pequeño negocio de venta de comida (mercado), el cual es su única fuente de ingresos para ella y su familia, con el apoyo de sus hijos está saliendo adelante. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar (menestras, arroz, verduras, sillas, mesas, cubiertos etc.)  Para generar ingresos  para su posterior venta y a si también poder tener más ingresos económicos. La Sra. Julia es la primera de la  mano izquierda se le distingue por su chompa de color marrón, la vez  se encuentra muy agradecida por la ayuda brindada, se despide con un fuerte abraso Kiva, sabiendo que cumplirá todas sus metas.
texts.en: Julia is 66 years old. She has a partner. She is the mother of four adult children. Julia is very enterprising woman. Due to her efforts, she has a small business selling food. This is the only source of income for herself and her family. With help from her children, she is making progress. With the awarded loan, she will invest in the purchase of vegetables, rice, seats, tables, silverware, etc. in order to generate income. Julia is the first on the left with the brown sweater. They are very thankful for the offered support and say goodbye with a strong Kiva hug, knowing that they will complete all of their goals.

loans.use: purchase grocery items.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 51 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à KOKOUNA un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame BINTOU assise au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  105 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the BENKADI 1 group are married women who are, on average, 51 years old with three children each. Most of them live in traditional families in Kokouna, a village located in the commune of Loulouni, in the Sikasso region (third administrative region of Mali).

They work with Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their ninth farming loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Bintou, a member of the group, grows groundnut. In the photo, she is in the middle of the front row.   She is planning to use her loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of fertilizers, two cans of herbicide, and to cover the plowing costs associated with maintaining 0.75 hectare of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production in her village and at the Sikasso markets. Her customers are both men and women and they pay her in cash and on credit. Bintou is expecting to make an average profit of 105,000 CFA francs per farming season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and the interest, and also to help her husband with the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 30-year-old, Lebanese, married woman. She lives with her husband and two children, both of whom are attending school. She is working hard to help her husband; both of them want to be capable to satisfy their family's needs and wants. Faten has owned a Pastry Shop in her town since 2010, and she feels happy with what she has attained so far.

Today, she’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l. She will use the loan to buy supplementary products, such as flour and sugar. These will enable her to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for pastry-making, like flour and sugar

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 27-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be loving. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy market and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a motorcycle. His business goal is to have a tuk tuk (rickshaw) within 5 years. He will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo es un joven trabajador, vive en Ica junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo.
Tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia y poder brindarles mayor comodidad.
Desde hace casi 1 año  trabaja en los campos agrícolas de un prestigioso Fundo por la zona donde reside.
Sale desde muy temprano a trabajar para poder cubrir los gastos del hogar y reunir dinero para el futuro de su hijo quien es su mayor orgullo y por quien no le importa trabajar todo el día, solo por su bienestar.
Wilfredo está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que con el apoyo brindado él podrá realizar la reparación de su vehículo para poder obtener otros ingresos por la actividad de transporte y así más adelante poder cumplir su más grande sueño: “Formar a su hijo como una buena persona y un excelente profesional”.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is a young worker. He lives in Ica with his wife and his little boy. He is very eager to move forward, to improve the quality of life of his family, and to be able to give his family greater comfort. 

For almost a year he has been working on the farmlands of a prestigious estate in the area where he lives. He leaves for work very early in order to cover household expenses and save money for the future of his child, who is his greatest source of pride and for whose wellbeing he does not mind working all day.

Wilfredo is thankful for Kiva lenders since with their support he will be able to repair his vehicle in order to have another source of income through the transportation business and that way in the future fulfill his greatest dream: "To raise his boy to be a good person and an excellent professional."

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Harbiyeh

texts.en: Harbiyeh is a 34-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and her three children who are still studying. She has been working in the agriculture sector since 2010 to help her husband, and they both cooperate together to be able to enhance their way of living. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy seeds for her business in order to improve it. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and help her children to continue their education.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tie dye (gala) for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy baby-soap, powder, baby-oil, and other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: Es una señora muy amable, madre soltera de 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 se encuentra en edad escolar y 2 menores de edad. Desde hace  12 años estableció su pequeña pulpería, inicio con capital propio, C$ 9,800 (Nueve mil ochocientos córdobas). Con el objetivo de incrementar su inventario desde hace 5 años formó parte de un grupo solidario. Solicita su primer financiamiento en la modalidad de crédito individual, para comprar mercadería: granos básicos, papel higiénico, leche en polvo, mortadela, pasta dental, salsa de tomate, material de limpieza, jugos, gaseosas, entre otros. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Estela is a very friendly woman, the single mother of four children, two of whom are school-age and two who are younger. Twelve years ago she started her small grocery store with her own capital, 9,800 córdobas.

With the goal of increasing her inventory, she joined a solidarity group five years ago. She is requesting her first loan in the individual category to purchase merchandise: basic grains, toilet paper, powdered milk, mortadella [sausage], toothpaste, tomato sauce, cleaning supplies, juice, and soda, among other items. Her dream is to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise: basic grains, toilet paper, powdered milk, mortadella, toothpaste, tomato sauce, cleaning supplies, juice, and soda, among other items

loans.name: Jacqueline Ivette

texts.es: Jacqueline tiene 34 años de edad y habita junto a su sobrina de 12 años de edad en casa familiar. Ella se dedica   a la prestación de servicios de transporte desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Jacqueline desea repellar las paredes de la vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento y arena.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 34 years old and lives along with her niece, age 12, at the family house. She has worked giving transport services for several years now. This is how she makes a living and is able to financially support her home. 

Jacqueline wants to repair the walls of the house. With the loan she is asking from FUSAI, she will buy cement and sand.

loans.use: to buy: cement and sand to repair the walls of the house.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 63-year-old, married mother of two. She has been working since four years ago at her house, selling homemade foods, such as pickles and thyme. She does this work, to help her family to meet the needs of life.

Zeinab is obtaining a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l. She will use the loan to improve her business merchandise, to give the best products to her customers. She is very certain that she will sell all products and expand her business area. She hopes that in the future, she might open her own store and attract more customers.

loans.use: to improve the homemade foods that she offers for sale, including pickles and thyme

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 20-year-old, single, Lebanese woman. She lives with her parents. Her father is their main income-provider and fulfills their needs. Fatmeh started her own home business, as a private teacher, in 2012. She looks to further improve her work.

Today, she would like to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She will use the loan to purchase a laptop, in order to enhance her teaching abilities and gain added students. In the future Fatmeh plans to open her own learning center.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop

loans.name: Maysaa

texts.en: Maysaa is a 34-year-old married mother of four children who has been working since 2010 at her house selling homemade foods to help her family to meet the needs of life and to improve their lifestyle. Maysaa is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to better her business merchandise in order to give the best product to her clients. She has a good reputation in her hometown by giving the best products to her clients. She is very certain that she will sell all products and expand her business area. She hopes that in the near future, she might open her own store.

loans.use: to better her homemade food business merchandise.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is a married woman with three children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells cosmetics and has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a vibrant area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cosmetics. Her business goal is to own a wholesale shop within five years. She also hopes that in the future, she will own a beauty spa. This is her first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: buy more stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Suyapa

texts.es: Doña Suyapa,tiene 57 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, y vive con una hija en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Hace dos años que ella se dedica a vender ropa nueva y usada, para damas, caballeros y niños, como ser blusas, faldas, short, pantalones, camisas etc. El negocio lo tiene en su casa. Ha decidido solicitar un segundo préstamo por  5,000 Lempiras para comprar un fardo de ropa de segunda y surtir con nuevos productos como vestidos, ropa de niños, jeans, camisetas y otros. Su plan es crecer mas con el negocio y en el futuro poner una tiendita de novedades y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Supaya, age 57, is a single mother.  She has four children, and she lives with a daughter in the Choloma municipality in Cortes.  She has been selling new and used clothes for women, men, and children for two years.  She sells things like blouses, skirts, shorts, pants, and shirts, etc.  The business is at her house.

She has decided to request a second loan for 5,000 lempiras to buy a bundle of second-hand clothes and to stock up on new products like dresses, children’s clothes, jeans, and t-shirts and others.  

Her plan is to grow more in the business.  In the future her plan includes setting up a gift shop and getting ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a farmer living in the Litein area of South Rift, Kenya, where he does farming, especially tea and dairy farming. This has been his main source of income for four years. His hobby in farming is feeding the cows because they will produce more milk, while his biggest challenge is difficulty in getting the animal feeds because they are very expensive.

Erick wants to construct a dairy unit in order to create a good environment for his livestock to produce more. He can’t accomplish this on his own, and that’s why he applied for this Kiva loan, which will help him. He will be able to get more income in return, which will enable him to provide more for his family.

loans.use: to pay for construction of a dairy unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coal bags.
